2915  >>> x.approx(20)
2916  6838717160008073720548335/4835703278458516698824704
2917  >>> x.approx(5)
2918  2965821/2097152
2919  """
2920  return RatNumRef(Z3_get_algebraic_number_upper(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), precision), self.ctx)
2921  def as_decimal(self, prec):
2922  """Return a string representation of the algebraic number `self` in decimal notation using `prec` decimal places
2923 
2924  >>> x = simplify(Sqrt(2))
2925  >>> x.as_decimal(10)
2926  '1.4142135623?'
2927  >>> x.as_decimal(20)
2928  '1.41421356237309504880?'
2929  """
2930  return Z3_get_numeral_decimal_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), prec)
2931 
2932  def poly(self):
2933  return AstVector(Z3_algebraic_get_poly(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
2934 
2935  def index(self):
2936  return Z3_algebraic_get_i(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
2937 
2938 def _py2expr(a, ctx=None):
2939  if isinstance(a, bool):
2940  return BoolVal(a, ctx)
2941  if _is_int(a):
2942  return IntVal(a, ctx)
2943  if isinstance(a, float):
2944  return RealVal(a, ctx)
2945  if isinstance(a, str):
2946  return StringVal(a, ctx)
2947  if is_expr(a):
2948  return a
2949  if z3_debug():
2950  _z3_assert(False, "Python bool, int, long or float expected")
2951 
2952 def IntSort(ctx=None):
2953  """Return the integer sort in the given context. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
2954 
2955  >>> IntSort()
2956  Int
2957  >>> x = Const('x', IntSort())
2958  >>> is_int(x)
2959  True
2960  >>> x.sort() == IntSort()
2961  True
2962  >>> x.sort() == BoolSort()
2963  False
2964  """
2965  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
2966  return ArithSortRef(Z3_mk_int_sort(ctx.ref()), ctx)
2967 
2968 def RealSort(ctx=None):
2969  """Return the real sort in the given context. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
2970 
2971  >>> RealSort()
2972  Real
2973  >>> x = Const('x', RealSort())
2974  >>> is_real(x)
2975  True
2976  >>> is_int(x)
2977  False
2978  >>> x.sort() == RealSort()
2979  True
2980  """
2981  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
2982  return ArithSortRef(Z3_mk_real_sort(ctx.ref()), ctx)
2983 
2984 def _to_int_str(val):
2985  if isinstance(val, float):
2986  return str(int(val))
2987  elif isinstance(val, bool):
2988  if val:
2989  return "1"
2990  else:
2991  return "0"
2992  elif _is_int(val):
2993  return str(val)
2994  elif isinstance(val, str):
2995  return val
2996  if z3_debug():
2997  _z3_assert(False, "Python value cannot be used as a Z3 integer")
2998 
2999 def IntVal(val, ctx=None):
3000  """Return a Z3 integer value. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3001 
3002  >>> IntVal(1)
3003  1
3004  >>> IntVal("100")
3005  100
3006  """
3007  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3008  return IntNumRef(Z3_mk_numeral(ctx.ref(), _to_int_str(val), IntSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
3009 
3010 def RealVal(val, ctx=None):
3011  """Return a Z3 real value.
3012 
3013  `val` may be a Python int, long, float or string representing a number in decimal or rational notation.
3014  If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3015 
3016  >>> RealVal(1)
3017  1
3018  >>> RealVal(1).sort()
3019  Real
3020  >>> RealVal("3/5")
3021  3/5
3022  >>> RealVal("1.5")
3023  3/2
3024  """
3025  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3026  return RatNumRef(Z3_mk_numeral(ctx.ref(), str(val), RealSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
3027 
3028 def RatVal(a, b, ctx=None):
3029  """Return a Z3 rational a/b.
3030 
3031  If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3032 
3033  >>> RatVal(3,5)
3034  3/5
3035  >>> RatVal(3,5).sort()
3036  Real
3037  """
3038  if z3_debug():
3039  _z3_assert(_is_int(a) or isinstance(a, str), "First argument cannot be converted into an integer")
3040  _z3_assert(_is_int(b) or isinstance(b, str), "Second argument cannot be converted into an integer")
3041  return simplify(RealVal(a, ctx)/RealVal(b, ctx))
3042 
3043 def Q(a, b, ctx=None):
3044  """Return a Z3 rational a/b.
3045 
3046  If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3047 
3048  >>> Q(3,5)
3049  3/5
3050  >>> Q(3,5).sort()
3051  Real
3052  """
3053  return simplify(RatVal(a, b))
3054 
3055 def Int(name, ctx=None):
3056  """Return an integer constant named `name`. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3057 
3058  >>> x = Int('x')
3059  >>> is_int(x)
3060  True
3061  >>> is_int(x + 1)
3062  True
3063  """
3064  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3065  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_const(ctx.ref(), to_symbol(name, ctx), IntSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
3066 
3067 def Ints(names, ctx=None):
3068  """Return a tuple of Integer constants.
3069 
3070  >>> x, y, z = Ints('x y z')
3071  >>> Sum(x, y, z)
3072  x + y + z
3073  """
3074  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3075  if isinstance(names, str):
3076  names = names.split(" ")
3077  return [Int(name, ctx) for name in names]
3078 
3079 def IntVector(prefix, sz, ctx=None):
3080  """Return a list of integer constants of size `sz`.
3081 
3082  >>> X = IntVector('x', 3)
3083  >>> X
3084  [x__0, x__1, x__2]
3085  >>> Sum(X)
3086  x__0 + x__1 + x__2
3087  """
3088  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3089  return [ Int('%s__%s' % (prefix, i), ctx) for i in range(sz) ]
3090 
3091 def FreshInt(prefix='x', ctx=None):
3092  """Return a fresh integer constant in the given context using the given prefix.
3093 
3094  >>> x = FreshInt()
3095  >>> y = FreshInt()
3096  >>> eq(x, y)
3097  False
3098  >>> x.sort()
3099  Int
3100  """
3101  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3102  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_fresh_const(ctx.ref(), prefix, IntSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
3103 
3104 def Real(name, ctx=None):
3105  """Return a real constant named `name`. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3106 
3107  >>> x = Real('x')
3108  >>> is_real(x)
3109  True
3110  >>> is_real(x + 1)
3111  True
3112  """
3113  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3114  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_const(ctx.ref(), to_symbol(name, ctx), RealSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
3115 
3116 def Reals(names, ctx=None):
3117  """Return a tuple of real constants.
3118 
3119  >>> x, y, z = Reals('x y z')
3120  >>> Sum(x, y, z)
3121  x + y + z
3122  >>> Sum(x, y, z).sort()
3123  Real
3124  """
3125  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3126  if isinstance(names, str):
3127  names = names.split(" ")
3128  return [Real(name, ctx) for name in names]
3129 
3130 def RealVector(prefix, sz, ctx=None):
3131  """Return a list of real constants of size `sz`.
3132 
3133  >>> X = RealVector('x', 3)
3134  >>> X
3135  [x__0, x__1, x__2]
3136  >>> Sum(X)
3137  x__0 + x__1 + x__2
3138  >>> Sum(X).sort()
3139  Real
3140  """
3141  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3142  return [ Real('%s__%s' % (prefix, i), ctx) for i in range(sz) ]
3143 
3144 def FreshReal(prefix='b', ctx=None):
3145  """Return a fresh real constant in the given context using the given prefix.
3146 
3147  >>> x = FreshReal()
3148  >>> y = FreshReal()
3149  >>> eq(x, y)
3150  False
3151  >>> x.sort()
3152  Real
3153  """
3154  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3155  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_fresh_const(ctx.ref(), prefix, RealSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
3156 
3157 def ToReal(a):
3158  """ Return the Z3 expression ToReal(a).
3159 
3160  >>> x = Int('x')
3161  >>> x.sort()
3162  Int
3163  >>> n = ToReal(x)
3164  >>> n
3165  ToReal(x)
3166  >>> n.sort()
3167  Real
3168  """
3169  if z3_debug():
3170  _z3_assert(a.is_int(), "Z3 integer expression expected.")
3171  ctx = a.ctx
3172  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_int2real(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
3173 
3174 def ToInt(a):
3175  """ Return the Z3 expression ToInt(a).
3176 
3177  >>> x = Real('x')
3178  >>> x.sort()
3179  Real
3180  >>> n = ToInt(x)
3181  >>> n
3182  ToInt(x)
3183  >>> n.sort()
3184  Int
3185  """
3186  if z3_debug():
3187  _z3_assert(a.is_real(), "Z3 real expression expected.")
3188  ctx = a.ctx
3189  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_real2int(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
3190 
3191 def IsInt(a):
3192  """ Return the Z3 predicate IsInt(a).
3193 
3194  >>> x = Real('x')
3195  >>> IsInt(x + "1/2")
3196  IsInt(x + 1/2)
3197  >>> solve(IsInt(x + "1/2"), x > 0, x < 1)
3198  [x = 1/2]
3199  >>> solve(IsInt(x + "1/2"), x > 0, x < 1, x != "1/2")
3200  no solution
3201  """
3202  if z3_debug():
3203  _z3_assert(a.is_real(), "Z3 real expression expected.")
3204  ctx = a.ctx
3205  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_is_int(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
3206 
3207 def Sqrt(a, ctx=None):
3208  """ Return a Z3 expression which represents the square root of a.
3209 
3210  >>> x = Real('x')
3211  >>> Sqrt(x)
3212  x**(1/2)
3213  """
3214  if not is_expr(a):
3215  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3216  a = RealVal(a, ctx)
3217  return a ** "1/2"
3218 
3219 def Cbrt(a, ctx=None):
3220  """ Return a Z3 expression which represents the cubic root of a.
3221 
3222  >>> x = Real('x')
3223  >>> Cbrt(x)
3224  x**(1/3)
3225  """
3226  if not is_expr(a):
3227  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3228  a = RealVal(a, ctx)
3229  return a ** "1/3"
3230 
3231 #########################################
3232 #
3233 # Bit-Vectors
3234 #
3235 #########################################
3236 
3237 class BitVecSortRef(SortRef):
3238  """Bit-vector sort."""
3239 
3240  def size(self):
3241  """Return the size (number of bits) of the bit-vector sort `self`.
3242 
3243  >>> b = BitVecSort(32)
3244  >>> b.size()
3245  32
3246  """
3247  return int(Z3_get_bv_sort_size(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast))
3248 
3249  def subsort(self, other):
3250  return is_bv_sort(other) and self.size() < other.size()
3251 
3252  def cast(self, val):
3253  """Try to cast `val` as a Bit-Vector.
3254 
3255  >>> b = BitVecSort(32)
3256  >>> b.cast(10)
3257  10
3258  >>> b.cast(10).sexpr()
3259  '#x0000000a'
3260  """
3261  if is_expr(val):
3262  if z3_debug():
3263  _z3_assert(self.ctx == val.ctx, "Context mismatch")
3264  # Idea: use sign_extend if sort of val is a bitvector of smaller size
3265  return val
3266  else:
3267  return BitVecVal(val, self)
3268 
3269 def is_bv_sort(s):
3270  """Return True if `s` is a Z3 bit-vector sort.
3271 
3272  >>> is_bv_sort(BitVecSort(32))
3273  True
3274  >>> is_bv_sort(IntSort())
3275  False
3276  """
3277  return isinstance(s, BitVecSortRef)
3278 
3279 class BitVecRef(ExprRef):
3280  """Bit-vector expressions."""
3281 
3282  def sort(self):
3283  """Return the sort of the bit-vector expression `self`.
3284 
3285  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3286  >>> x.sort()
3287  BitVec(32)
3288  >>> x.sort() == BitVecSort(32)
3289  True
3290  """
3291  return BitVecSortRef(Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3292 
3293  def size(self):
3294  """Return the number of bits of the bit-vector expression `self`.
3295 
3296  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3297  >>> (x + 1).size()
3298  32
3299  >>> Concat(x, x).size()
3300  64
3301  """
3302  return self.sort().size()
3303 
3304  def __add__(self, other):
3305  """Create the Z3 expression `self + other`.
3306 
3307  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3308  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3309  >>> x + y
3310  x + y
3311  >>> (x + y).sort()
3312  BitVec(32)
3313  """
3314  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3315  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvadd(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3316 
3317  def __radd__(self, other):
3318  """Create the Z3 expression `other + self`.
3319 
3320  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3321  >>> 10 + x
3322  10 + x
3323  """
3324  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3325  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvadd(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3326 
3327  def __mul__(self, other):
3328  """Create the Z3 expression `self * other`.
3329 
3330  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3331  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3332  >>> x * y
3333  x*y
3334  >>> (x * y).sort()
3335  BitVec(32)
3336  """
3337  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3338  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvmul(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3339 
3340  def __rmul__(self, other):
3341  """Create the Z3 expression `other * self`.
3342 
3343  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3344  >>> 10 * x
3345  10*x
3346  """
3347  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3348  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvmul(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3349 
3350  def __sub__(self, other):
3351  """Create the Z3 expression `self - other`.
3352 
3353  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3354  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3355  >>> x - y
3356  x - y
3357  >>> (x - y).sort()
3358  BitVec(32)
3359  """
3360  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3361  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsub(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3362 
3363  def __rsub__(self, other):
3364  """Create the Z3 expression `other - self`.
3365 
3366  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3367  >>> 10 - x
3368  10 - x
3369  """
3370  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3371  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsub(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3372 
3373  def __or__(self, other):
3374  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-or `self | other`.
3375 
3376  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3377  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3378  >>> x | y
3379  x | y
3380  >>> (x | y).sort()
3381  BitVec(32)
3382  """
3383  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3384  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvor(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3385 
3386  def __ror__(self, other):
3387  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-or `other | self`.
3388 
3389  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3390  >>> 10 | x
3391  10 | x
3392  """
3393  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3394  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvor(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3395 
3396  def __and__(self, other):
3397  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-and `self & other`.
3398 
3399  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3400  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3401  >>> x & y
3402  x & y
3403  >>> (x & y).sort()
3404  BitVec(32)
3405  """
3406  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3407  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvand(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3408 
3409  def __rand__(self, other):
3410  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-or `other & self`.
3411 
3412  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3413  >>> 10 & x
3414  10 & x
3415  """
3416  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3417  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvand(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3418 
3419  def __xor__(self, other):
3420  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-xor `self ^ other`.
3421 
3422  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3423  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3424  >>> x ^ y
3425  x ^ y
3426  >>> (x ^ y).sort()
3427  BitVec(32)
3428  """
3429  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3430  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvxor(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3431 
3432  def __rxor__(self, other):
3433  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-xor `other ^ self`.
3434 
3435  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3436  >>> 10 ^ x
3437  10 ^ x
3438  """
3439  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3440  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvxor(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3441 
3442  def __pos__(self):
3443  """Return `self`.
3444 
3445  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3446  >>> +x
3447  x
3448  """
3449  return self
3450 
3451  def __neg__(self):
3452  """Return an expression representing `-self`.
3453 
3454  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3455  >>> -x
3456  -x
3457  >>> simplify(-(-x))
3458  x
3459  """
3460  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvneg(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3461 
3462  def __invert__(self):
3463  """Create the Z3 expression bitwise-not `~self`.
3464 
3465  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3466  >>> ~x
3467  ~x
3468  >>> simplify(~(~x))
3469  x
3470  """
3471  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvnot(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3472 
3473  def __div__(self, other):
3474  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) division `self / other`.
3475 
3476  Use the function UDiv() for unsigned division.
3477 
3478  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3479  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3480  >>> x / y
3481  x/y
3482  >>> (x / y).sort()
3483  BitVec(32)
3484  >>> (x / y).sexpr()
3485  '(bvsdiv x y)'
3486  >>> UDiv(x, y).sexpr()
3487  '(bvudiv x y)'
3488  """
3489  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3490  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsdiv(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3491 
3492  def __truediv__(self, other):
3493  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) division `self / other`."""
3494  return self.__div__(other)
3495 
3496  def __rdiv__(self, other):
3497  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) division `other / self`.
3498 
3499  Use the function UDiv() for unsigned division.
3500 
3501  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3502  >>> 10 / x
3503  10/x
3504  >>> (10 / x).sexpr()
3505  '(bvsdiv #x0000000a x)'
3506  >>> UDiv(10, x).sexpr()
3507  '(bvudiv #x0000000a x)'
3508  """
3509  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3510  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsdiv(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3511 
3512  def __rtruediv__(self, other):
3513  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) division `other / self`."""
3514  return self.__rdiv__(other)
3515 
3516  def __mod__(self, other):
3517  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) mod `self % other`.
3518 
3519  Use the function URem() for unsigned remainder, and SRem() for signed remainder.
3520 
3521  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3522  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
3523  >>> x % y
3524  x%y
3525  >>> (x % y).sort()
3526  BitVec(32)
3527  >>> (x % y).sexpr()
3528  '(bvsmod x y)'
3529  >>> URem(x, y).sexpr()
3530  '(bvurem x y)'
3531  >>> SRem(x, y).sexpr()
3532  '(bvsrem x y)'
3533  """
3534  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3535  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsmod(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3536 
3537  def __rmod__(self, other):
3538  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) mod `other % self`.
3539 
3540  Use the function URem() for unsigned remainder, and SRem() for signed remainder.
3541 
3542  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3543  >>> 10 % x
3544  10%x
3545  >>> (10 % x).sexpr()
3546  '(bvsmod #x0000000a x)'
3547  >>> URem(10, x).sexpr()
3548  '(bvurem #x0000000a x)'
3549  >>> SRem(10, x).sexpr()
3550  '(bvsrem #x0000000a x)'
3551  """
3552  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3553  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsmod(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3554 
3555  def __le__(self, other):
3556  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) `other <= self`.
3557 
3558  Use the function ULE() for unsigned less than or equal to.
3559 
3560  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3561  >>> x <= y
3562  x <= y
3563  >>> (x <= y).sexpr()
3564  '(bvsle x y)'
3565  >>> ULE(x, y).sexpr()
3566  '(bvule x y)'
3567  """
3568  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3569  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvsle(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3570 
3571  def __lt__(self, other):
3572  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) `other < self`.
3573 
3574  Use the function ULT() for unsigned less than.
3575 
3576  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3577  >>> x < y
3578  x < y
3579  >>> (x < y).sexpr()
3580  '(bvslt x y)'
3581  >>> ULT(x, y).sexpr()
3582  '(bvult x y)'
3583  """
3584  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3585  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvslt(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3586 
3587  def __gt__(self, other):
3588  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) `other > self`.
3589 
3590  Use the function UGT() for unsigned greater than.
3591 
3592  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3593  >>> x > y
3594  x > y
3595  >>> (x > y).sexpr()
3596  '(bvsgt x y)'
3597  >>> UGT(x, y).sexpr()
3598  '(bvugt x y)'
3599  """
3600  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3601  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvsgt(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3602 
3603  def __ge__(self, other):
3604  """Create the Z3 expression (signed) `other >= self`.
3605 
3606  Use the function UGE() for unsigned greater than or equal to.
3607 
3608  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3609  >>> x >= y
3610  x >= y
3611  >>> (x >= y).sexpr()
3612  '(bvsge x y)'
3613  >>> UGE(x, y).sexpr()
3614  '(bvuge x y)'
3615  """
3616  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3617  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvsge(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3618 
3619  def __rshift__(self, other):
3620  """Create the Z3 expression (arithmetical) right shift `self >> other`
3621 
3622  Use the function LShR() for the right logical shift
3623 
3624  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3625  >>> x >> y
3626  x >> y
3627  >>> (x >> y).sexpr()
3628  '(bvashr x y)'
3629  >>> LShR(x, y).sexpr()
3630  '(bvlshr x y)'
3631  >>> BitVecVal(4, 3)
3632  4
3633  >>> BitVecVal(4, 3).as_signed_long()
3634  -4
3635  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(4, 3) >> 1).as_signed_long()
3636  -2
3637  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(4, 3) >> 1)
3638  6
3639  >>> simplify(LShR(BitVecVal(4, 3), 1))
3640  2
3641  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(2, 3) >> 1)
3642  1
3643  >>> simplify(LShR(BitVecVal(2, 3), 1))
3644  1
3645  """
3646  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3647  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvashr(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3648 
3649  def __lshift__(self, other):
3650  """Create the Z3 expression left shift `self << other`
3651 
3652  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3653  >>> x << y
3654  x << y
3655  >>> (x << y).sexpr()
3656  '(bvshl x y)'
3657  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(2, 3) << 1)
3658  4
3659  """
3660  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3661  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvshl(self.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3662 
3663  def __rrshift__(self, other):
3664  """Create the Z3 expression (arithmetical) right shift `other` >> `self`.
3665 
3666  Use the function LShR() for the right logical shift
3667 
3668  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3669  >>> 10 >> x
3670  10 >> x
3671  >>> (10 >> x).sexpr()
3672  '(bvashr #x0000000a x)'
3673  """
3674  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3675  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvashr(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3676 
3677  def __rlshift__(self, other):
3678  """Create the Z3 expression left shift `other << self`.
3679 
3680  Use the function LShR() for the right logical shift
3681 
3682  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
3683  >>> 10 << x
3684  10 << x
3685  >>> (10 << x).sexpr()
3686  '(bvshl #x0000000a x)'
3687  """
3688  a, b = _coerce_exprs(self, other)
3689  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvshl(self.ctx_ref(), b.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), self.ctx)
3690 
3691 class BitVecNumRef(BitVecRef):
3692  """Bit-vector values."""
3693 
3694  def as_long(self):
3695  """Return a Z3 bit-vector numeral as a Python long (bignum) numeral.
3696 
3697  >>> v = BitVecVal(0xbadc0de, 32)
3698  >>> v
3699  195936478
3700  >>> print("0x%.8x" % v.as_long())
3701  0x0badc0de
3702  """
3703  return int(self.as_string())
3704 
3705  def as_signed_long(self):
3706  """Return a Z3 bit-vector numeral as a Python long (bignum) numeral. The most significant bit is assumed to be the sign.
3707 
3708  >>> BitVecVal(4, 3).as_signed_long()
3709  -4
3710  >>> BitVecVal(7, 3).as_signed_long()
3711  -1
3712  >>> BitVecVal(3, 3).as_signed_long()
3713  3
3714  >>> BitVecVal(2**32 - 1, 32).as_signed_long()
3715  -1
3716  >>> BitVecVal(2**64 - 1, 64).as_signed_long()
3717  -1
3718  """
3719  sz = self.size()
3720  val = self.as_long()
3721  if val >= 2**(sz - 1):
3722  val = val - 2**sz
3723  if val < -2**(sz - 1):
3724  val = val + 2**sz
3725  return int(val)
3726 
3727  def as_string(self):
3728  return Z3_get_numeral_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
3729 
3730  def as_binary_string(self):
3731  return Z3_get_numeral_binary_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
3732 
3733 
3734 def is_bv(a):
3735  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 bit-vector expression.
3736 
3737  >>> b = BitVec('b', 32)
3738  >>> is_bv(b)
3739  True
3740  >>> is_bv(b + 10)
3741  True
3742  >>> is_bv(Int('x'))
3743  False
3744  """
3745  return isinstance(a, BitVecRef)
3746 
3747 def is_bv_value(a):
3748  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 bit-vector numeral value.
3749 
3750  >>> b = BitVec('b', 32)
3751  >>> is_bv_value(b)
3752  False
3753  >>> b = BitVecVal(10, 32)
3754  >>> b
3755  10
3756  >>> is_bv_value(b)
3757  True
3758  """
3759  return is_bv(a) and _is_numeral(a.ctx, a.as_ast())
3760 
3761 def BV2Int(a, is_signed=False):
3762  """Return the Z3 expression BV2Int(a).
3763 
3764  >>> b = BitVec('b', 3)
3765  >>> BV2Int(b).sort()
3766  Int
3767  >>> x = Int('x')
3768  >>> x > BV2Int(b)
3769  x > BV2Int(b)
3770  >>> x > BV2Int(b, is_signed=False)
3771  x > BV2Int(b)
3772  >>> x > BV2Int(b, is_signed=True)
3773  x > If(b < 0, BV2Int(b) - 8, BV2Int(b))
3774  >>> solve(x > BV2Int(b), b == 1, x < 3)
3775  [x = 2, b = 1]
3776  """
3777  if z3_debug():
3778  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "First argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
3779  ctx = a.ctx
3780  ## investigate problem with bv2int
3781  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_bv2int(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), is_signed), ctx)
3782 
3783 def Int2BV(a, num_bits):
3784  """Return the z3 expression Int2BV(a, num_bits).
3785  It is a bit-vector of width num_bits and represents the
3786  modulo of a by 2^num_bits
3787  """
3788  ctx = a.ctx
3789  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_int2bv(ctx.ref(), num_bits, a.as_ast()), ctx)
3790 
3791 def BitVecSort(sz, ctx=None):
3792  """Return a Z3 bit-vector sort of the given size. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3793 
3794  >>> Byte = BitVecSort(8)
3795  >>> Word = BitVecSort(16)
3796  >>> Byte
3797  BitVec(8)
3798  >>> x = Const('x', Byte)
3799  >>> eq(x, BitVec('x', 8))
3800  True
3801  """
3802  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3803  return BitVecSortRef(Z3_mk_bv_sort(ctx.ref(), sz), ctx)
3804 
3805 def BitVecVal(val, bv, ctx=None):
3806  """Return a bit-vector value with the given number of bits. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3807 
3808  >>> v = BitVecVal(10, 32)
3809  >>> v
3810  10
3811  >>> print("0x%.8x" % v.as_long())
3812  0x0000000a
3813  """
3814  if is_bv_sort(bv):
3815  ctx = bv.ctx
3816  return BitVecNumRef(Z3_mk_numeral(ctx.ref(), _to_int_str(val), bv.ast), ctx)
3817  else:
3818  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3819  return BitVecNumRef(Z3_mk_numeral(ctx.ref(), _to_int_str(val), BitVecSort(bv, ctx).ast), ctx)
3820 
3821 def BitVec(name, bv, ctx=None):
3822  """Return a bit-vector constant named `name`. `bv` may be the number of bits of a bit-vector sort.
3823  If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
3824 
3825  >>> x = BitVec('x', 16)
3826  >>> is_bv(x)
3827  True
3828  >>> x.size()
3829  16
3830  >>> x.sort()
3831  BitVec(16)
3832  >>> word = BitVecSort(16)
3833  >>> x2 = BitVec('x', word)
3834  >>> eq(x, x2)
3835  True
3836  """
3837  if isinstance(bv, BitVecSortRef):
3838  ctx = bv.ctx
3839  else:
3840  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3841  bv = BitVecSort(bv, ctx)
3842  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_const(ctx.ref(), to_symbol(name, ctx), bv.ast), ctx)
3843 
3844 def BitVecs(names, bv, ctx=None):
3845  """Return a tuple of bit-vector constants of size bv.
3846 
3847  >>> x, y, z = BitVecs('x y z', 16)
3848  >>> x.size()
3849  16
3850  >>> x.sort()
3851  BitVec(16)
3852  >>> Sum(x, y, z)
3853  0 + x + y + z
3854  >>> Product(x, y, z)
3855  1*x*y*z
3856  >>> simplify(Product(x, y, z))
3857  x*y*z
3858  """
3859  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
3860  if isinstance(names, str):
3861  names = names.split(" ")
3862  return [BitVec(name, bv, ctx) for name in names]
3863 
3864 def Concat(*args):
3865  """Create a Z3 bit-vector concatenation expression.
3866 
3867  >>> v = BitVecVal(1, 4)
3868  >>> Concat(v, v+1, v)
3869  Concat(Concat(1, 1 + 1), 1)
3870  >>> simplify(Concat(v, v+1, v))
3871  289
3872  >>> print("%.3x" % simplify(Concat(v, v+1, v)).as_long())
3873  121
3874  """
3875  args = _get_args(args)
3876  sz = len(args)
3877  if z3_debug():
3878  _z3_assert(sz >= 2, "At least two arguments expected.")
3879 
3880  ctx = None
3881  for a in args:
3882  if is_expr(a):
3883  ctx = a.ctx
3884  break
3885  if is_seq(args[0]) or isinstance(args[0], str):
3886  args = [_coerce_seq(s, ctx) for s in args]
3887  if z3_debug():
3888  _z3_assert(all([is_seq(a) for a in args]), "All arguments must be sequence expressions.")
3889  v = (Ast * sz)()
3890  for i in range(sz):
3891  v[i] = args[i].as_ast()
3892  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_seq_concat(ctx.ref(), sz, v), ctx)
3893 
3894  if is_re(args[0]):
3895  if z3_debug():
3896  _z3_assert(all([is_re(a) for a in args]), "All arguments must be regular expressions.")
3897  v = (Ast * sz)()
3898  for i in range(sz):
3899  v[i] = args[i].as_ast()
3900  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_concat(ctx.ref(), sz, v), ctx)
3901 
3902  if z3_debug():
3903  _z3_assert(all([is_bv(a) for a in args]), "All arguments must be Z3 bit-vector expressions.")
3904  r = args[0]
3905  for i in range(sz - 1):
3906  r = BitVecRef(Z3_mk_concat(ctx.ref(), r.as_ast(), args[i+1].as_ast()), ctx)
3907  return r
3908 
3909 def Extract(high, low, a):
3910  """Create a Z3 bit-vector extraction expression, or create a string extraction expression.
3911 
3912  >>> x = BitVec('x', 8)
3913  >>> Extract(6, 2, x)
3914  Extract(6, 2, x)
3915  >>> Extract(6, 2, x).sort()
3916  BitVec(5)
3917  >>> simplify(Extract(StringVal("abcd"),2,1))
3918  "c"
3919  """
3920  if isinstance(high, str):
3921  high = StringVal(high)
3922  if is_seq(high):
3923  s = high
3924  offset, length = _coerce_exprs(low, a, s.ctx)
3925  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_seq_extract(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast(), offset.as_ast(), length.as_ast()), s.ctx)
3926  if z3_debug():
3927  _z3_assert(low <= high, "First argument must be greater than or equal to second argument")
3928  _z3_assert(_is_int(high) and high >= 0 and _is_int(low) and low >= 0, "First and second arguments must be non negative integers")
3929  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "Third argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
3930  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_extract(a.ctx_ref(), high, low, a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
3931 
3932 def _check_bv_args(a, b):
3933  if z3_debug():
3934  _z3_assert(is_bv(a) or is_bv(b), "First or second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
3935 
3936 def ULE(a, b):
3937  """Create the Z3 expression (unsigned) `other <= self`.
3938 
3939  Use the operator <= for signed less than or equal to.
3940 
3941  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3942  >>> ULE(x, y)
3943  ULE(x, y)
3944  >>> (x <= y).sexpr()
3945  '(bvsle x y)'
3946  >>> ULE(x, y).sexpr()
3947  '(bvule x y)'
3948  """
3949  _check_bv_args(a, b)
3950  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
3951  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvule(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
3952 
3953 def ULT(a, b):
3954  """Create the Z3 expression (unsigned) `other < self`.
3955 
3956  Use the operator < for signed less than.
3957 
3958  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3959  >>> ULT(x, y)
3960  ULT(x, y)
3961  >>> (x < y).sexpr()
3962  '(bvslt x y)'
3963  >>> ULT(x, y).sexpr()
3964  '(bvult x y)'
3965  """
3966  _check_bv_args(a, b)
3967  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
3968  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvult(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
3969 
3970 def UGE(a, b):
3971  """Create the Z3 expression (unsigned) `other >= self`.
3972 
3973  Use the operator >= for signed greater than or equal to.
3974 
3975  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3976  >>> UGE(x, y)
3977  UGE(x, y)
3978  >>> (x >= y).sexpr()
3979  '(bvsge x y)'
3980  >>> UGE(x, y).sexpr()
3981  '(bvuge x y)'
3982  """
3983  _check_bv_args(a, b)
3984  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
3985  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvuge(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
3986 
3987 def UGT(a, b):
3988  """Create the Z3 expression (unsigned) `other > self`.
3989 
3990  Use the operator > for signed greater than.
3991 
3992  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
3993  >>> UGT(x, y)
3994  UGT(x, y)
3995  >>> (x > y).sexpr()
3996  '(bvsgt x y)'
3997  >>> UGT(x, y).sexpr()
3998  '(bvugt x y)'
3999  """
4000  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4001  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4002  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvugt(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4003 
4004 def UDiv(a, b):
4005  """Create the Z3 expression (unsigned) division `self / other`.
4006 
4007  Use the operator / for signed division.
4008 
4009  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
4010  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
4011  >>> UDiv(x, y)
4012  UDiv(x, y)
4013  >>> UDiv(x, y).sort()
4014  BitVec(32)
4015  >>> (x / y).sexpr()
4016  '(bvsdiv x y)'
4017  >>> UDiv(x, y).sexpr()
4018  '(bvudiv x y)'
4019  """
4020  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4021  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4022  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvudiv(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4023 
4024 def URem(a, b):
4025  """Create the Z3 expression (unsigned) remainder `self % other`.
4026 
4027  Use the operator % for signed modulus, and SRem() for signed remainder.
4028 
4029  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
4030  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
4031  >>> URem(x, y)
4032  URem(x, y)
4033  >>> URem(x, y).sort()
4034  BitVec(32)
4035  >>> (x % y).sexpr()
4036  '(bvsmod x y)'
4037  >>> URem(x, y).sexpr()
4038  '(bvurem x y)'
4039  """
4040  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4041  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4042  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvurem(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4043 
4044 def SRem(a, b):
4045  """Create the Z3 expression signed remainder.
4046 
4047  Use the operator % for signed modulus, and URem() for unsigned remainder.
4048 
4049  >>> x = BitVec('x', 32)
4050  >>> y = BitVec('y', 32)
4051  >>> SRem(x, y)
4052  SRem(x, y)
4053  >>> SRem(x, y).sort()
4054  BitVec(32)
4055  >>> (x % y).sexpr()
4056  '(bvsmod x y)'
4057  >>> SRem(x, y).sexpr()
4058  '(bvsrem x y)'
4059  """
4060  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4061  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4062  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvsrem(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4063 
4064 def LShR(a, b):
4065  """Create the Z3 expression logical right shift.
4066 
4067  Use the operator >> for the arithmetical right shift.
4068 
4069  >>> x, y = BitVecs('x y', 32)
4070  >>> LShR(x, y)
4071  LShR(x, y)
4072  >>> (x >> y).sexpr()
4073  '(bvashr x y)'
4074  >>> LShR(x, y).sexpr()
4075  '(bvlshr x y)'
4076  >>> BitVecVal(4, 3)
4077  4
4078  >>> BitVecVal(4, 3).as_signed_long()
4079  -4
4080  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(4, 3) >> 1).as_signed_long()
4081  -2
4082  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(4, 3) >> 1)
4083  6
4084  >>> simplify(LShR(BitVecVal(4, 3), 1))
4085  2
4086  >>> simplify(BitVecVal(2, 3) >> 1)
4087  1
4088  >>> simplify(LShR(BitVecVal(2, 3), 1))
4089  1
4090  """
4091  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4092  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4093  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvlshr(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4094 
4095 def RotateLeft(a, b):
4096  """Return an expression representing `a` rotated to the left `b` times.
4097 
4098  >>> a, b = BitVecs('a b', 16)
4099  >>> RotateLeft(a, b)
4100  RotateLeft(a, b)
4101  >>> simplify(RotateLeft(a, 0))
4102  a
4103  >>> simplify(RotateLeft(a, 16))
4104  a
4105  """
4106  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4107  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4108  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_ext_rotate_left(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4109 
4110 def RotateRight(a, b):
4111  """Return an expression representing `a` rotated to the right `b` times.
4112 
4113  >>> a, b = BitVecs('a b', 16)
4114  >>> RotateRight(a, b)
4115  RotateRight(a, b)
4116  >>> simplify(RotateRight(a, 0))
4117  a
4118  >>> simplify(RotateRight(a, 16))
4119  a
4120  """
4121  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4122  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4123  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_ext_rotate_right(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4124 
4125 def SignExt(n, a):
4126  """Return a bit-vector expression with `n` extra sign-bits.
4127 
4128  >>> x = BitVec('x', 16)
4129  >>> n = SignExt(8, x)
4130  >>> n.size()
4131  24
4132  >>> n
4133  SignExt(8, x)
4134  >>> n.sort()
4135  BitVec(24)
4136  >>> v0 = BitVecVal(2, 2)
4137  >>> v0
4138  2
4139  >>> v0.size()
4140  2
4141  >>> v = simplify(SignExt(6, v0))
4142  >>> v
4143  254
4144  >>> v.size()
4145  8
4146  >>> print("%.x" % v.as_long())
4147  fe
4148  """
4149  if z3_debug():
4150  _z3_assert(_is_int(n), "First argument must be an integer")
4151  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "Second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
4152  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_sign_ext(a.ctx_ref(), n, a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4153 
4154 def ZeroExt(n, a):
4155  """Return a bit-vector expression with `n` extra zero-bits.
4156 
4157  >>> x = BitVec('x', 16)
4158  >>> n = ZeroExt(8, x)
4159  >>> n.size()
4160  24
4161  >>> n
4162  ZeroExt(8, x)
4163  >>> n.sort()
4164  BitVec(24)
4165  >>> v0 = BitVecVal(2, 2)
4166  >>> v0
4167  2
4168  >>> v0.size()
4169  2
4170  >>> v = simplify(ZeroExt(6, v0))
4171  >>> v
4172  2
4173  >>> v.size()
4174  8
4175  """
4176  if z3_debug():
4177  _z3_assert(_is_int(n), "First argument must be an integer")
4178  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "Second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
4179  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_zero_ext(a.ctx_ref(), n, a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4180 
4181 def RepeatBitVec(n, a):
4182  """Return an expression representing `n` copies of `a`.
4183 
4184  >>> x = BitVec('x', 8)
4185  >>> n = RepeatBitVec(4, x)
4186  >>> n
4187  RepeatBitVec(4, x)
4188  >>> n.size()
4189  32
4190  >>> v0 = BitVecVal(10, 4)
4191  >>> print("%.x" % v0.as_long())
4192  a
4193  >>> v = simplify(RepeatBitVec(4, v0))
4194  >>> v.size()
4195  16
4196  >>> print("%.x" % v.as_long())
4197  aaaa
4198  """
4199  if z3_debug():
4200  _z3_assert(_is_int(n), "First argument must be an integer")
4201  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "Second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
4202  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_repeat(a.ctx_ref(), n, a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4203 
4204 def BVRedAnd(a):
4205  """Return the reduction-and expression of `a`."""
4206  if z3_debug():
4207  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "First argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
4208  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvredand(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4209 
4210 def BVRedOr(a):
4211  """Return the reduction-or expression of `a`."""
4212  if z3_debug():
4213  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "First argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
4214  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_bvredor(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4215 
4216 def BVAddNoOverflow(a, b, signed):
4217  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector addition does not overflow"""
4218  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4219  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4220  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvadd_no_overflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast(), signed), a.ctx)
4221 
4222 def BVAddNoUnderflow(a, b):
4223  """A predicate the determines that signed bit-vector addition does not underflow"""
4224  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4225  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4226  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvadd_no_underflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4227 
4228 def BVSubNoOverflow(a, b):
4229  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector subtraction does not overflow"""
4230  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4231  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4232  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvsub_no_overflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4233 
4234 
4235 def BVSubNoUnderflow(a, b, signed):
4236  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector subtraction does not underflow"""
4237  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4238  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4239  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvsub_no_underflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast(), signed), a.ctx)
4240 
4241 def BVSDivNoOverflow(a, b):
4242  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector signed division does not overflow"""
4243  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4244  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4245  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvsdiv_no_overflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4246 
4247 def BVSNegNoOverflow(a):
4248  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector unary negation does not overflow"""
4249  if z3_debug():
4250  _z3_assert(is_bv(a), "First argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
4251  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvneg_no_overflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4252 
4253 def BVMulNoOverflow(a, b, signed):
4254  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector multiplication does not overflow"""
4255  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4256  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4257  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvmul_no_overflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast(), signed), a.ctx)
4258 
4259 
4260 def BVMulNoUnderflow(a, b):
4261  """A predicate the determines that bit-vector signed multiplication does not underflow"""
4262  _check_bv_args(a, b)
4263  a, b = _coerce_exprs(a, b)
4264  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_bvmul_no_underflow(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
4265 
4266 
4267 
4268 #########################################
4269 #
4270 # Arrays
4271 #
4272 #########################################
4273 
4274 class ArraySortRef(SortRef):
4275  """Array sorts."""
4276 
4277  def domain(self):
4278  """Return the domain of the array sort `self`.
4279 
4280  >>> A = ArraySort(IntSort(), BoolSort())
4281  >>> A.domain()
4282  Int
4283  """
4284  return _to_sort_ref(Z3_get_array_sort_domain(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast), self.ctx)
4285 
4286  def range(self):
4287  """Return the range of the array sort `self`.
4288 
4289  >>> A = ArraySort(IntSort(), BoolSort())
4290  >>> A.range()
4291  Bool
4292  """
4293  return _to_sort_ref(Z3_get_array_sort_range(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast), self.ctx)
4294 
4295 class ArrayRef(ExprRef):
4296  """Array expressions. """
4297 
4298  def sort(self):
4299  """Return the array sort of the array expression `self`.
4300 
4301  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), BoolSort())
4302  >>> a.sort()
4303  Array(Int, Bool)
4304  """
4305  return ArraySortRef(Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
4306 
4307  def domain(self):
4308  """Shorthand for `self.sort().domain()`.
4309 
4310  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), BoolSort())
4311  >>> a.domain()
4312  Int
4313  """
4314  return self.sort().domain()
4315 
4316  def range(self):
4317  """Shorthand for `self.sort().range()`.
4318 
4319  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), BoolSort())
4320  >>> a.range()
4321  Bool
4322  """
4323  return self.sort().range()
4324 
4325  def __getitem__(self, arg):
4326  """Return the Z3 expression `self[arg]`.
4327 
4328  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), BoolSort())
4329  >>> i = Int('i')
4330  >>> a[i]
4331  a[i]
4332  >>> a[i].sexpr()
4333  '(select a i)'
4334  """
4335  arg = self.domain().cast(arg)
4336  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_mk_select(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), arg.as_ast()), self.ctx)
4337 
4338  def default(self):
4339  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_mk_array_default(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
4340 
4341 def is_array_sort(a):
4342  return Z3_get_sort_kind(a.ctx.ref(), Z3_get_sort(a.ctx.ref(), a.ast)) == Z3_ARRAY_SORT
4343 
4344 
4345 def is_array(a):
4346  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 array expression.
4347 
4348  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4349  >>> is_array(a)
4350  True
4351  >>> is_array(Store(a, 0, 1))
4352  True
4353  >>> is_array(a[0])
4354  False
4355  """
4356  return isinstance(a, ArrayRef)
4357 
4358 def is_const_array(a):
4359  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 constant array.
4360 
4361  >>> a = K(IntSort(), 10)
4362  >>> is_const_array(a)
4363  True
4364  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4365  >>> is_const_array(a)
4366  False
4367  """
4368  return is_app_of(a, Z3_OP_CONST_ARRAY)
4369 
4370 def is_K(a):
4371  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 constant array.
4372 
4373  >>> a = K(IntSort(), 10)
4374  >>> is_K(a)
4375  True
4376  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4377  >>> is_K(a)
4378  False
4379  """
4380  return is_app_of(a, Z3_OP_CONST_ARRAY)
4381 
4382 def is_map(a):
4383  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 map array expression.
4384 
4385  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
4386  >>> b = Array('b', IntSort(), IntSort())
4387  >>> a = Map(f, b)
4388  >>> a
4389  Map(f, b)
4390  >>> is_map(a)
4391  True
4392  >>> is_map(b)
4393  False
4394  """
4395  return is_app_of(a, Z3_OP_ARRAY_MAP)
4396 
4397 def is_default(a):
4398  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 default array expression.
4399  >>> d = Default(K(IntSort(), 10))
4400  >>> is_default(d)
4401  True
4402  """
4403  return is_app_of(a, Z3_OP_ARRAY_DEFAULT)
4404 
4405 def get_map_func(a):
4406  """Return the function declaration associated with a Z3 map array expression.
4407 
4408  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
4409  >>> b = Array('b', IntSort(), IntSort())
4410  >>> a = Map(f, b)
4411  >>> eq(f, get_map_func(a))
4412  True
4413  >>> get_map_func(a)
4414  f
4415  >>> get_map_func(a)(0)
4416  f(0)
4417  """
4418  if z3_debug():
4419  _z3_assert(is_map(a), "Z3 array map expression expected.")
4420  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_to_func_decl(a.ctx_ref(), Z3_get_decl_ast_parameter(a.ctx_ref(), a.decl().ast, 0)), a.ctx)
4421 
4422 def ArraySort(*sig):
4423  """Return the Z3 array sort with the given domain and range sorts.
4424 
4425  >>> A = ArraySort(IntSort(), BoolSort())
4426  >>> A
4427  Array(Int, Bool)
4428  >>> A.domain()
4429  Int
4430  >>> A.range()
4431  Bool
4432  >>> AA = ArraySort(IntSort(), A)
4433  >>> AA
4434  Array(Int, Array(Int, Bool))
4435  """
4436  sig = _get_args(sig)
4437  if z3_debug():
4438  _z3_assert(len(sig) > 1, "At least two arguments expected")
4439  arity = len(sig) - 1
4440  r = sig[arity]
4441  d = sig[0]
4442  if z3_debug():
4443  for s in sig:
4444  _z3_assert(is_sort(s), "Z3 sort expected")
4445  _z3_assert(s.ctx == r.ctx, "Context mismatch")
4446  ctx = d.ctx
4447  if len(sig) == 2:
4448  return ArraySortRef(Z3_mk_array_sort(ctx.ref(), d.ast, r.ast), ctx)
4449  dom = (Sort * arity)()
4450  for i in range(arity):
4451  dom[i] = sig[i].ast
4452  return ArraySortRef(Z3_mk_array_sort_n(ctx.ref(), arity, dom, r.ast), ctx)
4453 
4454 def Array(name, dom, rng):
4455  """Return an array constant named `name` with the given domain and range sorts.
4456 
4457  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4458  >>> a.sort()
4459  Array(Int, Int)
4460  >>> a[0]
4461  a[0]
4462  """
4463  s = ArraySort(dom, rng)
4464  ctx = s.ctx
4465  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_const(ctx.ref(), to_symbol(name, ctx), s.ast), ctx)
4466 
4467 def Update(a, i, v):
4468  """Return a Z3 store array expression.
4469 
4470  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4471  >>> i, v = Ints('i v')
4472  >>> s = Update(a, i, v)
4473  >>> s.sort()
4474  Array(Int, Int)
4475  >>> prove(s[i] == v)
4476  proved
4477  >>> j = Int('j')
4478  >>> prove(Implies(i != j, s[j] == a[j]))
4479  proved
4480  """
4481  if z3_debug():
4482  _z3_assert(is_array_sort(a), "First argument must be a Z3 array expression")
4483  i = a.sort().domain().cast(i)
4484  v = a.sort().range().cast(v)
4485  ctx = a.ctx
4486  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_mk_store(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), i.as_ast(), v.as_ast()), ctx)
4487 
4488 def Default(a):
4489  """ Return a default value for array expression.
4490  >>> b = K(IntSort(), 1)
4491  >>> prove(Default(b) == 1)
4492  proved
4493  """
4494  if z3_debug():
4495  _z3_assert(is_array_sort(a), "First argument must be a Z3 array expression")
4496  return a.default()
4497 
4498 
4499 def Store(a, i, v):
4500  """Return a Z3 store array expression.
4501 
4502  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4503  >>> i, v = Ints('i v')
4504  >>> s = Store(a, i, v)
4505  >>> s.sort()
4506  Array(Int, Int)
4507  >>> prove(s[i] == v)
4508  proved
4509  >>> j = Int('j')
4510  >>> prove(Implies(i != j, s[j] == a[j]))
4511  proved
4512  """
4513  return Update(a, i, v)
4514 
4515 def Select(a, i):
4516  """Return a Z3 select array expression.
4517 
4518  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4519  >>> i = Int('i')
4520  >>> Select(a, i)
4521  a[i]
4522  >>> eq(Select(a, i), a[i])
4523  True
4524  """
4525  if z3_debug():
4526  _z3_assert(is_array_sort(a), "First argument must be a Z3 array expression")
4527  return a[i]
4528 
4529 
4530 def Map(f, *args):
4531  """Return a Z3 map array expression.
4532 
4533  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort(), IntSort())
4534  >>> a1 = Array('a1', IntSort(), IntSort())
4535  >>> a2 = Array('a2', IntSort(), IntSort())
4536  >>> b = Map(f, a1, a2)
4537  >>> b
4538  Map(f, a1, a2)
4539  >>> prove(b[0] == f(a1[0], a2[0]))
4540  proved
4541  """
4542  args = _get_args(args)
4543  if z3_debug():
4544  _z3_assert(len(args) > 0, "At least one Z3 array expression expected")
4545  _z3_assert(is_func_decl(f), "First argument must be a Z3 function declaration")
4546  _z3_assert(all([is_array(a) for a in args]), "Z3 array expected expected")
4547  _z3_assert(len(args) == f.arity(), "Number of arguments mismatch")
4548  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args)
4549  ctx = f.ctx
4550  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_map(ctx.ref(), f.ast, sz, _args), ctx)
4551 
4552 def K(dom, v):
4553  """Return a Z3 constant array expression.
4554 
4555  >>> a = K(IntSort(), 10)
4556  >>> a
4557  K(Int, 10)
4558  >>> a.sort()
4559  Array(Int, Int)
4560  >>> i = Int('i')
4561  >>> a[i]
4562  K(Int, 10)[i]
4563  >>> simplify(a[i])
4564  10
4565  """
4566  if z3_debug():
4567  _z3_assert(is_sort(dom), "Z3 sort expected")
4568  ctx = dom.ctx
4569  if not is_expr(v):
4570  v = _py2expr(v, ctx)
4571  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_const_array(ctx.ref(), dom.ast, v.as_ast()), ctx)
4572 
4573 def Ext(a, b):
4574  """Return extensionality index for one-dimensional arrays.
4575  >> a, b = Consts('a b', SetSort(IntSort()))
4576  >> Ext(a, b)
4577  Ext(a, b)
4578  """
4579  ctx = a.ctx
4580  if z3_debug():
4581  _z3_assert(is_array_sort(a) and is_array(b), "arguments must be arrays")
4582  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_mk_array_ext(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), ctx)
4583 
4584 def SetHasSize(a, k):
4585  ctx = a.ctx
4586  k = _py2expr(k, ctx)
4587  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_mk_set_has_size(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), k.as_ast()), ctx)
4588 
4589 def is_select(a):
4590  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 array select application.
4591 
4592  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4593  >>> is_select(a)
4594  False
4595  >>> i = Int('i')
4596  >>> is_select(a[i])
4597  True
4598  """
4599  return is_app_of(a, Z3_OP_SELECT)
4600 
4601 def is_store(a):
4602  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 array store application.
4603 
4604  >>> a = Array('a', IntSort(), IntSort())
4605  >>> is_store(a)
4606  False
4607  >>> is_store(Store(a, 0, 1))
4608  True
4609  """
4610  return is_app_of(a, Z3_OP_STORE)
4611 
4612 #########################################
4613 #
4614 # Sets
4615 #
4616 #########################################
4617 
4618 
4619 def SetSort(s):
4620  """ Create a set sort over element sort s"""
4621  return ArraySort(s, BoolSort())
4622 
4623 def EmptySet(s):
4624  """Create the empty set
4625  >>> EmptySet(IntSort())
4626  K(Int, False)
4627  """
4628  ctx = s.ctx
4629  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_empty_set(ctx.ref(), s.ast), ctx)
4630 
4631 def FullSet(s):
4632  """Create the full set
4633  >>> FullSet(IntSort())
4634  K(Int, True)
4635  """
4636  ctx = s.ctx
4637  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_full_set(ctx.ref(), s.ast), ctx)
4638 
4639 def SetUnion(*args):
4640  """ Take the union of sets
4641  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4642  >>> b = Const('b', SetSort(IntSort()))
4643  >>> SetUnion(a, b)
4644  union(a, b)
4645  """
4646  args = _get_args(args)
4647  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
4648  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args)
4649  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_set_union(ctx.ref(), sz, _args), ctx)
4650 
4651 def SetIntersect(*args):
4652  """ Take the union of sets
4653  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4654  >>> b = Const('b', SetSort(IntSort()))
4655  >>> SetIntersect(a, b)
4656  intersection(a, b)
4657  """
4658  args = _get_args(args)
4659  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
4660  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args)
4661  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_set_intersect(ctx.ref(), sz, _args), ctx)
4662 
4663 def SetAdd(s, e):
4664  """ Add element e to set s
4665  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4666  >>> SetAdd(a, 1)
4667  Store(a, 1, True)
4668  """
4669  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list([s,e])
4670  e = _py2expr(e, ctx)
4671  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_set_add(ctx.ref(), s.as_ast(), e.as_ast()), ctx)
4672 
4673 def SetDel(s, e):
4674  """ Remove element e to set s
4675  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4676  >>> SetDel(a, 1)
4677  Store(a, 1, False)
4678  """
4679  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list([s,e])
4680  e = _py2expr(e, ctx)
4681  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_set_del(ctx.ref(), s.as_ast(), e.as_ast()), ctx)
4682 
4683 def SetComplement(s):
4684  """ The complement of set s
4685  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4686  >>> SetComplement(a)
4687  complement(a)
4688  """
4689  ctx = s.ctx
4690  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_set_complement(ctx.ref(), s.as_ast()), ctx)
4691 
4692 def SetDifference(a, b):
4693  """ The set difference of a and b
4694  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4695  >>> b = Const('b', SetSort(IntSort()))
4696  >>> SetDifference(a, b)
4697  setminus(a, b)
4698  """
4699  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list([a, b])
4700  return ArrayRef(Z3_mk_set_difference(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), ctx)
4701 
4702 def IsMember(e, s):
4703  """ Check if e is a member of set s
4704  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4705  >>> IsMember(1, a)
4706  a[1]
4707  """
4708  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list([s,e])
4709  e = _py2expr(e, ctx)
4710  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_set_member(ctx.ref(), e.as_ast(), s.as_ast()), ctx)
4711 
4712 def IsSubset(a, b):
4713  """ Check if a is a subset of b
4714  >>> a = Const('a', SetSort(IntSort()))
4715  >>> b = Const('b', SetSort(IntSort()))
4716  >>> IsSubset(a, b)
4717  subset(a, b)
4718  """
4719  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list([a, b])
4720  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_set_subset(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), ctx)
4721 
4722 
4723 #########################################
4724 #
4725 # Datatypes
4726 #
4727 #########################################
4728 
4729 def _valid_accessor(acc):
4730  """Return `True` if acc is pair of the form (String, Datatype or Sort). """
4731  return isinstance(acc, tuple) and len(acc) == 2 and isinstance(acc[0], str) and (isinstance(acc[1], Datatype) or is_sort(acc[1]))
4732 
4733 class Datatype:
4734  """Helper class for declaring Z3 datatypes.
4735 
4736  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4737  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4738  >>> List.declare('nil')
4739  >>> List = List.create()
4740  >>> # List is now a Z3 declaration
4741  >>> List.nil
4742  nil
4743  >>> List.cons(10, List.nil)
4744  cons(10, nil)
4745  >>> List.cons(10, List.nil).sort()
4746  List
4747  >>> cons = List.cons
4748  >>> nil = List.nil
4749  >>> car = List.car
4750  >>> cdr = List.cdr
4751  >>> n = cons(1, cons(0, nil))
4752  >>> n
4753  cons(1, cons(0, nil))
4754  >>> simplify(cdr(n))
4755  cons(0, nil)
4756  >>> simplify(car(n))
4757  1
4758  """
4759  def __init__(self, name, ctx=None):
4760  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
4761  self.name = name
4762  self.constructors = []
4763 
4764  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
4765  r = Datatype(self.name, self.ctx)
4766  r.constructors = copy.deepcopy(self.constructors)
4767  return r
4768 
4769  def declare_core(self, name, rec_name, *args):
4770  if z3_debug():
4771  _z3_assert(isinstance(name, str), "String expected")
4772  _z3_assert(isinstance(rec_name, str), "String expected")
4773  _z3_assert(all([_valid_accessor(a) for a in args]), "Valid list of accessors expected. An accessor is a pair of the form (String, Datatype|Sort)")
4774  self.constructors.append((name, rec_name, args))
4775 
4776  def declare(self, name, *args):
4777  """Declare constructor named `name` with the given accessors `args`.
4778  Each accessor is a pair `(name, sort)`, where `name` is a string and `sort` a Z3 sort or a reference to the datatypes being declared.
4779 
4780  In the following example `List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))`
4781  declares the constructor named `cons` that builds a new List using an integer and a List.
4782  It also declares the accessors `car` and `cdr`. The accessor `car` extracts the integer of a `cons` cell,
4783  and `cdr` the list of a `cons` cell. After all constructors were declared, we use the method create() to create
4784  the actual datatype in Z3.
4785 
4786  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4787  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4788  >>> List.declare('nil')
4789  >>> List = List.create()
4790  """
4791  if z3_debug():
4792  _z3_assert(isinstance(name, str), "String expected")
4793  _z3_assert(name != "", "Constructor name cannot be empty")
4794  return self.declare_core(name, "is-" + name, *args)
4795 
4796  def __repr__(self):
4797  return "Datatype(%s, %s)" % (self.name, self.constructors)
4798 
4799  def create(self):
4800  """Create a Z3 datatype based on the constructors declared using the method `declare()`.
4801 
4802  The function `CreateDatatypes()` must be used to define mutually recursive datatypes.
4803 
4804  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4805  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4806  >>> List.declare('nil')
4807  >>> List = List.create()
4808  >>> List.nil
4809  nil
4810  >>> List.cons(10, List.nil)
4811  cons(10, nil)
4812  """
4813  return CreateDatatypes([self])[0]
4814 
4815 class ScopedConstructor:
4816  """Auxiliary object used to create Z3 datatypes."""
4817  def __init__(self, c, ctx):
4818  self.c = c
4819  self.ctx = ctx
4820  def __del__(self):
4821  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
4822  Z3_del_constructor(self.ctx.ref(), self.c)
4823 
4824 class ScopedConstructorList:
4825  """Auxiliary object used to create Z3 datatypes."""
4826  def __init__(self, c, ctx):
4827  self.c = c
4828  self.ctx = ctx
4829  def __del__(self):
4830  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
4831  Z3_del_constructor_list(self.ctx.ref(), self.c)
4832 
4833 def CreateDatatypes(*ds):
4834  """Create mutually recursive Z3 datatypes using 1 or more Datatype helper objects.
4835 
4836  In the following example we define a Tree-List using two mutually recursive datatypes.
4837 
4838  >>> TreeList = Datatype('TreeList')
4839  >>> Tree = Datatype('Tree')
4840  >>> # Tree has two constructors: leaf and node
4841  >>> Tree.declare('leaf', ('val', IntSort()))
4842  >>> # a node contains a list of trees
4843  >>> Tree.declare('node', ('children', TreeList))
4844  >>> TreeList.declare('nil')
4845  >>> TreeList.declare('cons', ('car', Tree), ('cdr', TreeList))
4846  >>> Tree, TreeList = CreateDatatypes(Tree, TreeList)
4847  >>> Tree.val(Tree.leaf(10))
4848  val(leaf(10))
4849  >>> simplify(Tree.val(Tree.leaf(10)))
4850  10
4851  >>> n1 = Tree.node(TreeList.cons(Tree.leaf(10), TreeList.cons(Tree.leaf(20), TreeList.nil)))
4852  >>> n1
4853  node(cons(leaf(10), cons(leaf(20), nil)))
4854  >>> n2 = Tree.node(TreeList.cons(n1, TreeList.nil))
4855  >>> simplify(n2 == n1)
4856  False
4857  >>> simplify(TreeList.car(Tree.children(n2)) == n1)
4858  True
4859  """
4860  ds = _get_args(ds)
4861  if z3_debug():
4862  _z3_assert(len(ds) > 0, "At least one Datatype must be specified")
4863  _z3_assert(all([isinstance(d, Datatype) for d in ds]), "Arguments must be Datatypes")
4864  _z3_assert(all([d.ctx == ds[0].ctx for d in ds]), "Context mismatch")
4865  _z3_assert(all([d.constructors != [] for d in ds]), "Non-empty Datatypes expected")
4866  ctx = ds[0].ctx
4867  num = len(ds)
4868  names = (Symbol * num)()
4869  out = (Sort * num)()
4870  clists = (ConstructorList * num)()
4871  to_delete = []
4872  for i in range(num):
4873  d = ds[i]
4874  names[i] = to_symbol(d.name, ctx)
4875  num_cs = len(d.constructors)
4876  cs = (Constructor * num_cs)()
4877  for j in range(num_cs):
4878  c = d.constructors[j]
4879  cname = to_symbol(c[0], ctx)
4880  rname = to_symbol(c[1], ctx)
4881  fs = c[2]
4882  num_fs = len(fs)
4883  fnames = (Symbol * num_fs)()
4884  sorts = (Sort * num_fs)()
4885  refs = (ctypes.c_uint * num_fs)()
4886  for k in range(num_fs):
4887  fname = fs[k][0]
4888  ftype = fs[k][1]
4889  fnames[k] = to_symbol(fname, ctx)
4890  if isinstance(ftype, Datatype):
4891  if z3_debug():
4892  _z3_assert(ds.count(ftype) == 1, "One and only one occurrence of each datatype is expected")
4893  sorts[k] = None
4894  refs[k] = ds.index(ftype)
4895  else:
4896  if z3_debug():
4897  _z3_assert(is_sort(ftype), "Z3 sort expected")
4898  sorts[k] = ftype.ast
4899  refs[k] = 0
4900  cs[j] = Z3_mk_constructor(ctx.ref(), cname, rname, num_fs, fnames, sorts, refs)
4901  to_delete.append(ScopedConstructor(cs[j], ctx))
4902  clists[i] = Z3_mk_constructor_list(ctx.ref(), num_cs, cs)
4903  to_delete.append(ScopedConstructorList(clists[i], ctx))
4904  Z3_mk_datatypes(ctx.ref(), num, names, out, clists)
4905  result = []
4906  ## Create a field for every constructor, recognizer and accessor
4907  for i in range(num):
4908  dref = DatatypeSortRef(out[i], ctx)
4909  num_cs = dref.num_constructors()
4910  for j in range(num_cs):
4911  cref = dref.constructor(j)
4912  cref_name = cref.name()
4913  cref_arity = cref.arity()
4914  if cref.arity() == 0:
4915  cref = cref()
4916  setattr(dref, cref_name, cref)
4917  rref = dref.recognizer(j)
4918  setattr(dref, "is_" + cref_name, rref)
4919  for k in range(cref_arity):
4920  aref = dref.accessor(j, k)
4921  setattr(dref, aref.name(), aref)
4922  result.append(dref)
4923  return tuple(result)
4924 
4925 class DatatypeSortRef(SortRef):
4926  """Datatype sorts."""
4927  def num_constructors(self):
4928  """Return the number of constructors in the given Z3 datatype.
4929 
4930  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4931  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4932  >>> List.declare('nil')
4933  >>> List = List.create()
4934  >>> # List is now a Z3 declaration
4935  >>> List.num_constructors()
4936  2
4937  """
4938  return int(Z3_get_datatype_sort_num_constructors(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast))
4939 
4940  def constructor(self, idx):
4941  """Return a constructor of the datatype `self`.
4942 
4943  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4944  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4945  >>> List.declare('nil')
4946  >>> List = List.create()
4947  >>> # List is now a Z3 declaration
4948  >>> List.num_constructors()
4949  2
4950  >>> List.constructor(0)
4951  cons
4952  >>> List.constructor(1)
4953  nil
4954  """
4955  if z3_debug():
4956  _z3_assert(idx < self.num_constructors(), "Invalid constructor index")
4957  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_get_datatype_sort_constructor(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast, idx), self.ctx)
4958 
4959  def recognizer(self, idx):
4960  """In Z3, each constructor has an associated recognizer predicate.
4961 
4962  If the constructor is named `name`, then the recognizer `is_name`.
4963 
4964  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4965  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4966  >>> List.declare('nil')
4967  >>> List = List.create()
4968  >>> # List is now a Z3 declaration
4969  >>> List.num_constructors()
4970  2
4971  >>> List.recognizer(0)
4972  is(cons)
4973  >>> List.recognizer(1)
4974  is(nil)
4975  >>> simplify(List.is_nil(List.cons(10, List.nil)))
4976  False
4977  >>> simplify(List.is_cons(List.cons(10, List.nil)))
4978  True
4979  >>> l = Const('l', List)
4980  >>> simplify(List.is_cons(l))
4981  is(cons, l)
4982  """
4983  if z3_debug():
4984  _z3_assert(idx < self.num_constructors(), "Invalid recognizer index")
4985  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_get_datatype_sort_recognizer(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast, idx), self.ctx)
4986 
4987  def accessor(self, i, j):
4988  """In Z3, each constructor has 0 or more accessor. The number of accessors is equal to the arity of the constructor.
4989 
4990  >>> List = Datatype('List')
4991  >>> List.declare('cons', ('car', IntSort()), ('cdr', List))
4992  >>> List.declare('nil')
4993  >>> List = List.create()
4994  >>> List.num_constructors()
4995  2
4996  >>> List.constructor(0)
4997  cons
4998  >>> num_accs = List.constructor(0).arity()
4999  >>> num_accs
5000  2
5001  >>> List.accessor(0, 0)
5002  car
5003  >>> List.accessor(0, 1)
5004  cdr
5005  >>> List.constructor(1)
5006  nil
5007  >>> num_accs = List.constructor(1).arity()
5008  >>> num_accs
5009  0
5010  """
5011  if z3_debug():
5012  _z3_assert(i < self.num_constructors(), "Invalid constructor index")
5013  _z3_assert(j < self.constructor(i).arity(), "Invalid accessor index")
5014  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_get_datatype_sort_constructor_accessor(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast, i, j), self.ctx)
5015 
5016 class DatatypeRef(ExprRef):
5017  """Datatype expressions."""
5018  def sort(self):
5019  """Return the datatype sort of the datatype expression `self`."""
5020  return DatatypeSortRef(Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
5021 
5022 def TupleSort(name, sorts, ctx = None):
5023  """Create a named tuple sort base on a set of underlying sorts
5024  Example:
5025  >>> pair, mk_pair, (first, second) = TupleSort("pair", [IntSort(), StringSort()])
5026  """
5027  tuple = Datatype(name, ctx)
5028  projects = [ ('project%d' % i, sorts[i]) for i in range(len(sorts)) ]
5029  tuple.declare(name, *projects)
5030  tuple = tuple.create()
5031  return tuple, tuple.constructor(0), [tuple.accessor(0, i) for i in range(len(sorts))]
5032 
5033 def DisjointSum(name, sorts, ctx=None):
5034  """Create a named tagged union sort base on a set of underlying sorts
5035  Example:
5036  >>> sum, ((inject0, extract0), (inject1, extract1)) = DisjointSum("+", [IntSort(), StringSort()])
5037  """
5038  sum = Datatype(name, ctx)
5039  for i in range(len(sorts)):
5040  sum.declare("inject%d" % i, ("project%d" % i, sorts[i]))
5041  sum = sum.create()
5042  return sum, [(sum.constructor(i), sum.accessor(i, 0)) for i in range(len(sorts))]
5043 
5044 
5045 def EnumSort(name, values, ctx=None):
5046  """Return a new enumeration sort named `name` containing the given values.
5047 
5048  The result is a pair (sort, list of constants).
5049  Example:
5050  >>> Color, (red, green, blue) = EnumSort('Color', ['red', 'green', 'blue'])
5051  """
5052  if z3_debug():
5053  _z3_assert(isinstance(name, str), "Name must be a string")
5054  _z3_assert(all([isinstance(v, str) for v in values]), "Eumeration sort values must be strings")
5055  _z3_assert(len(values) > 0, "At least one value expected")
5056  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
5057  num = len(values)
5058  _val_names = (Symbol * num)()
5059  for i in range(num):
5060  _val_names[i] = to_symbol(values[i])
5061  _values = (FuncDecl * num)()
5062  _testers = (FuncDecl * num)()
5063  name = to_symbol(name)
5064  S = DatatypeSortRef(Z3_mk_enumeration_sort(ctx.ref(), name, num, _val_names, _values, _testers), ctx)
5065  V = []
5066  for i in range(num):
5067  V.append(FuncDeclRef(_values[i], ctx))
5068  V = [a() for a in V]
5069  return S, V
5070 
5071 #########################################
5072 #
5073 # Parameter Sets
5074 #
5075 #########################################
5076 
5077 class ParamsRef:
5078  """Set of parameters used to configure Solvers, Tactics and Simplifiers in Z3.
5079 
5080  Consider using the function `args2params` to create instances of this object.
5081  """
5082  def __init__(self, ctx=None, params=None):
5083  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
5084  if params is None:
5085  self.params = Z3_mk_params(self.ctx.ref())
5086  else:
5087  self.params = params
5088  Z3_params_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.params)
5089 
5090  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5091  return ParamsRef(self.ctx, self.params)
5092 
5093  def __del__(self):
5094  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5095  Z3_params_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.params)
5096 
5097  def set(self, name, val):
5098  """Set parameter name with value val."""
5099  if z3_debug():
5100  _z3_assert(isinstance(name, str), "parameter name must be a string")
5101  name_sym = to_symbol(name, self.ctx)
5102  if isinstance(val, bool):
5103  Z3_params_set_bool(self.ctx.ref(), self.params, name_sym, val)
5104  elif _is_int(val):
5105  Z3_params_set_uint(self.ctx.ref(), self.params, name_sym, val)
5106  elif isinstance(val, float):
5107  Z3_params_set_double(self.ctx.ref(), self.params, name_sym, val)
5108  elif isinstance(val, str):
5109  Z3_params_set_symbol(self.ctx.ref(), self.params, name_sym, to_symbol(val, self.ctx))
5110  else:
5111  if z3_debug():
5112  _z3_assert(False, "invalid parameter value")
5113 
5114  def __repr__(self):
5115  return Z3_params_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.params)
5116 
5117  def validate(self, ds):
5118  _z3_assert(isinstance(ds, ParamDescrsRef), "parameter description set expected")
5119  Z3_params_validate(self.ctx.ref(), self.params, ds.descr)
5120 
5121 def args2params(arguments, keywords, ctx=None):
5122  """Convert python arguments into a Z3_params object.
5123  A ':' is added to the keywords, and '_' is replaced with '-'
5124 
5125  >>> args2params(['model', True, 'relevancy', 2], {'elim_and' : True})
5126  (params model true relevancy 2 elim_and true)
5127  """
5128  if z3_debug():
5129  _z3_assert(len(arguments) % 2 == 0, "Argument list must have an even number of elements.")
5130  prev = None
5131  r = ParamsRef(ctx)
5132  for a in arguments:
5133  if prev is None:
5134  prev = a
5135  else:
5136  r.set(prev, a)
5137  prev = None
5138  for k in keywords:
5139  v = keywords[k]
5140  r.set(k, v)
5141  return r
5142 
5143 class ParamDescrsRef:
5144  """Set of parameter descriptions for Solvers, Tactics and Simplifiers in Z3.
5145  """
5146  def __init__(self, descr, ctx=None):
5147  _z3_assert(isinstance(descr, ParamDescrs), "parameter description object expected")
5148  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
5149  self.descr = descr
5150  Z3_param_descrs_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr)
5151 
5152  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5153  return ParamsDescrsRef(self.descr, self.ctx)
5154 
5155  def __del__(self):
5156  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5157  Z3_param_descrs_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr)
5158 
5159  def size(self):
5160  """Return the size of in the parameter description `self`.
5161  """
5162  return int(Z3_param_descrs_size(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr))
5163 
5164  def __len__(self):
5165  """Return the size of in the parameter description `self`.
5166  """
5167  return self.size()
5168 
5169  def get_name(self, i):
5170  """Return the i-th parameter name in the parameter description `self`.
5171  """
5172  return _symbol2py(self.ctx, Z3_param_descrs_get_name(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr, i))
5173 
5174  def get_kind(self, n):
5175  """Return the kind of the parameter named `n`.
5176  """
5177  return Z3_param_descrs_get_kind(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr, to_symbol(n, self.ctx))
5178 
5179  def get_documentation(self, n):
5180  """Return the documentation string of the parameter named `n`.
5181  """
5182  return Z3_param_descrs_get_documentation(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr, to_symbol(n, self.ctx))
5183 
5184  def __getitem__(self, arg):
5185  if _is_int(arg):
5186  return self.get_name(arg)
5187  else:
5188  return self.get_kind(arg)
5189 
5190  def __repr__(self):
5191  return Z3_param_descrs_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.descr)
5192 
5193 #########################################
5194 #
5195 # Goals
5196 #
5197 #########################################
5198 
5199 class Goal(Z3PPObject):
5200  """Goal is a collection of constraints we want to find a solution or show to be unsatisfiable (infeasible).
5201 
5202  Goals are processed using Tactics. A Tactic transforms a goal into a set of subgoals.
5203  A goal has a solution if one of its subgoals has a solution.
5204  A goal is unsatisfiable if all subgoals are unsatisfiable.
5205  """
5206 
5207  def __init__(self, models=True, unsat_cores=False, proofs=False, ctx=None, goal=None):
5208  if z3_debug():
5209  _z3_assert(goal is None or ctx is not None, "If goal is different from None, then ctx must be also different from None")
5210  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
5211  self.goal = goal
5212  if self.goal is None:
5213  self.goal = Z3_mk_goal(self.ctx.ref(), models, unsat_cores, proofs)
5214  Z3_goal_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal)
5215 
5216  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5217  return Goal(False, False, False, self.ctx, self.goal)
5218 
5219  def __del__(self):
5220  if self.goal is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5221  Z3_goal_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal)
5222 
5223  def depth(self):
5224  """Return the depth of the goal `self`. The depth corresponds to the number of tactics applied to `self`.
5225 
5226  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5227  >>> g = Goal()
5228  >>> g.add(x == 0, y >= x + 1)
5229  >>> g.depth()
5230  0
5231  >>> r = Then('simplify', 'solve-eqs')(g)
5232  >>> # r has 1 subgoal
5233  >>> len(r)
5234  1
5235  >>> r[0].depth()
5236  2
5237  """
5238  return int(Z3_goal_depth(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal))
5239 
5240  def inconsistent(self):
5241  """Return `True` if `self` contains the `False` constraints.
5242 
5243  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5244  >>> g = Goal()
5245  >>> g.inconsistent()
5246  False
5247  >>> g.add(x == 0, x == 1)
5248  >>> g
5249  [x == 0, x == 1]
5250  >>> g.inconsistent()
5251  False
5252  >>> g2 = Tactic('propagate-values')(g)[0]
5253  >>> g2.inconsistent()
5254  True
5255  """
5256  return Z3_goal_inconsistent(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal)
5257 
5258  def prec(self):
5259  """Return the precision (under-approximation, over-approximation, or precise) of the goal `self`.
5260 
5261  >>> g = Goal()
5262  >>> g.prec() == Z3_GOAL_PRECISE
5263  True
5264  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5265  >>> g.add(x == y + 1)
5266  >>> g.prec() == Z3_GOAL_PRECISE
5267  True
5268  >>> t = With(Tactic('add-bounds'), add_bound_lower=0, add_bound_upper=10)
5269  >>> g2 = t(g)[0]
5270  >>> g2
5271  [x == y + 1, x <= 10, x >= 0, y <= 10, y >= 0]
5272  >>> g2.prec() == Z3_GOAL_PRECISE
5273  False
5274  >>> g2.prec() == Z3_GOAL_UNDER
5275  True
5276  """
5277  return Z3_goal_precision(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal)
5278 
5279  def precision(self):
5280  """Alias for `prec()`.
5281 
5282  >>> g = Goal()
5283  >>> g.precision() == Z3_GOAL_PRECISE
5284  True
5285  """
5286  return self.prec()
5287 
5288  def size(self):
5289  """Return the number of constraints in the goal `self`.
5290 
5291  >>> g = Goal()
5292  >>> g.size()
5293  0
5294  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5295  >>> g.add(x == 0, y > x)
5296  >>> g.size()
5297  2
5298  """
5299  return int(Z3_goal_size(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal))
5300 
5301  def __len__(self):
5302  """Return the number of constraints in the goal `self`.
5303 
5304  >>> g = Goal()
5305  >>> len(g)
5306  0
5307  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5308  >>> g.add(x == 0, y > x)
5309  >>> len(g)
5310  2
5311  """
5312  return self.size()
5313 
5314  def get(self, i):
5315  """Return a constraint in the goal `self`.
5316 
5317  >>> g = Goal()
5318  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5319  >>> g.add(x == 0, y > x)
5320  >>> g.get(0)
5321  x == 0
5322  >>> g.get(1)
5323  y > x
5324  """
5325  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_goal_formula(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal, i), self.ctx)
5326 
5327  def __getitem__(self, arg):
5328  """Return a constraint in the goal `self`.
5329 
5330  >>> g = Goal()
5331  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
5332  >>> g.add(x == 0, y > x)
5333  >>> g[0]
5334  x == 0
5335  >>> g[1]
5336  y > x
5337  """
5338  if arg >= len(self):
5339  raise IndexError
5340  return self.get(arg)
5341 
5342  def assert_exprs(self, *args):
5343  """Assert constraints into the goal.
5344 
5345  >>> x = Int('x')
5346  >>> g = Goal()
5347  >>> g.assert_exprs(x > 0, x < 2)
5348  >>> g
5349  [x > 0, x < 2]
5350  """
5351  args = _get_args(args)
5352  s = BoolSort(self.ctx)
5353  for arg in args:
5354  arg = s.cast(arg)
5355  Z3_goal_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal, arg.as_ast())
5356 
5357  def append(self, *args):
5358  """Add constraints.
5359 
5360  >>> x = Int('x')
5361  >>> g = Goal()
5362  >>> g.append(x > 0, x < 2)
5363  >>> g
5364  [x > 0, x < 2]
5365  """
5366  self.assert_exprs(*args)
5367 
5368  def insert(self, *args):
5369  """Add constraints.
5370 
5371  >>> x = Int('x')
5372  >>> g = Goal()
5373  >>> g.insert(x > 0, x < 2)
5374  >>> g
5375  [x > 0, x < 2]
5376  """
5377  self.assert_exprs(*args)
5378 
5379  def add(self, *args):
5380  """Add constraints.
5381 
5382  >>> x = Int('x')
5383  >>> g = Goal()
5384  >>> g.add(x > 0, x < 2)
5385  >>> g
5386  [x > 0, x < 2]
5387  """
5388  self.assert_exprs(*args)
5389 
5390  def convert_model(self, model):
5391  """Retrieve model from a satisfiable goal
5392  >>> a, b = Ints('a b')
5393  >>> g = Goal()
5394  >>> g.add(Or(a == 0, a == 1), Or(b == 0, b == 1), a > b)
5395  >>> t = Then(Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('solve-eqs'))
5396  >>> r = t(g)
5397  >>> r[0]
5398  [Or(b == 0, b == 1), Not(0 <= b)]
5399  >>> r[1]
5400  [Or(b == 0, b == 1), Not(1 <= b)]
5401  >>> # Remark: the subgoal r[0] is unsatisfiable
5402  >>> # Creating a solver for solving the second subgoal
5403  >>> s = Solver()
5404  >>> s.add(r[1])
5405  >>> s.check()
5406  sat
5407  >>> s.model()
5408  [b = 0]
5409  >>> # Model s.model() does not assign a value to `a`
5410  >>> # It is a model for subgoal `r[1]`, but not for goal `g`
5411  >>> # The method convert_model creates a model for `g` from a model for `r[1]`.
5412  >>> r[1].convert_model(s.model())
5413  [b = 0, a = 1]
5414  """
5415  if z3_debug():
5416  _z3_assert(isinstance(model, ModelRef), "Z3 Model expected")
5417  return ModelRef(Z3_goal_convert_model(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal, model.model), self.ctx)
5418 
5419  def __repr__(self):
5420  return obj_to_string(self)
5421 
5422  def sexpr(self):
5423  """Return a textual representation of the s-expression representing the goal."""
5424  return Z3_goal_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal)
5425 
5426  def dimacs(self, include_names = True):
5427  """Return a textual representation of the goal in DIMACS format."""
5428  return Z3_goal_to_dimacs_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal, include_names)
5429 
5430  def translate(self, target):
5431  """Copy goal `self` to context `target`.
5432 
5433  >>> x = Int('x')
5434  >>> g = Goal()
5435  >>> g.add(x > 10)
5436  >>> g
5437  [x > 10]
5438  >>> c2 = Context()
5439  >>> g2 = g.translate(c2)
5440  >>> g2
5441  [x > 10]
5442  >>> g.ctx == main_ctx()
5443  True
5444  >>> g2.ctx == c2
5445  True
5446  >>> g2.ctx == main_ctx()
5447  False
5448  """
5449  if z3_debug():
5450  _z3_assert(isinstance(target, Context), "target must be a context")
5451  return Goal(goal=Z3_goal_translate(self.ctx.ref(), self.goal, target.ref()), ctx=target)
5452 
5453  def __copy__(self):
5454  return self.translate(self.ctx)
5455 
5456  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5457  return self.translate(self.ctx)
5458 
5459  def simplify(self, *arguments, **keywords):
5460  """Return a new simplified goal.
5461 
5462  This method is essentially invoking the simplify tactic.
5463 
5464  >>> g = Goal()
5465  >>> x = Int('x')
5466  >>> g.add(x + 1 >= 2)
5467  >>> g
5468  [x + 1 >= 2]
5469  >>> g2 = g.simplify()
5470  >>> g2
5471  [x >= 1]
5472  >>> # g was not modified
5473  >>> g
5474  [x + 1 >= 2]
5475  """
5476  t = Tactic('simplify')
5477  return t.apply(self, *arguments, **keywords)[0]
5478 
5479  def as_expr(self):
5480  """Return goal `self` as a single Z3 expression.
5481 
5482  >>> x = Int('x')
5483  >>> g = Goal()
5484  >>> g.as_expr()
5485  True
5486  >>> g.add(x > 1)
5487  >>> g.as_expr()
5488  x > 1
5489  >>> g.add(x < 10)
5490  >>> g.as_expr()
5491  And(x > 1, x < 10)
5492  """
5493  sz = len(self)
5494  if sz == 0:
5495  return BoolVal(True, self.ctx)
5496  elif sz == 1:
5497  return self.get(0)
5498  else:
5499  return And([ self.get(i) for i in range(len(self)) ], self.ctx)
5500 
5501 #########################################
5502 #
5503 # AST Vector
5504 #
5505 #########################################
5506 class AstVector(Z3PPObject):
5507  """A collection (vector) of ASTs."""
5508 
5509  def __init__(self, v=None, ctx=None):
5510  self.vector = None
5511  if v is None:
5512  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
5513  self.vector = Z3_mk_ast_vector(self.ctx.ref())
5514  else:
5515  self.vector = v
5516  assert ctx is not None
5517  self.ctx = ctx
5518  Z3_ast_vector_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector)
5519 
5520  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5521  return AstVector(self.vector, self.ctx)
5522 
5523  def __del__(self):
5524  if self.vector is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5525  Z3_ast_vector_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector)
5526 
5527  def __len__(self):
5528  """Return the size of the vector `self`.
5529 
5530  >>> A = AstVector()
5531  >>> len(A)
5532  0
5533  >>> A.push(Int('x'))
5534  >>> A.push(Int('x'))
5535  >>> len(A)
5536  2
5537  """
5538  return int(Z3_ast_vector_size(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector))
5539 
5540  def __getitem__(self, i):
5541  """Return the AST at position `i`.
5542 
5543  >>> A = AstVector()
5544  >>> A.push(Int('x') + 1)
5545  >>> A.push(Int('y'))
5546  >>> A[0]
5547  x + 1
5548  >>> A[1]
5549  y
5550  """
5551 
5552  if isinstance(i, int):
5553  if i < 0:
5554  i += self.__len__()
5555 
5556  if i >= self.__len__():
5557  raise IndexError
5558  return _to_ast_ref(Z3_ast_vector_get(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector, i), self.ctx)
5559 
5560  elif isinstance(i, slice):
5561  return [_to_ast_ref(Z3_ast_vector_get(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector, ii), self.ctx) for ii in range(*i.indices(self.__len__()))]
5562 
5563 
5564  def __setitem__(self, i, v):
5565  """Update AST at position `i`.
5566 
5567  >>> A = AstVector()
5568  >>> A.push(Int('x') + 1)
5569  >>> A.push(Int('y'))
5570  >>> A[0]
5571  x + 1
5572  >>> A[0] = Int('x')
5573  >>> A[0]
5574  x
5575  """
5576  if i >= self.__len__():
5577  raise IndexError
