5578  Z3_ast_vector_set(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector, i, v.as_ast())
5579 
5580  def push(self, v):
5581  """Add `v` in the end of the vector.
5582 
5583  >>> A = AstVector()
5584  >>> len(A)
5585  0
5586  >>> A.push(Int('x'))
5587  >>> len(A)
5588  1
5589  """
5590  Z3_ast_vector_push(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector, v.as_ast())
5591 
5592  def resize(self, sz):
5593  """Resize the vector to `sz` elements.
5594 
5595  >>> A = AstVector()
5596  >>> A.resize(10)
5597  >>> len(A)
5598  10
5599  >>> for i in range(10): A[i] = Int('x')
5600  >>> A[5]
5601  x
5602  """
5603  Z3_ast_vector_resize(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector, sz)
5604 
5605  def __contains__(self, item):
5606  """Return `True` if the vector contains `item`.
5607 
5608  >>> x = Int('x')
5609  >>> A = AstVector()
5610  >>> x in A
5611  False
5612  >>> A.push(x)
5613  >>> x in A
5614  True
5615  >>> (x+1) in A
5616  False
5617  >>> A.push(x+1)
5618  >>> (x+1) in A
5619  True
5620  >>> A
5621  [x, x + 1]
5622  """
5623  for elem in self:
5624  if elem.eq(item):
5625  return True
5626  return False
5627 
5628  def translate(self, other_ctx):
5629  """Copy vector `self` to context `other_ctx`.
5630 
5631  >>> x = Int('x')
5632  >>> A = AstVector()
5633  >>> A.push(x)
5634  >>> c2 = Context()
5635  >>> B = A.translate(c2)
5636  >>> B
5637  [x]
5638  """
5639  return AstVector(Z3_ast_vector_translate(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector, other_ctx.ref()), other_ctx)
5640 
5641  def __copy__(self):
5642  return self.translate(self.ctx)
5643 
5644  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5645  return self.translate(self.ctx)
5646 
5647  def __repr__(self):
5648  return obj_to_string(self)
5649 
5650  def sexpr(self):
5651  """Return a textual representation of the s-expression representing the vector."""
5652  return Z3_ast_vector_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.vector)
5653 
5654 #########################################
5655 #
5656 # AST Map
5657 #
5658 #########################################
5659 class AstMap:
5660  """A mapping from ASTs to ASTs."""
5661 
5662  def __init__(self, m=None, ctx=None):
5663  self.map = None
5664  if m is None:
5665  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
5666  self.map = Z3_mk_ast_map(self.ctx.ref())
5667  else:
5668  self.map = m
5669  assert ctx is not None
5670  self.ctx = ctx
5671  Z3_ast_map_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.map)
5672 
5673  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5674  return AstMap(self.map, self.ctx)
5675 
5676  def __del__(self):
5677  if self.map is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5678  Z3_ast_map_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.map)
5679 
5680  def __len__(self):
5681  """Return the size of the map.
5682 
5683  >>> M = AstMap()
5684  >>> len(M)
5685  0
5686  >>> x = Int('x')
5687  >>> M[x] = IntVal(1)
5688  >>> len(M)
5689  1
5690  """
5691  return int(Z3_ast_map_size(self.ctx.ref(), self.map))
5692 
5693  def __contains__(self, key):
5694  """Return `True` if the map contains key `key`.
5695 
5696  >>> M = AstMap()
5697  >>> x = Int('x')
5698  >>> M[x] = x + 1
5699  >>> x in M
5700  True
5701  >>> x+1 in M
5702  False
5703  """
5704  return Z3_ast_map_contains(self.ctx.ref(), self.map, key.as_ast())
5705 
5706  def __getitem__(self, key):
5707  """Retrieve the value associated with key `key`.
5708 
5709  >>> M = AstMap()
5710  >>> x = Int('x')
5711  >>> M[x] = x + 1
5712  >>> M[x]
5713  x + 1
5714  """
5715  return _to_ast_ref(Z3_ast_map_find(self.ctx.ref(), self.map, key.as_ast()), self.ctx)
5716 
5717  def __setitem__(self, k, v):
5718  """Add/Update key `k` with value `v`.
5719 
5720  >>> M = AstMap()
5721  >>> x = Int('x')
5722  >>> M[x] = x + 1
5723  >>> len(M)
5724  1
5725  >>> M[x]
5726  x + 1
5727  >>> M[x] = IntVal(1)
5728  >>> M[x]
5729  1
5730  """
5731  Z3_ast_map_insert(self.ctx.ref(), self.map, k.as_ast(), v.as_ast())
5732 
5733  def __repr__(self):
5734  return Z3_ast_map_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.map)
5735 
5736  def erase(self, k):
5737  """Remove the entry associated with key `k`.
5738 
5739  >>> M = AstMap()
5740  >>> x = Int('x')
5741  >>> M[x] = x + 1
5742  >>> len(M)
5743  1
5744  >>> M.erase(x)
5745  >>> len(M)
5746  0
5747  """
5748  Z3_ast_map_erase(self.ctx.ref(), self.map, k.as_ast())
5749 
5750  def reset(self):
5751  """Remove all entries from the map.
5752 
5753  >>> M = AstMap()
5754  >>> x = Int('x')
5755  >>> M[x] = x + 1
5756  >>> M[x+x] = IntVal(1)
5757  >>> len(M)
5758  2
5759  >>> M.reset()
5760  >>> len(M)
5761  0
5762  """
5763  Z3_ast_map_reset(self.ctx.ref(), self.map)
5764 
5765  def keys(self):
5766  """Return an AstVector containing all keys in the map.
5767 
5768  >>> M = AstMap()
5769  >>> x = Int('x')
5770  >>> M[x] = x + 1
5771  >>> M[x+x] = IntVal(1)
5772  >>> M.keys()
5773  [x, x + x]
5774  """
5775  return AstVector(Z3_ast_map_keys(self.ctx.ref(), self.map), self.ctx)
5776 
5777 #########################################
5778 #
5779 # Model
5780 #
5781 #########################################
5782 
5783 class FuncEntry:
5784  """Store the value of the interpretation of a function in a particular point."""
5785 
5786  def __init__(self, entry, ctx):
5787  self.entry = entry
5788  self.ctx = ctx
5789  Z3_func_entry_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.entry)
5790 
5791  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5792  return FuncEntry(self.entry, self.ctx)
5793 
5794  def __del__(self):
5795  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5796  Z3_func_entry_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.entry)
5797 
5798  def num_args(self):
5799  """Return the number of arguments in the given entry.
5800 
5801  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort(), IntSort())
5802  >>> s = Solver()
5803  >>> s.add(f(0, 1) == 10, f(1, 2) == 20, f(1, 0) == 10)
5804  >>> s.check()
5805  sat
5806  >>> m = s.model()
5807  >>> f_i = m[f]
5808  >>> f_i.num_entries()
5809  1
5810  >>> e = f_i.entry(0)
5811  >>> e.num_args()
5812  2
5813  """
5814  return int(Z3_func_entry_get_num_args(self.ctx.ref(), self.entry))
5815 
5816  def arg_value(self, idx):
5817  """Return the value of argument `idx`.
5818 
5819  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort(), IntSort())
5820  >>> s = Solver()
5821  >>> s.add(f(0, 1) == 10, f(1, 2) == 20, f(1, 0) == 10)
5822  >>> s.check()
5823  sat
5824  >>> m = s.model()
5825  >>> f_i = m[f]
5826  >>> f_i.num_entries()
5827  1
5828  >>> e = f_i.entry(0)
5829  >>> e
5830  [1, 2, 20]
5831  >>> e.num_args()
5832  2
5833  >>> e.arg_value(0)
5834  1
5835  >>> e.arg_value(1)
5836  2
5837  >>> try:
5838  ... e.arg_value(2)
5839  ... except IndexError:
5840  ... print("index error")
5841  index error
5842  """
5843  if idx >= self.num_args():
5844  raise IndexError
5845  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_func_entry_get_arg(self.ctx.ref(), self.entry, idx), self.ctx)
5846 
5847  def value(self):
5848  """Return the value of the function at point `self`.
5849 
5850  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort(), IntSort())
5851  >>> s = Solver()
5852  >>> s.add(f(0, 1) == 10, f(1, 2) == 20, f(1, 0) == 10)
5853  >>> s.check()
5854  sat
5855  >>> m = s.model()
5856  >>> f_i = m[f]
5857  >>> f_i.num_entries()
5858  1
5859  >>> e = f_i.entry(0)
5860  >>> e
5861  [1, 2, 20]
5862  >>> e.num_args()
5863  2
5864  >>> e.value()
5865  20
5866  """
5867  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_func_entry_get_value(self.ctx.ref(), self.entry), self.ctx)
5868 
5869  def as_list(self):
5870  """Return entry `self` as a Python list.
5871  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort(), IntSort())
5872  >>> s = Solver()
5873  >>> s.add(f(0, 1) == 10, f(1, 2) == 20, f(1, 0) == 10)
5874  >>> s.check()
5875  sat
5876  >>> m = s.model()
5877  >>> f_i = m[f]
5878  >>> f_i.num_entries()
5879  1
5880  >>> e = f_i.entry(0)
5881  >>> e.as_list()
5882  [1, 2, 20]
5883  """
5884  args = [ self.arg_value(i) for i in range(self.num_args())]
5885  args.append(self.value())
5886  return args
5887 
5888  def __repr__(self):
5889  return repr(self.as_list())
5890 
5891 class FuncInterp(Z3PPObject):
5892  """Stores the interpretation of a function in a Z3 model."""
5893 
5894  def __init__(self, f, ctx):
5895  self.f = f
5896  self.ctx = ctx
5897  if self.f is not None:
5898  Z3_func_interp_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.f)
5899 
5900  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5901  return FuncInterp(self.f, self.ctx)
5902 
5903  def __del__(self):
5904  if self.f is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
5905  Z3_func_interp_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.f)
5906 
5907  def else_value(self):
5908  """
5909  Return the `else` value for a function interpretation.
5910  Return None if Z3 did not specify the `else` value for
5911  this object.
5912 
5913  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
5914  >>> s = Solver()
5915  >>> s.add(f(0) == 1, f(1) == 1, f(2) == 0)
5916  >>> s.check()
5917  sat
5918  >>> m = s.model()
5919  >>> m[f]
5920  [2 -> 0, else -> 1]
5921  >>> m[f].else_value()
5922  1
5923  """
5924  r = Z3_func_interp_get_else(self.ctx.ref(), self.f)
5925  if r:
5926  return _to_expr_ref(r, self.ctx)
5927  else:
5928  return None
5929 
5930  def num_entries(self):
5931  """Return the number of entries/points in the function interpretation `self`.
5932 
5933  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
5934  >>> s = Solver()
5935  >>> s.add(f(0) == 1, f(1) == 1, f(2) == 0)
5936  >>> s.check()
5937  sat
5938  >>> m = s.model()
5939  >>> m[f]
5940  [2 -> 0, else -> 1]
5941  >>> m[f].num_entries()
5942  1
5943  """
5944  return int(Z3_func_interp_get_num_entries(self.ctx.ref(), self.f))
5945 
5946  def arity(self):
5947  """Return the number of arguments for each entry in the function interpretation `self`.
5948 
5949  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
5950  >>> s = Solver()
5951  >>> s.add(f(0) == 1, f(1) == 1, f(2) == 0)
5952  >>> s.check()
5953  sat
5954  >>> m = s.model()
5955  >>> m[f].arity()
5956  1
5957  """
5958  return int(Z3_func_interp_get_arity(self.ctx.ref(), self.f))
5959 
5960  def entry(self, idx):
5961  """Return an entry at position `idx < self.num_entries()` in the function interpretation `self`.
5962 
5963  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
5964  >>> s = Solver()
5965  >>> s.add(f(0) == 1, f(1) == 1, f(2) == 0)
5966  >>> s.check()
5967  sat
5968  >>> m = s.model()
5969  >>> m[f]
5970  [2 -> 0, else -> 1]
5971  >>> m[f].num_entries()
5972  1
5973  >>> m[f].entry(0)
5974  [2, 0]
5975  """
5976  if idx >= self.num_entries():
5977  raise IndexError
5978  return FuncEntry(Z3_func_interp_get_entry(self.ctx.ref(), self.f, idx), self.ctx)
5979 
5980  def translate(self, other_ctx):
5981  """Copy model 'self' to context 'other_ctx'.
5982  """
5983  return ModelRef(Z3_model_translate(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, other_ctx.ref()), other_ctx)
5984 
5985  def __copy__(self):
5986  return self.translate(self.ctx)
5987 
5988  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
5989  return self.translate(self.ctx)
5990 
5991  def as_list(self):
5992  """Return the function interpretation as a Python list.
5993  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
5994  >>> s = Solver()
5995  >>> s.add(f(0) == 1, f(1) == 1, f(2) == 0)
5996  >>> s.check()
5997  sat
5998  >>> m = s.model()
5999  >>> m[f]
6000  [2 -> 0, else -> 1]
6001  >>> m[f].as_list()
6002  [[2, 0], 1]
6003  """
6004  r = [ self.entry(i).as_list() for i in range(self.num_entries())]
6005  r.append(self.else_value())
6006  return r
6007 
6008  def __repr__(self):
6009  return obj_to_string(self)
6010 
6011 class ModelRef(Z3PPObject):
6012  """Model/Solution of a satisfiability problem (aka system of constraints)."""
6013 
6014  def __init__(self, m, ctx):
6015  assert ctx is not None
6016  self.model = m
6017  self.ctx = ctx
6018  Z3_model_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)
6019 
6020  def __del__(self):
6021  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
6022  Z3_model_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)
6023 
6024  def __repr__(self):
6025  return obj_to_string(self)
6026 
6027  def sexpr(self):
6028  """Return a textual representation of the s-expression representing the model."""
6029  return Z3_model_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)
6030 
6031  def eval(self, t, model_completion=False):
6032  """Evaluate the expression `t` in the model `self`. If `model_completion` is enabled, then a default interpretation is automatically added for symbols that do not have an interpretation in the model `self`.
6033 
6034  >>> x = Int('x')
6035  >>> s = Solver()
6036  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2)
6037  >>> s.check()
6038  sat
6039  >>> m = s.model()
6040  >>> m.eval(x + 1)
6041  2
6042  >>> m.eval(x == 1)
6043  True
6044  >>> y = Int('y')
6045  >>> m.eval(y + x)
6046  1 + y
6047  >>> m.eval(y)
6048  y
6049  >>> m.eval(y, model_completion=True)
6050  0
6051  >>> # Now, m contains an interpretation for y
6052  >>> m.eval(y + x)
6053  1
6054  """
6055  r = (Ast * 1)()
6056  if Z3_model_eval(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, t.as_ast(), model_completion, r):
6057  return _to_expr_ref(r[0], self.ctx)
6058  raise Z3Exception("failed to evaluate expression in the model")
6059 
6060  def evaluate(self, t, model_completion=False):
6061  """Alias for `eval`.
6062 
6063  >>> x = Int('x')
6064  >>> s = Solver()
6065  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2)
6066  >>> s.check()
6067  sat
6068  >>> m = s.model()
6069  >>> m.evaluate(x + 1)
6070  2
6071  >>> m.evaluate(x == 1)
6072  True
6073  >>> y = Int('y')
6074  >>> m.evaluate(y + x)
6075  1 + y
6076  >>> m.evaluate(y)
6077  y
6078  >>> m.evaluate(y, model_completion=True)
6079  0
6080  >>> # Now, m contains an interpretation for y
6081  >>> m.evaluate(y + x)
6082  1
6083  """
6084  return self.eval(t, model_completion)
6085 
6086  def __len__(self):
6087  """Return the number of constant and function declarations in the model `self`.
6088 
6089  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
6090  >>> x = Int('x')
6091  >>> s = Solver()
6092  >>> s.add(x > 0, f(x) != x)
6093  >>> s.check()
6094  sat
6095  >>> m = s.model()
6096  >>> len(m)
6097  2
6098  """
6099  return int(Z3_model_get_num_consts(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)) + int(Z3_model_get_num_funcs(self.ctx.ref(), self.model))
6100 
6101  def get_interp(self, decl):
6102  """Return the interpretation for a given declaration or constant.
6103 
6104  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
6105  >>> x = Int('x')
6106  >>> s = Solver()
6107  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2, f(x) == 0)
6108  >>> s.check()
6109  sat
6110  >>> m = s.model()
6111  >>> m[x]
6112  1
6113  >>> m[f]
6114  [else -> 0]
6115  """
6116  if z3_debug():
6117  _z3_assert(isinstance(decl, FuncDeclRef) or is_const(decl), "Z3 declaration expected")
6118  if is_const(decl):
6119  decl = decl.decl()
6120  try:
6121  if decl.arity() == 0:
6122  _r = Z3_model_get_const_interp(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, decl.ast)
6123  if _r.value is None:
6124  return None
6125  r = _to_expr_ref(_r, self.ctx)
6126  if is_as_array(r):
6127  return self.get_interp(get_as_array_func(r))
6128  else:
6129  return r
6130  else:
6131  return FuncInterp(Z3_model_get_func_interp(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, decl.ast), self.ctx)
6132  except Z3Exception:
6133  return None
6134 
6135  def num_sorts(self):
6136  """Return the number of uninterpreted sorts that contain an interpretation in the model `self`.
6137 
6138  >>> A = DeclareSort('A')
6139  >>> a, b = Consts('a b', A)
6140  >>> s = Solver()
6141  >>> s.add(a != b)
6142  >>> s.check()
6143  sat
6144  >>> m = s.model()
6145  >>> m.num_sorts()
6146  1
6147  """
6148  return int(Z3_model_get_num_sorts(self.ctx.ref(), self.model))
6149 
6150  def get_sort(self, idx):
6151  """Return the uninterpreted sort at position `idx` < self.num_sorts().
6152 
6153  >>> A = DeclareSort('A')
6154  >>> B = DeclareSort('B')
6155  >>> a1, a2 = Consts('a1 a2', A)
6156  >>> b1, b2 = Consts('b1 b2', B)
6157  >>> s = Solver()
6158  >>> s.add(a1 != a2, b1 != b2)
6159  >>> s.check()
6160  sat
6161  >>> m = s.model()
6162  >>> m.num_sorts()
6163  2
6164  >>> m.get_sort(0)
6165  A
6166  >>> m.get_sort(1)
6167  B
6168  """
6169  if idx >= self.num_sorts():
6170  raise IndexError
6171  return _to_sort_ref(Z3_model_get_sort(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, idx), self.ctx)
6172 
6173  def sorts(self):
6174  """Return all uninterpreted sorts that have an interpretation in the model `self`.
6175 
6176  >>> A = DeclareSort('A')
6177  >>> B = DeclareSort('B')
6178  >>> a1, a2 = Consts('a1 a2', A)
6179  >>> b1, b2 = Consts('b1 b2', B)
6180  >>> s = Solver()
6181  >>> s.add(a1 != a2, b1 != b2)
6182  >>> s.check()
6183  sat
6184  >>> m = s.model()
6185  >>> m.sorts()
6186  [A, B]
6187  """
6188  return [ self.get_sort(i) for i in range(self.num_sorts()) ]
6189 
6190  def get_universe(self, s):
6191  """Return the interpretation for the uninterpreted sort `s` in the model `self`.
6192 
6193  >>> A = DeclareSort('A')
6194  >>> a, b = Consts('a b', A)
6195  >>> s = Solver()
6196  >>> s.add(a != b)
6197  >>> s.check()
6198  sat
6199  >>> m = s.model()
6200  >>> m.get_universe(A)
6201  [A!val!0, A!val!1]
6202  """
6203  if z3_debug():
6204  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, SortRef), "Z3 sort expected")
6205  try:
6206  return AstVector(Z3_model_get_sort_universe(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, s.ast), self.ctx)
6207  except Z3Exception:
6208  return None
6209 
6210  def __getitem__(self, idx):
6211  """If `idx` is an integer, then the declaration at position `idx` in the model `self` is returned. If `idx` is a declaration, then the actual interpretation is returned.
6212 
6213  The elements can be retrieved using position or the actual declaration.
6214 
6215  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
6216  >>> x = Int('x')
6217  >>> s = Solver()
6218  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2, f(x) == 0)
6219  >>> s.check()
6220  sat
6221  >>> m = s.model()
6222  >>> len(m)
6223  2
6224  >>> m[0]
6225  x
6226  >>> m[1]
6227  f
6228  >>> m[x]
6229  1
6230  >>> m[f]
6231  [else -> 0]
6232  >>> for d in m: print("%s -> %s" % (d, m[d]))
6233  x -> 1
6234  f -> [else -> 0]
6235  """
6236  if _is_int(idx):
6237  if idx >= len(self):
6238  raise IndexError
6239  num_consts = Z3_model_get_num_consts(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)
6240  if (idx < num_consts):
6241  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_model_get_const_decl(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, idx), self.ctx)
6242  else:
6243  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_model_get_func_decl(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, idx - num_consts), self.ctx)
6244  if isinstance(idx, FuncDeclRef):
6245  return self.get_interp(idx)
6246  if is_const(idx):
6247  return self.get_interp(idx.decl())
6248  if isinstance(idx, SortRef):
6249  return self.get_universe(idx)
6250  if z3_debug():
6251  _z3_assert(False, "Integer, Z3 declaration, or Z3 constant expected")
6252  return None
6253 
6254  def decls(self):
6255  """Return a list with all symbols that have an interpretation in the model `self`.
6256  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
6257  >>> x = Int('x')
6258  >>> s = Solver()
6259  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2, f(x) == 0)
6260  >>> s.check()
6261  sat
6262  >>> m = s.model()
6263  >>> m.decls()
6264  [x, f]
6265  """
6266  r = []
6267  for i in range(Z3_model_get_num_consts(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)):
6268  r.append(FuncDeclRef(Z3_model_get_const_decl(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, i), self.ctx))
6269  for i in range(Z3_model_get_num_funcs(self.ctx.ref(), self.model)):
6270  r.append(FuncDeclRef(Z3_model_get_func_decl(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, i), self.ctx))
6271  return r
6272 
6273  def translate(self, target):
6274  """Translate `self` to the context `target`. That is, return a copy of `self` in the context `target`.
6275  """
6276  if z3_debug():
6277  _z3_assert(isinstance(target, Context), "argument must be a Z3 context")
6278  model = Z3_model_translate(self.ctx.ref(), self.model, target.ref())
6279  return ModelRef(model, target)
6280 
6281  def __copy__(self):
6282  return self.translate(self.ctx)
6283 
6284  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
6285  return self.translate(self.ctx)
6286 
6287 def Model(ctx = None):
6288  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
6289  return ModelRef(Z3_mk_model(ctx.ref()), ctx)
6290 
6291 def is_as_array(n):
6292  """Return true if n is a Z3 expression of the form (_ as-array f)."""
6293  return isinstance(n, ExprRef) and Z3_is_as_array(n.ctx.ref(), n.as_ast())
6294 
6295 def get_as_array_func(n):
6296  """Return the function declaration f associated with a Z3 expression of the form (_ as-array f)."""
6297  if z3_debug():
6298  _z3_assert(is_as_array(n), "as-array Z3 expression expected.")
6299  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_get_as_array_func_decl(n.ctx.ref(), n.as_ast()), n.ctx)
6300 
6301 #########################################
6302 #
6303 # Statistics
6304 #
6305 #########################################
6306 class Statistics:
6307  """Statistics for `Solver.check()`."""
6308 
6309  def __init__(self, stats, ctx):
6310  self.stats = stats
6311  self.ctx = ctx
6312  Z3_stats_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats)
6313 
6314  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
6315  return Statistics(self.stats, self.ctx)
6316 
6317  def __del__(self):
6318  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
6319  Z3_stats_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats)
6320 
6321  def __repr__(self):
6322  if in_html_mode():
6323  out = io.StringIO()
6324  even = True
6325  out.write(u('<table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0">'))
6326  for k, v in self:
6327  if even:
6328  out.write(u('<tr style="background-color:#CFCFCF">'))
6329  even = False
6330  else:
6331  out.write(u('<tr>'))
6332  even = True
6333  out.write(u('<td>%s</td><td>%s</td></tr>' % (k, v)))
6334  out.write(u('</table>'))
6335  return out.getvalue()
6336  else:
6337  return Z3_stats_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats)
6338 
6339  def __len__(self):
6340  """Return the number of statistical counters.
6341 
6342  >>> x = Int('x')
6343  >>> s = Then('simplify', 'nlsat').solver()
6344  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6345  >>> s.check()
6346  sat
6347  >>> st = s.statistics()
6348  >>> len(st)
6349  6
6350  """
6351  return int(Z3_stats_size(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats))
6352 
6353  def __getitem__(self, idx):
6354  """Return the value of statistical counter at position `idx`. The result is a pair (key, value).
6355 
6356  >>> x = Int('x')
6357  >>> s = Then('simplify', 'nlsat').solver()
6358  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6359  >>> s.check()
6360  sat
6361  >>> st = s.statistics()
6362  >>> len(st)
6363  6
6364  >>> st[0]
6365  ('nlsat propagations', 2)
6366  >>> st[1]
6367  ('nlsat stages', 2)
6368  """
6369  if idx >= len(self):
6370  raise IndexError
6371  if Z3_stats_is_uint(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx):
6372  val = int(Z3_stats_get_uint_value(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx))
6373  else:
6374  val = Z3_stats_get_double_value(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx)
6375  return (Z3_stats_get_key(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx), val)
6376 
6377  def keys(self):
6378  """Return the list of statistical counters.
6379 
6380  >>> x = Int('x')
6381  >>> s = Then('simplify', 'nlsat').solver()
6382  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6383  >>> s.check()
6384  sat
6385  >>> st = s.statistics()
6386  """
6387  return [Z3_stats_get_key(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx) for idx in range(len(self))]
6388 
6389  def get_key_value(self, key):
6390  """Return the value of a particular statistical counter.
6391 
6392  >>> x = Int('x')
6393  >>> s = Then('simplify', 'nlsat').solver()
6394  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6395  >>> s.check()
6396  sat
6397  >>> st = s.statistics()
6398  >>> st.get_key_value('nlsat propagations')
6399  2
6400  """
6401  for idx in range(len(self)):
6402  if key == Z3_stats_get_key(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx):
6403  if Z3_stats_is_uint(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx):
6404  return int(Z3_stats_get_uint_value(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx))
6405  else:
6406  return Z3_stats_get_double_value(self.ctx.ref(), self.stats, idx)
6407  raise Z3Exception("unknown key")
6408 
6409  def __getattr__(self, name):
6410  """Access the value of statistical using attributes.
6411 
6412  Remark: to access a counter containing blank spaces (e.g., 'nlsat propagations'),
6413  we should use '_' (e.g., 'nlsat_propagations').
6414 
6415  >>> x = Int('x')
6416  >>> s = Then('simplify', 'nlsat').solver()
6417  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6418  >>> s.check()
6419  sat
6420  >>> st = s.statistics()
6421  >>> st.nlsat_propagations
6422  2
6423  >>> st.nlsat_stages
6424  2
6425  """
6426  key = name.replace('_', ' ')
6427  try:
6428  return self.get_key_value(key)
6429  except Z3Exception:
6430  raise AttributeError
6431 
6432 #########################################
6433 #
6434 # Solver
6435 #
6436 #########################################
6437 class CheckSatResult:
6438  """Represents the result of a satisfiability check: sat, unsat, unknown.
6439 
6440  >>> s = Solver()
6441  >>> s.check()
6442  sat
6443  >>> r = s.check()
6444  >>> isinstance(r, CheckSatResult)
6445  True
6446  """
6447 
6448  def __init__(self, r):
6449  self.r = r
6450 
6451  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
6452  return CheckSatResult(self.r)
6453 
6454  def __eq__(self, other):
6455  return isinstance(other, CheckSatResult) and self.r == other.r
6456 
6457  def __ne__(self, other):
6458  return not self.__eq__(other)
6459 
6460  def __repr__(self):
6461  if in_html_mode():
6462  if self.r == Z3_L_TRUE:
6463  return "<b>sat</b>"
6464  elif self.r == Z3_L_FALSE:
6465  return "<b>unsat</b>"
6466  else:
6467  return "<b>unknown</b>"
6468  else:
6469  if self.r == Z3_L_TRUE:
6470  return "sat"
6471  elif self.r == Z3_L_FALSE:
6472  return "unsat"
6473  else:
6474  return "unknown"
6475 
6476  def _repr_html_(self):
6477  in_html = in_html_mode()
6478  set_html_mode(True)
6479  res = repr(self)
6480  set_html_mode(in_html)
6481  return res
6482 
6483 sat = CheckSatResult(Z3_L_TRUE)
6484 unsat = CheckSatResult(Z3_L_FALSE)
6485 unknown = CheckSatResult(Z3_L_UNDEF)
6486 
6487 class Solver(Z3PPObject):
6488  """Solver API provides methods for implementing the main SMT 2.0 commands: push, pop, check, get-model, etc."""
6489 
6490  def __init__(self, solver=None, ctx=None, logFile=None):
6491  assert solver is None or ctx is not None
6492  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
6493  self.backtrack_level = 4000000000
6494  self.solver = None
6495  if solver is None:
6496  self.solver = Z3_mk_solver(self.ctx.ref())
6497  else:
6498  self.solver = solver
6499  Z3_solver_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6500  if logFile is not None:
6501  self.set("smtlib2_log", logFile)
6502 
6503  def __del__(self):
6504  if self.solver is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
6505  Z3_solver_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6506 
6507  def set(self, *args, **keys):
6508  """Set a configuration option. The method `help()` return a string containing all available options.
6509 
6510  >>> s = Solver()
6511  >>> # The option MBQI can be set using three different approaches.
6512  >>> s.set(mbqi=True)
6513  >>> s.set('MBQI', True)
6514  >>> s.set(':mbqi', True)
6515  """
6516  p = args2params(args, keys, self.ctx)
6517  Z3_solver_set_params(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, p.params)
6518 
6519  def push(self):
6520  """Create a backtracking point.
6521 
6522  >>> x = Int('x')
6523  >>> s = Solver()
6524  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6525  >>> s
6526  [x > 0]
6527  >>> s.push()
6528  >>> s.add(x < 1)
6529  >>> s
6530  [x > 0, x < 1]
6531  >>> s.check()
6532  unsat
6533  >>> s.pop()
6534  >>> s.check()
6535  sat
6536  >>> s
6537  [x > 0]
6538  """
6539  Z3_solver_push(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6540 
6541  def pop(self, num=1):
6542  """Backtrack \c num backtracking points.
6543 
6544  >>> x = Int('x')
6545  >>> s = Solver()
6546  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6547  >>> s
6548  [x > 0]
6549  >>> s.push()
6550  >>> s.add(x < 1)
6551  >>> s
6552  [x > 0, x < 1]
6553  >>> s.check()
6554  unsat
6555  >>> s.pop()
6556  >>> s.check()
6557  sat
6558  >>> s
6559  [x > 0]
6560  """
6561  Z3_solver_pop(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, num)
6562 
6563  def num_scopes(self):
6564  """Return the current number of backtracking points.
6565 
6566  >>> s = Solver()
6567  >>> s.num_scopes()
6568  0L
6569  >>> s.push()
6570  >>> s.num_scopes()
6571  1L
6572  >>> s.push()
6573  >>> s.num_scopes()
6574  2L
6575  >>> s.pop()
6576  >>> s.num_scopes()
6577  1L
6578  """
6579  return Z3_solver_get_num_scopes(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6580 
6581  def reset(self):
6582  """Remove all asserted constraints and backtracking points created using `push()`.
6583 
6584  >>> x = Int('x')
6585  >>> s = Solver()
6586  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6587  >>> s
6588  [x > 0]
6589  >>> s.reset()
6590  >>> s
6591  []
6592  """
6593  Z3_solver_reset(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6594 
6595  def assert_exprs(self, *args):
6596  """Assert constraints into the solver.
6597 
6598  >>> x = Int('x')
6599  >>> s = Solver()
6600  >>> s.assert_exprs(x > 0, x < 2)
6601  >>> s
6602  [x > 0, x < 2]
6603  """
6604  args = _get_args(args)
6605  s = BoolSort(self.ctx)
6606  for arg in args:
6607  if isinstance(arg, Goal) or isinstance(arg, AstVector):
6608  for f in arg:
6609  Z3_solver_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, f.as_ast())
6610  else:
6611  arg = s.cast(arg)
6612  Z3_solver_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, arg.as_ast())
6613 
6614  def add(self, *args):
6615  """Assert constraints into the solver.
6616 
6617  >>> x = Int('x')
6618  >>> s = Solver()
6619  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2)
6620  >>> s
6621  [x > 0, x < 2]
6622  """
6623  self.assert_exprs(*args)
6624 
6625  def __iadd__(self, fml):
6626  self.add(fml)
6627  return self
6628 
6629  def append(self, *args):
6630  """Assert constraints into the solver.
6631 
6632  >>> x = Int('x')
6633  >>> s = Solver()
6634  >>> s.append(x > 0, x < 2)
6635  >>> s
6636  [x > 0, x < 2]
6637  """
6638  self.assert_exprs(*args)
6639 
6640  def insert(self, *args):
6641  """Assert constraints into the solver.
6642 
6643  >>> x = Int('x')
6644  >>> s = Solver()
6645  >>> s.insert(x > 0, x < 2)
6646  >>> s
6647  [x > 0, x < 2]
6648  """
6649  self.assert_exprs(*args)
6650 
6651  def assert_and_track(self, a, p):
6652  """Assert constraint `a` and track it in the unsat core using the Boolean constant `p`.
6653 
6654  If `p` is a string, it will be automatically converted into a Boolean constant.
6655 
6656  >>> x = Int('x')
6657  >>> p3 = Bool('p3')
6658  >>> s = Solver()
6659  >>> s.set(unsat_core=True)
6660  >>> s.assert_and_track(x > 0, 'p1')
6661  >>> s.assert_and_track(x != 1, 'p2')
6662  >>> s.assert_and_track(x < 0, p3)
6663  >>> print(s.check())
6664  unsat
6665  >>> c = s.unsat_core()
6666  >>> len(c)
6667  2
6668  >>> Bool('p1') in c
6669  True
6670  >>> Bool('p2') in c
6671  False
6672  >>> p3 in c
6673  True
6674  """
6675  if isinstance(p, str):
6676  p = Bool(p, self.ctx)
6677  _z3_assert(isinstance(a, BoolRef), "Boolean expression expected")
6678  _z3_assert(isinstance(p, BoolRef) and is_const(p), "Boolean expression expected")
6679  Z3_solver_assert_and_track(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, a.as_ast(), p.as_ast())
6680 
6681  def check(self, *assumptions):
6682  """Check whether the assertions in the given solver plus the optional assumptions are consistent or not.
6683 
6684  >>> x = Int('x')
6685  >>> s = Solver()
6686  >>> s.check()
6687  sat
6688  >>> s.add(x > 0, x < 2)
6689  >>> s.check()
6690  sat
6691  >>> s.model().eval(x)
6692  1
6693  >>> s.add(x < 1)
6694  >>> s.check()
6695  unsat
6696  >>> s.reset()
6697  >>> s.add(2**x == 4)
6698  >>> s.check()
6699  unknown
6700  """
6701  s = BoolSort(self.ctx)
6702  assumptions = _get_args(assumptions)
6703  num = len(assumptions)
6704  _assumptions = (Ast * num)()
6705  for i in range(num):
6706  _assumptions[i] = s.cast(assumptions[i]).as_ast()
6707  r = Z3_solver_check_assumptions(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, num, _assumptions)
6708  return CheckSatResult(r)
6709 
6710  def model(self):
6711  """Return a model for the last `check()`.
6712 
6713  This function raises an exception if
6714  a model is not available (e.g., last `check()` returned unsat).
6715 
6716  >>> s = Solver()
6717  >>> a = Int('a')
6718  >>> s.add(a + 2 == 0)
6719  >>> s.check()
6720  sat
6721  >>> s.model()
6722  [a = -2]
6723  """
6724  try:
6725  return ModelRef(Z3_solver_get_model(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6726  except Z3Exception:
6727  raise Z3Exception("model is not available")
6728 
6729  def import_model_converter(self, other):
6730  """Import model converter from other into the current solver"""
6731  Z3_solver_import_model_converter(self.ctx.ref(), other.solver, self.solver)
6732 
6733  def unsat_core(self):
6734  """Return a subset (as an AST vector) of the assumptions provided to the last check().
6735 
6736  These are the assumptions Z3 used in the unsatisfiability proof.
6737  Assumptions are available in Z3. They are used to extract unsatisfiable cores.
6738  They may be also used to "retract" assumptions. Note that, assumptions are not really
6739  "soft constraints", but they can be used to implement them.
6740 
6741  >>> p1, p2, p3 = Bools('p1 p2 p3')
6742  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
6743  >>> s = Solver()
6744  >>> s.add(Implies(p1, x > 0))
6745  >>> s.add(Implies(p2, y > x))
6746  >>> s.add(Implies(p2, y < 1))
6747  >>> s.add(Implies(p3, y > -3))
6748  >>> s.check(p1, p2, p3)
6749  unsat
6750  >>> core = s.unsat_core()
6751  >>> len(core)
6752  2
6753  >>> p1 in core
6754  True
6755  >>> p2 in core
6756  True
6757  >>> p3 in core
6758  False
6759  >>> # "Retracting" p2
6760  >>> s.check(p1, p3)
6761  sat
6762  """
6763  return AstVector(Z3_solver_get_unsat_core(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6764 
6765  def consequences(self, assumptions, variables):
6766  """Determine fixed values for the variables based on the solver state and assumptions.
6767  >>> s = Solver()
6768  >>> a, b, c, d = Bools('a b c d')
6769  >>> s.add(Implies(a,b), Implies(b, c))
6770  >>> s.consequences([a],[b,c,d])
6771  (sat, [Implies(a, b), Implies(a, c)])
6772  >>> s.consequences([Not(c),d],[a,b,c,d])
6773  (sat, [Implies(d, d), Implies(Not(c), Not(c)), Implies(Not(c), Not(b)), Implies(Not(c), Not(a))])
6774  """
6775  if isinstance(assumptions, list):
6776  _asms = AstVector(None, self.ctx)
6777  for a in assumptions:
6778  _asms.push(a)
6779  assumptions = _asms
6780  if isinstance(variables, list):
6781  _vars = AstVector(None, self.ctx)
6782  for a in variables:
6783  _vars.push(a)
6784  variables = _vars
6785  _z3_assert(isinstance(assumptions, AstVector), "ast vector expected")
6786  _z3_assert(isinstance(variables, AstVector), "ast vector expected")
6787  consequences = AstVector(None, self.ctx)
6788  r = Z3_solver_get_consequences(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, assumptions.vector, variables.vector, consequences.vector)
6789  sz = len(consequences)
6790  consequences = [ consequences[i] for i in range(sz) ]
6791  return CheckSatResult(r), consequences
6792 
6793  def from_file(self, filename):
6794  """Parse assertions from a file"""
6795  Z3_solver_from_file(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, filename)
6796 
6797  def from_string(self, s):
6798  """Parse assertions from a string"""
6799  Z3_solver_from_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, s)
6800 
6801  def cube(self, vars = None):
6802  """Get set of cubes
6803  The method takes an optional set of variables that restrict which
6804  variables may be used as a starting point for cubing.
6805  If vars is not None, then the first case split is based on a variable in
6806  this set.
6807  """
6808  self.cube_vs = AstVector(None, self.ctx)
6809  if vars is not None:
6810  for v in vars:
6811  self.cube_vs.push(v)
6812  while True:
6813  lvl = self.backtrack_level
6814  self.backtrack_level = 4000000000
6815  r = AstVector(Z3_solver_cube(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, self.cube_vs.vector, lvl), self.ctx)
6816  if (len(r) == 1 and is_false(r[0])):
6817  return
6818  yield r
6819  if (len(r) == 0):
6820  return
6821 
6822  def cube_vars(self):
6823  """Access the set of variables that were touched by the most recently generated cube.
6824  This set of variables can be used as a starting point for additional cubes.
6825  The idea is that variables that appear in clauses that are reduced by the most recent
6826  cube are likely more useful to cube on."""
6827  return self.cube_vs
6828 
6829  def proof(self):
6830  """Return a proof for the last `check()`. Proof construction must be enabled."""
6831  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_solver_get_proof(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6832 
6833  def assertions(self):
6834  """Return an AST vector containing all added constraints.
6835 
6836  >>> s = Solver()
6837  >>> s.assertions()
6838  []
6839  >>> a = Int('a')
6840  >>> s.add(a > 0)
6841  >>> s.add(a < 10)
6842  >>> s.assertions()
6843  [a > 0, a < 10]
6844  """
6845  return AstVector(Z3_solver_get_assertions(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6846 
6847  def units(self):
6848  """Return an AST vector containing all currently inferred units.
6849  """
6850  return AstVector(Z3_solver_get_units(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6851 
6852  def non_units(self):
6853  """Return an AST vector containing all atomic formulas in solver state that are not units.
6854  """
6855  return AstVector(Z3_solver_get_non_units(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6856 
6857  def trail_levels(self):
6858  """Return trail and decision levels of the solver state after a check() call.
6859  """
6860  trail = self.trail()
6861  levels = (ctypes.c_uint * len(trail))()
6862  Z3_solver_get_levels(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, trail.vector, len(trail), levels)
6863  return trail, levels
6864 
6865  def trail(self):
6866  """Return trail of the solver state after a check() call.
6867  """
6868  return AstVector(Z3_solver_get_trail(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6869 
6870  def statistics(self):
6871  """Return statistics for the last `check()`.
6872 
6873  >>> s = SimpleSolver()
6874  >>> x = Int('x')
6875  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6876  >>> s.check()
6877  sat
6878  >>> st = s.statistics()
6879  >>> st.get_key_value('final checks')
6880  1
6881  >>> len(st) > 0
6882  True
6883  >>> st[0] != 0
6884  True
6885  """
6886  return Statistics(Z3_solver_get_statistics(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6887 
6888  def reason_unknown(self):
6889  """Return a string describing why the last `check()` returned `unknown`.
6890 
6891  >>> x = Int('x')
6892  >>> s = SimpleSolver()
6893  >>> s.add(2**x == 4)
6894  >>> s.check()
6895  unknown
6896  >>> s.reason_unknown()
6897  '(incomplete (theory arithmetic))'
6898  """
6899  return Z3_solver_get_reason_unknown(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6900 
6901  def help(self):
6902  """Display a string describing all available options."""
6903  print(Z3_solver_get_help(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver))
6904 
6905  def param_descrs(self):
6906  """Return the parameter description set."""
6907  return ParamDescrsRef(Z3_solver_get_param_descrs(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver), self.ctx)
6908 
6909  def __repr__(self):
6910  """Return a formatted string with all added constraints."""
6911  return obj_to_string(self)
6912 
6913  def translate(self, target):
6914  """Translate `self` to the context `target`. That is, return a copy of `self` in the context `target`.
6915 
6916  >>> c1 = Context()
6917  >>> c2 = Context()
6918  >>> s1 = Solver(ctx=c1)
6919  >>> s2 = s1.translate(c2)
6920  """
6921  if z3_debug():
6922  _z3_assert(isinstance(target, Context), "argument must be a Z3 context")
6923  solver = Z3_solver_translate(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, target.ref())
6924  return Solver(solver, target)
6925 
6926  def __copy__(self):
6927  return self.translate(self.ctx)
6928 
6929  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
6930  return self.translate(self.ctx)
6931 
6932  def sexpr(self):
6933  """Return a formatted string (in Lisp-like format) with all added constraints. We say the string is in s-expression format.
6934 
6935  >>> x = Int('x')
6936  >>> s = Solver()
6937  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6938  >>> s.add(x < 2)
6939  >>> r = s.sexpr()
6940  """
6941  return Z3_solver_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver)
6942 
6943  def dimacs(self, include_names=True):
6944  """Return a textual representation of the solver in DIMACS format."""
6945  return Z3_solver_to_dimacs_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.solver, include_names)
6946 
6947  def to_smt2(self):
6948  """return SMTLIB2 formatted benchmark for solver's assertions"""
6949  es = self.assertions()
6950  sz = len(es)
6951  sz1 = sz
6952  if sz1 > 0:
6953  sz1 -= 1
6954  v = (Ast * sz1)()
6955  for i in range(sz1):
6956  v[i] = es[i].as_ast()
6957  if sz > 0:
6958  e = es[sz1].as_ast()
6959  else:
6960  e = BoolVal(True, self.ctx).as_ast()
6961  return Z3_benchmark_to_smtlib_string(self.ctx.ref(), "benchmark generated from python API", "", "unknown", "", sz1, v, e)
6962 
6963 def SolverFor(logic, ctx=None, logFile=None):
6964  """Create a solver customized for the given logic.
6965 
6966  The parameter `logic` is a string. It should be contains
6967  the name of a SMT-LIB logic.
6968  See http://www.smtlib.org/ for the name of all available logics.
6969 
6970  >>> s = SolverFor("QF_LIA")
6971  >>> x = Int('x')
6972  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6973  >>> s.add(x < 2)
6974  >>> s.check()
6975  sat
6976  >>> s.model()
6977  [x = 1]
6978  """
6979  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
6980  logic = to_symbol(logic)
6981  return Solver(Z3_mk_solver_for_logic(ctx.ref(), logic), ctx, logFile)
6982 
6983 def SimpleSolver(ctx=None, logFile=None):
6984  """Return a simple general purpose solver with limited amount of preprocessing.
6985 
6986  >>> s = SimpleSolver()
6987  >>> x = Int('x')
6988  >>> s.add(x > 0)
6989  >>> s.check()
6990  sat
6991  """
6992  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
6993  return Solver(Z3_mk_simple_solver(ctx.ref()), ctx, logFile)
6994 
6995 
7000 
7001 class Fixedpoint(Z3PPObject):
7002  """Fixedpoint API provides methods for solving with recursive predicates"""
7003 
7004  def __init__(self, fixedpoint=None, ctx=None):
7005  assert fixedpoint is None or ctx is not None
7006  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7007  self.fixedpoint = None
7008  if fixedpoint is None:
7009  self.fixedpoint = Z3_mk_fixedpoint(self.ctx.ref())
7010  else:
7011  self.fixedpoint = fixedpoint
7012  Z3_fixedpoint_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint)
7013  self.vars = []
7014 
7015  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
7016  return FixedPoint(self.fixedpoint, self.ctx)
7017 
7018  def __del__(self):
7019  if self.fixedpoint is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
7020  Z3_fixedpoint_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint)
7021 
7022  def set(self, *args, **keys):
7023  """Set a configuration option. The method `help()` return a string containing all available options.
7024  """
7025  p = args2params(args, keys, self.ctx)
7026  Z3_fixedpoint_set_params(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, p.params)
7027 
7028  def help(self):
7029  """Display a string describing all available options."""
7030  print(Z3_fixedpoint_get_help(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint))
7031 
7032  def param_descrs(self):
7033  """Return the parameter description set."""
7034  return ParamDescrsRef(Z3_fixedpoint_get_param_descrs(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint), self.ctx)
7035 
7036  def assert_exprs(self, *args):
7037  """Assert constraints as background axioms for the fixedpoint solver."""
7038  args = _get_args(args)
7039  s = BoolSort(self.ctx)
7040  for arg in args:
7041  if isinstance(arg, Goal) or isinstance(arg, AstVector):
7042  for f in arg:
7043  f = self.abstract(f)
7044  Z3_fixedpoint_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, f.as_ast())
7045  else:
7046  arg = s.cast(arg)
7047  arg = self.abstract(arg)
7048  Z3_fixedpoint_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, arg.as_ast())
7049 
7050  def add(self, *args):
7051  """Assert constraints as background axioms for the fixedpoint solver. Alias for assert_expr."""
7052  self.assert_exprs(*args)
7053 
7054  def __iadd__(self, fml):
7055  self.add(fml)
7056  return self
7057 
7058  def append(self, *args):
7059  """Assert constraints as background axioms for the fixedpoint solver. Alias for assert_expr."""
7060  self.assert_exprs(*args)
7061 
7062  def insert(self, *args):
7063  """Assert constraints as background axioms for the fixedpoint solver. Alias for assert_expr."""
7064  self.assert_exprs(*args)
7065 
7066  def add_rule(self, head, body = None, name = None):
7067  """Assert rules defining recursive predicates to the fixedpoint solver.
7068  >>> a = Bool('a')
7069  >>> b = Bool('b')
7070  >>> s = Fixedpoint()
7071  >>> s.register_relation(a.decl())
7072  >>> s.register_relation(b.decl())
7073  >>> s.fact(a)
7074  >>> s.rule(b, a)
7075  >>> s.query(b)
7076  sat
7077  """
7078  if name is None:
7079  name = ""
7080  name = to_symbol(name, self.ctx)
7081  if body is None:
7082  head = self.abstract(head)
7083  Z3_fixedpoint_add_rule(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, head.as_ast(), name)
7084  else:
7085  body = _get_args(body)
7086  f = self.abstract(Implies(And(body, self.ctx),head))
7087  Z3_fixedpoint_add_rule(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, f.as_ast(), name)
7088 
7089  def rule(self, head, body = None, name = None):
7090  """Assert rules defining recursive predicates to the fixedpoint solver. Alias for add_rule."""
7091  self.add_rule(head, body, name)
7092 
7093  def fact(self, head, name = None):
7094  """Assert facts defining recursive predicates to the fixedpoint solver. Alias for add_rule."""
7095  self.add_rule(head, None, name)
7096 
7097  def query(self, *query):
7098  """Query the fixedpoint engine whether formula is derivable.
7099  You can also pass an tuple or list of recursive predicates.
7100  """
7101  query = _get_args(query)
7102  sz = len(query)
7103  if sz >= 1 and isinstance(query[0], FuncDeclRef):
7104  _decls = (FuncDecl * sz)()
7105  i = 0
7106  for q in query:
7107  _decls[i] = q.ast
7108  i = i + 1
7109  r = Z3_fixedpoint_query_relations(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, sz, _decls)
7110  else:
7111  if sz == 1:
7112  query = query[0]
7113  else:
7114  query = And(query, self.ctx)
7115  query = self.abstract(query, False)
7116  r = Z3_fixedpoint_query(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, query.as_ast())
7117  return CheckSatResult(r)
7118 
7119  def query_from_lvl (self, lvl, *query):
7120  """Query the fixedpoint engine whether formula is derivable starting at the given query level.
7121  """
7122  query = _get_args(query)
7123  sz = len(query)
7124  if sz >= 1 and isinstance(query[0], FuncDecl):
7125  _z3_assert (False, "unsupported")
7126  else:
7127  if sz == 1:
7128  query = query[0]
7129  else:
7130  query = And(query)
7131  query = self.abstract(query, False)
7132  r = Z3_fixedpoint_query_from_lvl (self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, query.as_ast(), lvl)
7133  return CheckSatResult(r)
7134 
7135  def update_rule(self, head, body, name):
7136  """update rule"""
7137  if name is None:
7138  name = ""
7139  name = to_symbol(name, self.ctx)
7140  body = _get_args(body)
7141  f = self.abstract(Implies(And(body, self.ctx),head))
7142  Z3_fixedpoint_update_rule(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, f.as_ast(), name)
7143 
7144  def get_answer(self):
7145  """Retrieve answer from last query call."""
7146  r = Z3_fixedpoint_get_answer(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint)
7147  return _to_expr_ref(r, self.ctx)
7148 
7149  def get_ground_sat_answer(self):
7150  """Retrieve a ground cex from last query call."""
7151  r = Z3_fixedpoint_get_ground_sat_answer(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint)
7152  return _to_expr_ref(r, self.ctx)
7153 
7154  def get_rules_along_trace(self):
7155  """retrieve rules along the counterexample trace"""
7156  return AstVector(Z3_fixedpoint_get_rules_along_trace(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint), self.ctx)
7157 
7158  def get_rule_names_along_trace(self):
7159  """retrieve rule names along the counterexample trace"""
7160  # this is a hack as I don't know how to return a list of symbols from C++;
7161  # obtain names as a single string separated by semicolons
7162  names = _symbol2py (self.ctx, Z3_fixedpoint_get_rule_names_along_trace(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint))
7163  # split into individual names
7164  return names.split (';')
7165 
7166  def get_num_levels(self, predicate):
7167  """Retrieve number of levels used for predicate in PDR engine"""
7168  return Z3_fixedpoint_get_num_levels(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, predicate.ast)
7169 
7170  def get_cover_delta(self, level, predicate):
7171  """Retrieve properties known about predicate for the level'th unfolding. -1 is treated as the limit (infinity)"""
7172  r = Z3_fixedpoint_get_cover_delta(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, level, predicate.ast)
7173  return _to_expr_ref(r, self.ctx)
7174 
7175  def add_cover(self, level, predicate, property):
7176  """Add property to predicate for the level'th unfolding. -1 is treated as infinity (infinity)"""
7177  Z3_fixedpoint_add_cover(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, level, predicate.ast, property.ast)
7178 
7179  def register_relation(self, *relations):
7180  """Register relation as recursive"""
7181  relations = _get_args(relations)
7182  for f in relations:
7183  Z3_fixedpoint_register_relation(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, f.ast)
7184 
7185  def set_predicate_representation(self, f, *representations):
7186  """Control how relation is represented"""
7187  representations = _get_args(representations)
7188  representations = [to_symbol(s) for s in representations]
7189  sz = len(representations)
7190  args = (Symbol * sz)()
7191  for i in range(sz):
7192  args[i] = representations[i]
7193  Z3_fixedpoint_set_predicate_representation(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, f.ast, sz, args)
7194 
7195  def parse_string(self, s):
7196  """Parse rules and queries from a string"""
7197  return AstVector(Z3_fixedpoint_from_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, s), self.ctx)
7198 
7199  def parse_file(self, f):
7200  """Parse rules and queries from a file"""
7201  return AstVector(Z3_fixedpoint_from_file(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, f), self.ctx)
7202 
7203  def get_rules(self):
7204  """retrieve rules that have been added to fixedpoint context"""
7205  return AstVector(Z3_fixedpoint_get_rules(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint), self.ctx)
7206 
7207  def get_assertions(self):
7208  """retrieve assertions that have been added to fixedpoint context"""
7209  return AstVector(Z3_fixedpoint_get_assertions(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint), self.ctx)
7210 
7211  def __repr__(self):
7212  """Return a formatted string with all added rules and constraints."""
7213  return self.sexpr()
7214 
7215  def sexpr(self):
7216  """Return a formatted string (in Lisp-like format) with all added constraints. We say the string is in s-expression format.
7217  """
7218  return Z3_fixedpoint_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, 0, (Ast * 0)())
7219 
7220  def to_string(self, queries):
7221  """Return a formatted string (in Lisp-like format) with all added constraints.
7222  We say the string is in s-expression format.
7223  Include also queries.
7224  """
7225  args, len = _to_ast_array(queries)
7226  return Z3_fixedpoint_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint, len, args)
7227 
7228  def statistics(self):
7229  """Return statistics for the last `query()`.
7230  """
7231  return Statistics(Z3_fixedpoint_get_statistics(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint), self.ctx)
7232 
7233  def reason_unknown(self):
7234  """Return a string describing why the last `query()` returned `unknown`.
7235  """
7236  return Z3_fixedpoint_get_reason_unknown(self.ctx.ref(), self.fixedpoint)
7237 
7238  def declare_var(self, *vars):
7239  """Add variable or several variables.
7240  The added variable or variables will be bound in the rules
7241  and queries
7242  """
7243  vars = _get_args(vars)
7244  for v in vars:
7245  self.vars += [v]
7246 
7247  def abstract(self, fml, is_forall=True):
7248  if self.vars == []:
7249  return fml
7250  if is_forall:
7251  return ForAll(self.vars, fml)
7252  else:
7253  return Exists(self.vars, fml)
7254 
7255 
7256 
7261 
7262 class FiniteDomainSortRef(SortRef):
7263  """Finite domain sort."""
7264 
7265  def size(self):
7266  """Return the size of the finite domain sort"""
7267  r = (ctypes.c_ulonglong * 1)()
7268  if Z3_get_finite_domain_sort_size(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast, r):
7269  return r[0]
7270  else:
7271  raise Z3Exception("Failed to retrieve finite domain sort size")
7272 
7273 def FiniteDomainSort(name, sz, ctx=None):
7274  """Create a named finite domain sort of a given size sz"""
7275  if not isinstance(name, Symbol):
7276  name = to_symbol(name)
7277  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7278  return FiniteDomainSortRef(Z3_mk_finite_domain_sort(ctx.ref(), name, sz), ctx)
7279 
7280 def is_finite_domain_sort(s):
7281  """Return True if `s` is a Z3 finite-domain sort.
7282 
7283  >>> is_finite_domain_sort(FiniteDomainSort('S', 100))
7284  True
7285  >>> is_finite_domain_sort(IntSort())
7286  False
7287  """
7288  return isinstance(s, FiniteDomainSortRef)
7289 
7290 
7291 class FiniteDomainRef(ExprRef):
7292  """Finite-domain expressions."""
7293 
7294  def sort(self):
7295  """Return the sort of the finite-domain expression `self`."""
7296  return FiniteDomainSortRef(Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
7297 
7298  def as_string(self):
7299  """Return a Z3 floating point expression as a Python string."""
7300  return Z3_ast_to_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
7301 
7302 def is_finite_domain(a):
7303  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 finite-domain expression.
7304 
7305  >>> s = FiniteDomainSort('S', 100)
7306  >>> b = Const('b', s)
7307  >>> is_finite_domain(b)
7308  True
7309  >>> is_finite_domain(Int('x'))
7310  False
7311  """
7312  return isinstance(a, FiniteDomainRef)
7313 
7314 
7315 class FiniteDomainNumRef(FiniteDomainRef):
7316  """Integer values."""
7317 
7318  def as_long(self):
7319  """Return a Z3 finite-domain numeral as a Python long (bignum) numeral.
7320 
7321  >>> s = FiniteDomainSort('S', 100)
7322  >>> v = FiniteDomainVal(3, s)
7323  >>> v
7324  3
7325  >>> v.as_long() + 1
7326  4
7327  """
7328  return int(self.as_string())
7329 
7330  def as_string(self):
7331  """Return a Z3 finite-domain numeral as a Python string.
7332 
7333  >>> s = FiniteDomainSort('S', 100)
7334  >>> v = FiniteDomainVal(42, s)
7335  >>> v.as_string()
7336  '42'
7337  """
7338  return Z3_get_numeral_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
7339 
7340 
7341 def FiniteDomainVal(val, sort, ctx=None):
7342  """Return a Z3 finite-domain value. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
7343 
7344  >>> s = FiniteDomainSort('S', 256)
7345  >>> FiniteDomainVal(255, s)
7346  255
7347  >>> FiniteDomainVal('100', s)
7348  100
7349  """
7350  if z3_debug():
7351  _z3_assert(is_finite_domain_sort(sort), "Expected finite-domain sort" )
7352  ctx = sort.ctx
7353  return FiniteDomainNumRef(Z3_mk_numeral(ctx.ref(), _to_int_str(val), sort.ast), ctx)
7354 
7355 def is_finite_domain_value(a):
7356  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 finite-domain value.
7357 
7358  >>> s = FiniteDomainSort('S', 100)
7359  >>> b = Const('b', s)
7360  >>> is_finite_domain_value(b)
7361  False
7362  >>> b = FiniteDomainVal(10, s)
7363  >>> b
7364  10
7365  >>> is_finite_domain_value(b)
7366  True
7367  """
7368  return is_finite_domain(a) and _is_numeral(a.ctx, a.as_ast())
7369 
7370 
7371 
7376 
7377 class OptimizeObjective:
7378  def __init__(self, opt, value, is_max):
7379  self._opt = opt
7380  self._value = value
7381  self._is_max = is_max
7382 
7383  def lower(self):
7384  opt = self._opt
7385  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_optimize_get_lower(opt.ctx.ref(), opt.optimize, self._value), opt.ctx)
7386 
7387  def upper(self):
7388  opt = self._opt
7389  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_optimize_get_upper(opt.ctx.ref(), opt.optimize, self._value), opt.ctx)
7390 
7391  def lower_values(self):
7392  opt = self._opt
7393  return AstVector(Z3_optimize_get_lower_as_vector(opt.ctx.ref(), opt.optimize, self._value), opt.ctx)
7394 
7395  def upper_values(self):
7396  opt = self._opt
7397  return AstVector(Z3_optimize_get_upper_as_vector(opt.ctx.ref(), opt.optimize, self._value), opt.ctx)
7398 
7399  def value(self):
7400  if self._is_max:
7401  return self.upper()
7402  else:
7403  return self.lower()
7404 
7405  def __str__(self):
7406  return "%s:%s" % (self._value, self._is_max)
7407 
7408 
7409 class Optimize(Z3PPObject):
7410  """Optimize API provides methods for solving using objective functions and weighted soft constraints"""
7411 
7412  def __init__(self, ctx=None):
7413  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7414  self.optimize = Z3_mk_optimize(self.ctx.ref())
7415  Z3_optimize_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize)
7416 
7417  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
7418  return Optimize(self.optimize, self.ctx)
7419 
7420  def __del__(self):
7421  if self.optimize is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
7422  Z3_optimize_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize)
7423 
7424  def set(self, *args, **keys):
7425  """Set a configuration option. The method `help()` return a string containing all available options.
7426  """
7427  p = args2params(args, keys, self.ctx)
7428  Z3_optimize_set_params(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, p.params)
7429 
7430  def help(self):
7431  """Display a string describing all available options."""
7432  print(Z3_optimize_get_help(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize))
7433 
7434  def param_descrs(self):
7435  """Return the parameter description set."""
7436  return ParamDescrsRef(Z3_optimize_get_param_descrs(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize), self.ctx)
7437 
7438  def assert_exprs(self, *args):
7439  """Assert constraints as background axioms for the optimize solver."""
7440  args = _get_args(args)
7441  s = BoolSort(self.ctx)
7442  for arg in args:
7443  if isinstance(arg, Goal) or isinstance(arg, AstVector):
7444  for f in arg:
7445  Z3_optimize_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, f.as_ast())
7446  else:
7447  arg = s.cast(arg)
7448  Z3_optimize_assert(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, arg.as_ast())
7449 
7450  def add(self, *args):
7451  """Assert constraints as background axioms for the optimize solver. Alias for assert_expr."""
7452  self.assert_exprs(*args)
7453 
7454  def __iadd__(self, fml):
7455  self.add(fml)
7456  return self
7457 
7458  def assert_and_track(self, a, p):
7459  """Assert constraint `a` and track it in the unsat core using the Boolean constant `p`.
7460 
7461  If `p` is a string, it will be automatically converted into a Boolean constant.
7462 
7463  >>> x = Int('x')
7464  >>> p3 = Bool('p3')
7465  >>> s = Optimize()
7466  >>> s.assert_and_track(x > 0, 'p1')
7467  >>> s.assert_and_track(x != 1, 'p2')
7468  >>> s.assert_and_track(x < 0, p3)
7469  >>> print(s.check())
7470  unsat
7471  >>> c = s.unsat_core()
7472  >>> len(c)
7473  2
7474  >>> Bool('p1') in c
7475  True
7476  >>> Bool('p2') in c
7477  False
7478  >>> p3 in c
7479  True
7480  """
7481  if isinstance(p, str):
7482  p = Bool(p, self.ctx)
7483  _z3_assert(isinstance(a, BoolRef), "Boolean expression expected")
7484  _z3_assert(isinstance(p, BoolRef) and is_const(p), "Boolean expression expected")
7485  Z3_optimize_assert_and_track(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, a.as_ast(), p.as_ast())
7486 
7487  def add_soft(self, arg, weight = "1", id = None):
7488  """Add soft constraint with optional weight and optional identifier.
7489  If no weight is supplied, then the penalty for violating the soft constraint
7490  is 1.
7491  Soft constraints are grouped by identifiers. Soft constraints that are
7492  added without identifiers are grouped by default.
7493  """
7494  if _is_int(weight):
7495  weight = "%d" % weight
7496  elif isinstance(weight, float):
7497  weight = "%f" % weight
7498  if not isinstance(weight, str):
7499  raise Z3Exception("weight should be a string or an integer")
7500  if id is None:
7501  id = ""
7502  id = to_symbol(id, self.ctx)
7503  def asoft(a):
7504  v = Z3_optimize_assert_soft(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, a.as_ast(), weight, id)
7505  return OptimizeObjective(self, v, False)
7506  if isinstance(arg, iterable):
7507  return [asoft(a) for a in arg]
7508  return asoft(arg)
7509 
7510  def maximize(self, arg):
7511  """Add objective function to maximize."""
7512  return OptimizeObjective(self, Z3_optimize_maximize(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, arg.as_ast()), True)
7513 
7514  def minimize(self, arg):
7515  """Add objective function to minimize."""
7516  return OptimizeObjective(self, Z3_optimize_minimize(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, arg.as_ast()), False)
7517 
7518  def push(self):
7519  """create a backtracking point for added rules, facts and assertions"""
7520  Z3_optimize_push(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize)
7521 
7522  def pop(self):
7523  """restore to previously created backtracking point"""
7524  Z3_optimize_pop(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize)
7525 
7526  def check(self, *assumptions):
7527  """Check satisfiability while optimizing objective functions."""
7528  assumptions = _get_args(assumptions)
7529  num = len(assumptions)
7530  _assumptions = (Ast * num)()
7531  for i in range(num):
7532  _assumptions[i] = assumptions[i].as_ast()
7533  return CheckSatResult(Z3_optimize_check(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, num, _assumptions))
7534 
7535  def reason_unknown(self):
7536  """Return a string that describes why the last `check()` returned `unknown`."""
7537  return Z3_optimize_get_reason_unknown(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize)
7538 
7539  def model(self):
7540  """Return a model for the last check()."""
7541  try:
7542  return ModelRef(Z3_optimize_get_model(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize), self.ctx)
7543  except Z3Exception:
7544  raise Z3Exception("model is not available")
7545 
7546  def unsat_core(self):
7547  return AstVector(Z3_optimize_get_unsat_core(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize), self.ctx)
7548 
7549  def lower(self, obj):
7550  if not isinstance(obj, OptimizeObjective):
7551  raise Z3Exception("Expecting objective handle returned by maximize/minimize")
7552  return obj.lower()
7553 
7554  def upper(self, obj):
7555  if not isinstance(obj, OptimizeObjective):
7556  raise Z3Exception("Expecting objective handle returned by maximize/minimize")
7557  return obj.upper()
7558 
7559  def lower_values(self, obj):
7560  if not isinstance(obj, OptimizeObjective):
7561  raise Z3Exception("Expecting objective handle returned by maximize/minimize")
7562  return obj.lower_values()
7563 
7564  def upper_values(self, obj):
7565  if not isinstance(obj, OptimizeObjective):
7566  raise Z3Exception("Expecting objective handle returned by maximize/minimize")
7567  return obj.upper_values()
7568 
7569  def from_file(self, filename):
7570  """Parse assertions and objectives from a file"""
7571  Z3_optimize_from_file(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, filename)
7572 
7573  def from_string(self, s):
7574  """Parse assertions and objectives from a string"""
7575  Z3_optimize_from_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize, s)
7576 
7577  def assertions(self):
7578  """Return an AST vector containing all added constraints."""
7579  return AstVector(Z3_optimize_get_assertions(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize), self.ctx)
7580 
7581  def objectives(self):
7582  """returns set of objective functions"""
7583  return AstVector(Z3_optimize_get_objectives(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize), self.ctx)
7584 
7585  def __repr__(self):
7586  """Return a formatted string with all added rules and constraints."""
7587  return self.sexpr()
7588 
7589  def sexpr(self):
7590  """Return a formatted string (in Lisp-like format) with all added constraints. We say the string is in s-expression format.
7591  """
7592  return Z3_optimize_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize)
7593 
7594  def statistics(self):
7595  """Return statistics for the last check`.
7596  """
7597  return Statistics(Z3_optimize_get_statistics(self.ctx.ref(), self.optimize), self.ctx)
7598 
7599 
7600 
7601 
7602 
7607 class ApplyResult(Z3PPObject):
7608  """An ApplyResult object contains the subgoals produced by a tactic when applied to a goal. It also contains model and proof converters."""
7609 
7610  def __init__(self, result, ctx):
7611  self.result = result
7612  self.ctx = ctx
7613  Z3_apply_result_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.result)
7614 
7615  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
7616  return ApplyResult(self.result, self.ctx)
7617 
7618  def __del__(self):
7619  if self.ctx.ref() is not None:
7620  Z3_apply_result_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.result)
7621 
7622  def __len__(self):
7623  """Return the number of subgoals in `self`.
7624 
7625  >>> a, b = Ints('a b')
7626  >>> g = Goal()
7627  >>> g.add(Or(a == 0, a == 1), Or(b == 0, b == 1), a > b)
7628  >>> t = Tactic('split-clause')
7629  >>> r = t(g)
7630  >>> len(r)
7631  2
7632  >>> t = Then(Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('split-clause'))
7633  >>> len(t(g))
7634  4
7635  >>> t = Then(Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('propagate-values'))
7636  >>> len(t(g))
7637  1
7638  """
7639  return int(Z3_apply_result_get_num_subgoals(self.ctx.ref(), self.result))
7640 
7641  def __getitem__(self, idx):
7642  """Return one of the subgoals stored in ApplyResult object `self`.
7643 
7644  >>> a, b = Ints('a b')
7645  >>> g = Goal()
7646  >>> g.add(Or(a == 0, a == 1), Or(b == 0, b == 1), a > b)
7647  >>> t = Tactic('split-clause')
7648  >>> r = t(g)
7649  >>> r[0]
7650  [a == 0, Or(b == 0, b == 1), a > b]
7651  >>> r[1]
7652  [a == 1, Or(b == 0, b == 1), a > b]
7653  """
7654  if idx >= len(self):
7655  raise IndexError
7656  return Goal(goal=Z3_apply_result_get_subgoal(self.ctx.ref(), self.result, idx), ctx=self.ctx)
7657 
7658  def __repr__(self):
7659  return obj_to_string(self)
7660 
7661  def sexpr(self):
7662  """Return a textual representation of the s-expression representing the set of subgoals in `self`."""
7663  return Z3_apply_result_to_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.result)
7664 
7665 
7666  def as_expr(self):
7667  """Return a Z3 expression consisting of all subgoals.
7668 
7669  >>> x = Int('x')
7670  >>> g = Goal()
7671  >>> g.add(x > 1)
7672  >>> g.add(Or(x == 2, x == 3))
7673  >>> r = Tactic('simplify')(g)
7674  >>> r
7675  [[Not(x <= 1), Or(x == 2, x == 3)]]
7676  >>> r.as_expr()
7677  And(Not(x <= 1), Or(x == 2, x == 3))
7678  >>> r = Tactic('split-clause')(g)
7679  >>> r
7680  [[x > 1, x == 2], [x > 1, x == 3]]
7681  >>> r.as_expr()
7682  Or(And(x > 1, x == 2), And(x > 1, x == 3))
7683  """
7684  sz = len(self)
7685  if sz == 0:
7686  return BoolVal(False, self.ctx)
7687  elif sz == 1:
7688  return self[0].as_expr()
7689  else:
7690  return Or([ self[i].as_expr() for i in range(len(self)) ])
7691 
7692 
7697 class Tactic:
7698  """Tactics transform, solver and/or simplify sets of constraints (Goal). A Tactic can be converted into a Solver using the method solver().
7699 
7700  Several combinators are available for creating new tactics using the built-in ones: Then(), OrElse(), FailIf(), Repeat(), When(), Cond().
7701  """
7702  def __init__(self, tactic, ctx=None):
7703  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7704  self.tactic = None
7705  if isinstance(tactic, TacticObj):
7706  self.tactic = tactic
7707  else:
7708  if z3_debug():
7709  _z3_assert(isinstance(tactic, str), "tactic name expected")
7710  try:
7711  self.tactic = Z3_mk_tactic(self.ctx.ref(), str(tactic))
7712  except Z3Exception:
7713  raise Z3Exception("unknown tactic '%s'" % tactic)
7714  Z3_tactic_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic)
7715 
7716  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
7717  return Tactic(self.tactic, self.ctx)
7718 
7719  def __del__(self):
7720  if self.tactic is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
7721  Z3_tactic_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic)
7722 
7723  def solver(self, logFile=None):
7724  """Create a solver using the tactic `self`.
7725 
7726  The solver supports the methods `push()` and `pop()`, but it
7727  will always solve each `check()` from scratch.
7728 
7729  >>> t = Then('simplify', 'nlsat')
7730  >>> s = t.solver()
7731  >>> x = Real('x')
7732  >>> s.add(x**2 == 2, x > 0)
7733  >>> s.check()
7734  sat
7735  >>> s.model()
7736  [x = 1.4142135623?]
7737  """
7738  return Solver(Z3_mk_solver_from_tactic(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic), self.ctx, logFile)
7739 
7740  def apply(self, goal, *arguments, **keywords):
7741  """Apply tactic `self` to the given goal or Z3 Boolean expression using the given options.
7742 
7743  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7744  >>> t = Tactic('solve-eqs')
7745  >>> t.apply(And(x == 0, y >= x + 1))
7746  [[y >= 1]]
7747  """
7748  if z3_debug():
7749  _z3_assert(isinstance(goal, Goal) or isinstance(goal, BoolRef), "Z3 Goal or Boolean expressions expected")
7750  goal = _to_goal(goal)
7751  if len(arguments) > 0 or len(keywords) > 0:
7752  p = args2params(arguments, keywords, self.ctx)
7753  return ApplyResult(Z3_tactic_apply_ex(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic, goal.goal, p.params), self.ctx)
7754  else:
7755  return ApplyResult(Z3_tactic_apply(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic, goal.goal), self.ctx)
7756 
7757  def __call__(self, goal, *arguments, **keywords):
7758  """Apply tactic `self` to the given goal or Z3 Boolean expression using the given options.
7759 
7760  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7761  >>> t = Tactic('solve-eqs')
7762  >>> t(And(x == 0, y >= x + 1))
7763  [[y >= 1]]
7764  """
7765  return self.apply(goal, *arguments, **keywords)
7766 
7767  def help(self):
7768  """Display a string containing a description of the available options for the `self` tactic."""
7769  print(Z3_tactic_get_help(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic))
7770 
7771  def param_descrs(self):
7772  """Return the parameter description set."""
7773  return ParamDescrsRef(Z3_tactic_get_param_descrs(self.ctx.ref(), self.tactic), self.ctx)
7774 
7775 def _to_goal(a):
7776  if isinstance(a, BoolRef):
7777  goal = Goal(ctx = a.ctx)
7778  goal.add(a)
7779  return goal
7780  else:
7781  return a
7782 
7783 def _to_tactic(t, ctx=None):
7784  if isinstance(t, Tactic):
7785  return t
7786  else:
7787  return Tactic(t, ctx)
7788 
7789 def _and_then(t1, t2, ctx=None):
7790  t1 = _to_tactic(t1, ctx)
7791  t2 = _to_tactic(t2, ctx)
7792  if z3_debug():
7793  _z3_assert(t1.ctx == t2.ctx, "Context mismatch")
7794  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_and_then(t1.ctx.ref(), t1.tactic, t2.tactic), t1.ctx)
7795 
7796 def _or_else(t1, t2, ctx=None):
7797  t1 = _to_tactic(t1, ctx)
7798  t2 = _to_tactic(t2, ctx)
7799  if z3_debug():
7800  _z3_assert(t1.ctx == t2.ctx, "Context mismatch")
7801  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_or_else(t1.ctx.ref(), t1.tactic, t2.tactic), t1.ctx)
7802 
7803 def AndThen(*ts, **ks):
7804  """Return a tactic that applies the tactics in `*ts` in sequence.
7805 
7806  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7807  >>> t = AndThen(Tactic('simplify'), Tactic('solve-eqs'))
7808  >>> t(And(x == 0, y > x + 1))
7809  [[Not(y <= 1)]]
7810  >>> t(And(x == 0, y > x + 1)).as_expr()
7811  Not(y <= 1)
7812  """
7813  if z3_debug():
7814  _z3_assert(len(ts) >= 2, "At least two arguments expected")
7815  ctx = ks.get('ctx', None)
7816  num = len(ts)
7817  r = ts[0]
7818  for i in range(num - 1):
7819  r = _and_then(r, ts[i+1], ctx)
7820  return r
7821 
7822 def Then(*ts, **ks):
7823  """Return a tactic that applies the tactics in `*ts` in sequence. Shorthand for AndThen(*ts, **ks).
7824 
7825  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7826  >>> t = Then(Tactic('simplify'), Tactic('solve-eqs'))
7827  >>> t(And(x == 0, y > x + 1))
7828  [[Not(y <= 1)]]
7829  >>> t(And(x == 0, y > x + 1)).as_expr()
7830  Not(y <= 1)
7831  """
7832  return AndThen(*ts, **ks)
7833 
7834 def OrElse(*ts, **ks):
7835  """Return a tactic that applies the tactics in `*ts` until one of them succeeds (it doesn't fail).
7836 
7837  >>> x = Int('x')
7838  >>> t = OrElse(Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('skip'))
7839  >>> # Tactic split-clause fails if there is no clause in the given goal.
7840  >>> t(x == 0)
7841  [[x == 0]]
7842  >>> t(Or(x == 0, x == 1))
7843  [[x == 0], [x == 1]]
7844  """
7845  if z3_debug():
7846  _z3_assert(len(ts) >= 2, "At least two arguments expected")
7847  ctx = ks.get('ctx', None)
7848  num = len(ts)
7849  r = ts[0]
7850  for i in range(num - 1):
7851  r = _or_else(r, ts[i+1], ctx)
7852  return r
7853 
7854 def ParOr(*ts, **ks):
7855  """Return a tactic that applies the tactics in `*ts` in parallel until one of them succeeds (it doesn't fail).
7856 
7857  >>> x = Int('x')
7858  >>> t = ParOr(Tactic('simplify'), Tactic('fail'))
7859  >>> t(x + 1 == 2)
7860  [[x == 1]]
7861  """
7862  if z3_debug():
7863  _z3_assert(len(ts) >= 2, "At least two arguments expected")
7864  ctx = _get_ctx(ks.get('ctx', None))
7865  ts = [ _to_tactic(t, ctx) for t in ts ]
7866  sz = len(ts)
7867  _args = (TacticObj * sz)()
7868  for i in range(sz):
7869  _args[i] = ts[i].tactic
7870  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_par_or(ctx.ref(), sz, _args), ctx)
7871 
7872 def ParThen(t1, t2, ctx=None):
7873  """Return a tactic that applies t1 and then t2 to every subgoal produced by t1. The subgoals are processed in parallel.
7874 
7875  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7876  >>> t = ParThen(Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('propagate-values'))
7877  >>> t(And(Or(x == 1, x == 2), y == x + 1))
7878  [[x == 1, y == 2], [x == 2, y == 3]]
7879  """
7880  t1 = _to_tactic(t1, ctx)
7881  t2 = _to_tactic(t2, ctx)
7882  if z3_debug():
7883  _z3_assert(t1.ctx == t2.ctx, "Context mismatch")
7884  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_par_and_then(t1.ctx.ref(), t1.tactic, t2.tactic), t1.ctx)
7885 
7886 def ParAndThen(t1, t2, ctx=None):
7887  """Alias for ParThen(t1, t2, ctx)."""
7888  return ParThen(t1, t2, ctx)
7889 
7890 def With(t, *args, **keys):
7891  """Return a tactic that applies tactic `t` using the given configuration options.
7892 
7893  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7894  >>> t = With(Tactic('simplify'), som=True)
7895  >>> t((x + 1)*(y + 2) == 0)
7896  [[2*x + y + x*y == -2]]
7897  """
7898  ctx = keys.pop('ctx', None)
7899  t = _to_tactic(t, ctx)
7900  p = args2params(args, keys, t.ctx)
7901  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_using_params(t.ctx.ref(), t.tactic, p.params), t.ctx)
7902 
7903 def WithParams(t, p):
7904  """Return a tactic that applies tactic `t` using the given configuration options.
7905 
7906  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7907  >>> p = ParamsRef()
7908  >>> p.set("som", True)
7909  >>> t = WithParams(Tactic('simplify'), p)
7910  >>> t((x + 1)*(y + 2) == 0)
7911  [[2*x + y + x*y == -2]]
7912  """
7913  t = _to_tactic(t, None)
7914  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_using_params(t.ctx.ref(), t.tactic, p.params), t.ctx)
7915 
7916 def Repeat(t, max=4294967295, ctx=None):
7917  """Return a tactic that keeps applying `t` until the goal is not modified anymore or the maximum number of iterations `max` is reached.
7918 
7919  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
7920  >>> c = And(Or(x == 0, x == 1), Or(y == 0, y == 1), x > y)
7921  >>> t = Repeat(OrElse(Tactic('split-clause'), Tactic('skip')))
7922  >>> r = t(c)
7923  >>> for subgoal in r: print(subgoal)
7924  [x == 0, y == 0, x > y]
7925  [x == 0, y == 1, x > y]
7926  [x == 1, y == 0, x > y]
7927  [x == 1, y == 1, x > y]
7928  >>> t = Then(t, Tactic('propagate-values'))
7929  >>> t(c)
7930  [[x == 1, y == 0]]
7931  """
7932  t = _to_tactic(t, ctx)
7933  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_repeat(t.ctx.ref(), t.tactic, max), t.ctx)
7934 
7935 def TryFor(t, ms, ctx=None):
7936  """Return a tactic that applies `t` to a given goal for `ms` milliseconds.
7937 
7938  If `t` does not terminate in `ms` milliseconds, then it fails.
7939  """
7940  t = _to_tactic(t, ctx)
7941  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_try_for(t.ctx.ref(), t.tactic, ms), t.ctx)
7942 
7943 def tactics(ctx=None):
7944  """Return a list of all available tactics in Z3.
7945 
7946  >>> l = tactics()
7947  >>> l.count('simplify') == 1
7948  True
7949  """
7950  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7951  return [ Z3_get_tactic_name(ctx.ref(), i) for i in range(Z3_get_num_tactics(ctx.ref())) ]
7952 
7953 def tactic_description(name, ctx=None):
7954  """Return a short description for the tactic named `name`.
7955 
7956  >>> d = tactic_description('simplify')
7957  """
7958  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7959  return Z3_tactic_get_descr(ctx.ref(), name)
7960 
7961 def describe_tactics():
7962  """Display a (tabular) description of all available tactics in Z3."""
7963  if in_html_mode():
7964  even = True
7965  print('<table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0">')
7966  for t in tactics():
7967  if even:
7968  print('<tr style="background-color:#CFCFCF">')
7969  even = False
7970  else:
7971  print('<tr>')
7972  even = True
7973  print('<td>%s</td><td>%s</td></tr>' % (t, insert_line_breaks(tactic_description(t), 40)))
7974  print('</table>')
7975  else:
7976  for t in tactics():
7977  print('%s : %s' % (t, tactic_description(t)))
7978 
7979 class Probe:
7980  """Probes are used to inspect a goal (aka problem) and collect information that may be used to decide which solver and/or preprocessing step will be used."""
7981  def __init__(self, probe, ctx=None):
7982  self.ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
7983  self.probe = None
7984  if isinstance(probe, ProbeObj):
7985  self.probe = probe
7986  elif isinstance(probe, float):
7987  self.probe = Z3_probe_const(self.ctx.ref(), probe)
7988  elif _is_int(probe):
7989  self.probe = Z3_probe_const(self.ctx.ref(), float(probe))
7990  elif isinstance(probe, bool):
7991  if probe:
7992  self.probe = Z3_probe_const(self.ctx.ref(), 1.0)
7993  else:
7994  self.probe = Z3_probe_const(self.ctx.ref(), 0.0)
7995  else:
7996  if z3_debug():
7997  _z3_assert(isinstance(probe, str), "probe name expected")
7998  try:
7999  self.probe = Z3_mk_probe(self.ctx.ref(), probe)
8000  except Z3Exception:
8001  raise Z3Exception("unknown probe '%s'" % probe)
8002  Z3_probe_inc_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe)
8003 
8004  def __deepcopy__(self, memo={}):
8005  return Probe(self.probe, self.ctx)
8006 
8007  def __del__(self):
8008  if self.probe is not None and self.ctx.ref() is not None:
8009  Z3_probe_dec_ref(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe)
8010 
8011  def __lt__(self, other):
8012  """Return a probe that evaluates to "true" when the value returned by `self` is less than the value returned by `other`.
8013 
8014  >>> p = Probe('size') < 10
8015  >>> x = Int('x')
8016  >>> g = Goal()
8017  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8018  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8019  >>> p(g)
8020  1.0
8021  """
8022  return Probe(Z3_probe_lt(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe, _to_probe(other, self.ctx).probe), self.ctx)
8023 
8024  def __gt__(self, other):
8025  """Return a probe that evaluates to "true" when the value returned by `self` is greater than the value returned by `other`.
8026 
8027  >>> p = Probe('size') > 10
8028  >>> x = Int('x')
8029  >>> g = Goal()
8030  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8031  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8032  >>> p(g)
8033  0.0
8034  """
8035  return Probe(Z3_probe_gt(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe, _to_probe(other, self.ctx).probe), self.ctx)
8036 
8037  def __le__(self, other):
8038  """Return a probe that evaluates to "true" when the value returned by `self` is less than or equal to the value returned by `other`.
8039 
8040  >>> p = Probe('size') <= 2
8041  >>> x = Int('x')
8042  >>> g = Goal()
8043  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8044  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8045  >>> p(g)
8046  1.0
8047  """
8048  return Probe(Z3_probe_le(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe, _to_probe(other, self.ctx).probe), self.ctx)
8049 
8050  def __ge__(self, other):
8051  """Return a probe that evaluates to "true" when the value returned by `self` is greater than or equal to the value returned by `other`.
8052 
8053  >>> p = Probe('size') >= 2
8054  >>> x = Int('x')
8055  >>> g = Goal()
8056  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8057  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8058  >>> p(g)
8059  1.0
8060  """
8061  return Probe(Z3_probe_ge(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe, _to_probe(other, self.ctx).probe), self.ctx)
8062 
8063  def __eq__(self, other):
8064  """Return a probe that evaluates to "true" when the value returned by `self` is equal to the value returned by `other`.
8065 
8066  >>> p = Probe('size') == 2
8067  >>> x = Int('x')
8068  >>> g = Goal()
8069  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8070  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8071  >>> p(g)
8072  1.0
8073  """
8074  return Probe(Z3_probe_eq(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe, _to_probe(other, self.ctx).probe), self.ctx)
8075 
8076  def __ne__(self, other):
8077  """Return a probe that evaluates to "true" when the value returned by `self` is not equal to the value returned by `other`.
8078 
8079  >>> p = Probe('size') != 2
8080  >>> x = Int('x')
8081  >>> g = Goal()
8082  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8083  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8084  >>> p(g)
8085  0.0
8086  """
8087  p = self.__eq__(other)
8088  return Probe(Z3_probe_not(self.ctx.ref(), p.probe), self.ctx)
8089 
8090  def __call__(self, goal):
8091  """Evaluate the probe `self` in the given goal.
8092 
8093  >>> p = Probe('size')
8094  >>> x = Int('x')
