8095  >>> g = Goal()
8096  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8097  >>> g.add(x < 10)
8098  >>> p(g)
8099  2.0
8100  >>> g.add(x < 20)
8101  >>> p(g)
8102  3.0
8103  >>> p = Probe('num-consts')
8104  >>> p(g)
8105  1.0
8106  >>> p = Probe('is-propositional')
8107  >>> p(g)
8108  0.0
8109  >>> p = Probe('is-qflia')
8110  >>> p(g)
8111  1.0
8112  """
8113  if z3_debug():
8114  _z3_assert(isinstance(goal, Goal) or isinstance(goal, BoolRef), "Z3 Goal or Boolean expression expected")
8115  goal = _to_goal(goal)
8116  return Z3_probe_apply(self.ctx.ref(), self.probe, goal.goal)
8117 
8118 def is_probe(p):
8119  """Return `True` if `p` is a Z3 probe.
8120 
8121  >>> is_probe(Int('x'))
8122  False
8123  >>> is_probe(Probe('memory'))
8124  True
8125  """
8126  return isinstance(p, Probe)
8127 
8128 def _to_probe(p, ctx=None):
8129  if is_probe(p):
8130  return p
8131  else:
8132  return Probe(p, ctx)
8133 
8134 def probes(ctx=None):
8135  """Return a list of all available probes in Z3.
8136 
8137  >>> l = probes()
8138  >>> l.count('memory') == 1
8139  True
8140  """
8141  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8142  return [ Z3_get_probe_name(ctx.ref(), i) for i in range(Z3_get_num_probes(ctx.ref())) ]
8143 
8144 def probe_description(name, ctx=None):
8145  """Return a short description for the probe named `name`.
8146 
8147  >>> d = probe_description('memory')
8148  """
8149  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8150  return Z3_probe_get_descr(ctx.ref(), name)
8151 
8152 def describe_probes():
8153  """Display a (tabular) description of all available probes in Z3."""
8154  if in_html_mode():
8155  even = True
8156  print('<table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0">')
8157  for p in probes():
8158  if even:
8159  print('<tr style="background-color:#CFCFCF">')
8160  even = False
8161  else:
8162  print('<tr>')
8163  even = True
8164  print('<td>%s</td><td>%s</td></tr>' % (p, insert_line_breaks(probe_description(p), 40)))
8165  print('</table>')
8166  else:
8167  for p in probes():
8168  print('%s : %s' % (p, probe_description(p)))
8169 
8170 def _probe_nary(f, args, ctx):
8171  if z3_debug():
8172  _z3_assert(len(args) > 0, "At least one argument expected")
8173  num = len(args)
8174  r = _to_probe(args[0], ctx)
8175  for i in range(num - 1):
8176  r = Probe(f(ctx.ref(), r.probe, _to_probe(args[i+1], ctx).probe), ctx)
8177  return r
8178 
8179 def _probe_and(args, ctx):
8180  return _probe_nary(Z3_probe_and, args, ctx)
8181 
8182 def _probe_or(args, ctx):
8183  return _probe_nary(Z3_probe_or, args, ctx)
8184 
8185 def FailIf(p, ctx=None):
8186  """Return a tactic that fails if the probe `p` evaluates to true. Otherwise, it returns the input goal unmodified.
8187 
8188  In the following example, the tactic applies 'simplify' if and only if there are more than 2 constraints in the goal.
8189 
8190  >>> t = OrElse(FailIf(Probe('size') > 2), Tactic('simplify'))
8191  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
8192  >>> g = Goal()
8193  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8194  >>> g.add(y > 0)
8195  >>> t(g)
8196  [[x > 0, y > 0]]
8197  >>> g.add(x == y + 1)
8198  >>> t(g)
8199  [[Not(x <= 0), Not(y <= 0), x == 1 + y]]
8200  """
8201  p = _to_probe(p, ctx)
8202  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_fail_if(p.ctx.ref(), p.probe), p.ctx)
8203 
8204 def When(p, t, ctx=None):
8205  """Return a tactic that applies tactic `t` only if probe `p` evaluates to true. Otherwise, it returns the input goal unmodified.
8206 
8207  >>> t = When(Probe('size') > 2, Tactic('simplify'))
8208  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
8209  >>> g = Goal()
8210  >>> g.add(x > 0)
8211  >>> g.add(y > 0)
8212  >>> t(g)
8213  [[x > 0, y > 0]]
8214  >>> g.add(x == y + 1)
8215  >>> t(g)
8216  [[Not(x <= 0), Not(y <= 0), x == 1 + y]]
8217  """
8218  p = _to_probe(p, ctx)
8219  t = _to_tactic(t, ctx)
8220  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_when(t.ctx.ref(), p.probe, t.tactic), t.ctx)
8221 
8222 def Cond(p, t1, t2, ctx=None):
8223  """Return a tactic that applies tactic `t1` to a goal if probe `p` evaluates to true, and `t2` otherwise.
8224 
8225  >>> t = Cond(Probe('is-qfnra'), Tactic('qfnra'), Tactic('smt'))
8226  """
8227  p = _to_probe(p, ctx)
8228  t1 = _to_tactic(t1, ctx)
8229  t2 = _to_tactic(t2, ctx)
8230  return Tactic(Z3_tactic_cond(t1.ctx.ref(), p.probe, t1.tactic, t2.tactic), t1.ctx)
8231 
8232 
8237 
8238 def simplify(a, *arguments, **keywords):
8239  """Simplify the expression `a` using the given options.
8240 
8241  This function has many options. Use `help_simplify` to obtain the complete list.
8242 
8243  >>> x = Int('x')
8244  >>> y = Int('y')
8245  >>> simplify(x + 1 + y + x + 1)
8246  2 + 2*x + y
8247  >>> simplify((x + 1)*(y + 1), som=True)
8248  1 + x + y + x*y
8249  >>> simplify(Distinct(x, y, 1), blast_distinct=True)
8250  And(Not(x == y), Not(x == 1), Not(y == 1))
8251  >>> simplify(And(x == 0, y == 1), elim_and=True)
8252  Not(Or(Not(x == 0), Not(y == 1)))
8253  """
8254  if z3_debug():
8255  _z3_assert(is_expr(a), "Z3 expression expected")
8256  if len(arguments) > 0 or len(keywords) > 0:
8257  p = args2params(arguments, keywords, a.ctx)
8258  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_simplify_ex(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), p.params), a.ctx)
8259  else:
8260  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_simplify(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
8261 
8262 def help_simplify():
8263  """Return a string describing all options available for Z3 `simplify` procedure."""
8264  print(Z3_simplify_get_help(main_ctx().ref()))
8265 
8266 def simplify_param_descrs():
8267  """Return the set of parameter descriptions for Z3 `simplify` procedure."""
8268  return ParamDescrsRef(Z3_simplify_get_param_descrs(main_ctx().ref()), main_ctx())
8269 
8270 def substitute(t, *m):
8271  """Apply substitution m on t, m is a list of pairs of the form (from, to). Every occurrence in t of from is replaced with to.
8272 
8273  >>> x = Int('x')
8274  >>> y = Int('y')
8275  >>> substitute(x + 1, (x, y + 1))
8276  y + 1 + 1
8277  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
8278  >>> substitute(f(x) + f(y), (f(x), IntVal(1)), (f(y), IntVal(1)))
8279  1 + 1
8280  """
8281  if isinstance(m, tuple):
8282  m1 = _get_args(m)
8283  if isinstance(m1, list) and all(isinstance(p, tuple) for p in m1):
8284  m = m1
8285  if z3_debug():
8286  _z3_assert(is_expr(t), "Z3 expression expected")
8287  _z3_assert(all([isinstance(p, tuple) and is_expr(p[0]) and is_expr(p[1]) and p[0].sort().eq(p[1].sort()) for p in m]), "Z3 invalid substitution, expression pairs expected.")
8288  num = len(m)
8289  _from = (Ast * num)()
8290  _to = (Ast * num)()
8291  for i in range(num):
8292  _from[i] = m[i][0].as_ast()
8293  _to[i] = m[i][1].as_ast()
8294  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_substitute(t.ctx.ref(), t.as_ast(), num, _from, _to), t.ctx)
8295 
8296 def substitute_vars(t, *m):
8297  """Substitute the free variables in t with the expression in m.
8298 
8299  >>> v0 = Var(0, IntSort())
8300  >>> v1 = Var(1, IntSort())
8301  >>> x = Int('x')
8302  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort(), IntSort())
8303  >>> # replace v0 with x+1 and v1 with x
8304  >>> substitute_vars(f(v0, v1), x + 1, x)
8305  f(x + 1, x)
8306  """
8307  if z3_debug():
8308  _z3_assert(is_expr(t), "Z3 expression expected")
8309  _z3_assert(all([is_expr(n) for n in m]), "Z3 invalid substitution, list of expressions expected.")
8310  num = len(m)
8311  _to = (Ast * num)()
8312  for i in range(num):
8313  _to[i] = m[i].as_ast()
8314  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_substitute_vars(t.ctx.ref(), t.as_ast(), num, _to), t.ctx)
8315 
8316 def Sum(*args):
8317  """Create the sum of the Z3 expressions.
8318 
8319  >>> a, b, c = Ints('a b c')
8320  >>> Sum(a, b, c)
8321  a + b + c
8322  >>> Sum([a, b, c])
8323  a + b + c
8324  >>> A = IntVector('a', 5)
8325  >>> Sum(A)
8326  a__0 + a__1 + a__2 + a__3 + a__4
8327  """
8328  args = _get_args(args)
8329  if len(args) == 0:
8330  return 0
8331  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
8332  if ctx is None:
8333  return _reduce(lambda a, b: a + b, args, 0)
8334  args = _coerce_expr_list(args, ctx)
8335  if is_bv(args[0]):
8336  return _reduce(lambda a, b: a + b, args, 0)
8337  else:
8338  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args)
8339  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_add(ctx.ref(), sz, _args), ctx)
8340 
8341 
8342 def Product(*args):
8343  """Create the product of the Z3 expressions.
8344 
8345  >>> a, b, c = Ints('a b c')
8346  >>> Product(a, b, c)
8347  a*b*c
8348  >>> Product([a, b, c])
8349  a*b*c
8350  >>> A = IntVector('a', 5)
8351  >>> Product(A)
8352  a__0*a__1*a__2*a__3*a__4
8353  """
8354  args = _get_args(args)
8355  if len(args) == 0:
8356  return 1
8357  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
8358  if ctx is None:
8359  return _reduce(lambda a, b: a * b, args, 1)
8360  args = _coerce_expr_list(args, ctx)
8361  if is_bv(args[0]):
8362  return _reduce(lambda a, b: a * b, args, 1)
8363  else:
8364  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args)
8365  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_mul(ctx.ref(), sz, _args), ctx)
8366 
8367 def AtMost(*args):
8368  """Create an at-most Pseudo-Boolean k constraint.
8369 
8370  >>> a, b, c = Bools('a b c')
8371  >>> f = AtMost(a, b, c, 2)
8372  """
8373  args = _get_args(args)
8374  if z3_debug():
8375  _z3_assert(len(args) > 1, "Non empty list of arguments expected")
8376  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
8377  if z3_debug():
8378  _z3_assert(ctx is not None, "At least one of the arguments must be a Z3 expression")
8379  args1 = _coerce_expr_list(args[:-1], ctx)
8380  k = args[-1]
8381  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args1)
8382  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_atmost(ctx.ref(), sz, _args, k), ctx)
8383 
8384 def AtLeast(*args):
8385  """Create an at-most Pseudo-Boolean k constraint.
8386 
8387  >>> a, b, c = Bools('a b c')
8388  >>> f = AtLeast(a, b, c, 2)
8389  """
8390  args = _get_args(args)
8391  if z3_debug():
8392  _z3_assert(len(args) > 1, "Non empty list of arguments expected")
8393  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
8394  if z3_debug():
8395  _z3_assert(ctx is not None, "At least one of the arguments must be a Z3 expression")
8396  args1 = _coerce_expr_list(args[:-1], ctx)
8397  k = args[-1]
8398  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args1)
8399  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_atleast(ctx.ref(), sz, _args, k), ctx)
8400 
8401 def _reorder_pb_arg(arg):
8402  a, b = arg
8403  if not _is_int(b) and _is_int(a):
8404  return b, a
8405  return arg
8406 
8407 def _pb_args_coeffs(args, default_ctx = None):
8408  args = _get_args_ast_list(args)
8409  if len(args) == 0:
8410  return _get_ctx(default_ctx), 0, (Ast * 0)(), (ctypes.c_int * 0)()
8411  args = [_reorder_pb_arg(arg) for arg in args]
8412  args, coeffs = zip(*args)
8413  if z3_debug():
8414  _z3_assert(len(args) > 0, "Non empty list of arguments expected")
8415  ctx = _ctx_from_ast_arg_list(args)
8416  if z3_debug():
8417  _z3_assert(ctx is not None, "At least one of the arguments must be a Z3 expression")
8418  args = _coerce_expr_list(args, ctx)
8419  _args, sz = _to_ast_array(args)
8420  _coeffs = (ctypes.c_int * len(coeffs))()
8421  for i in range(len(coeffs)):
8422  _z3_check_cint_overflow(coeffs[i], "coefficient")
8423  _coeffs[i] = coeffs[i]
8424  return ctx, sz, _args, _coeffs
8425 
8426 def PbLe(args, k):
8427  """Create a Pseudo-Boolean inequality k constraint.
8428 
8429  >>> a, b, c = Bools('a b c')
8430  >>> f = PbLe(((a,1),(b,3),(c,2)), 3)
8431  """
8432  _z3_check_cint_overflow(k, "k")
8433  ctx, sz, _args, _coeffs = _pb_args_coeffs(args)
8434  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_pble(ctx.ref(), sz, _args, _coeffs, k), ctx)
8435 
8436 def PbGe(args, k):
8437  """Create a Pseudo-Boolean inequality k constraint.
8438 
8439  >>> a, b, c = Bools('a b c')
8440  >>> f = PbGe(((a,1),(b,3),(c,2)), 3)
8441  """
8442  _z3_check_cint_overflow(k, "k")
8443  ctx, sz, _args, _coeffs = _pb_args_coeffs(args)
8444  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_pbge(ctx.ref(), sz, _args, _coeffs, k), ctx)
8445 
8446 def PbEq(args, k, ctx = None):
8447  """Create a Pseudo-Boolean inequality k constraint.
8448 
8449  >>> a, b, c = Bools('a b c')
8450  >>> f = PbEq(((a,1),(b,3),(c,2)), 3)
8451  """
8452  _z3_check_cint_overflow(k, "k")
8453  ctx, sz, _args, _coeffs = _pb_args_coeffs(args)
8454  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_pbeq(ctx.ref(), sz, _args, _coeffs, k), ctx)
8455 
8456 
8457 def solve(*args, **keywords):
8458  """Solve the constraints `*args`.
8459 
8460  This is a simple function for creating demonstrations. It creates a solver,
8461  configure it using the options in `keywords`, adds the constraints
8462  in `args`, and invokes check.
8463 
8464  >>> a = Int('a')
8465  >>> solve(a > 0, a < 2)
8466  [a = 1]
8467  """
8468  s = Solver()
8469  s.set(**keywords)
8470  s.add(*args)
8471  if keywords.get('show', False):
8472  print(s)
8473  r = s.check()
8474  if r == unsat:
8475  print("no solution")
8476  elif r == unknown:
8477  print("failed to solve")
8478  try:
8479  print(s.model())
8480  except Z3Exception:
8481  return
8482  else:
8483  print(s.model())
8484 
8485 def solve_using(s, *args, **keywords):
8486  """Solve the constraints `*args` using solver `s`.
8487 
8488  This is a simple function for creating demonstrations. It is similar to `solve`,
8489  but it uses the given solver `s`.
8490  It configures solver `s` using the options in `keywords`, adds the constraints
8491  in `args`, and invokes check.
8492  """
8493  if z3_debug():
8494  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, Solver), "Solver object expected")
8495  s.set(**keywords)
8496  s.add(*args)
8497  if keywords.get('show', False):
8498  print("Problem:")
8499  print(s)
8500  r = s.check()
8501  if r == unsat:
8502  print("no solution")
8503  elif r == unknown:
8504  print("failed to solve")
8505  try:
8506  print(s.model())
8507  except Z3Exception:
8508  return
8509  else:
8510  if keywords.get('show', False):
8511  print("Solution:")
8512  print(s.model())
8513 
8514 def prove(claim, **keywords):
8515  """Try to prove the given claim.
8516 
8517  This is a simple function for creating demonstrations. It tries to prove
8518  `claim` by showing the negation is unsatisfiable.
8519 
8520  >>> p, q = Bools('p q')
8521  >>> prove(Not(And(p, q)) == Or(Not(p), Not(q)))
8522  proved
8523  """
8524  if z3_debug():
8525  _z3_assert(is_bool(claim), "Z3 Boolean expression expected")
8526  s = Solver()
8527  s.set(**keywords)
8528  s.add(Not(claim))
8529  if keywords.get('show', False):
8530  print(s)
8531  r = s.check()
8532  if r == unsat:
8533  print("proved")
8534  elif r == unknown:
8535  print("failed to prove")
8536  print(s.model())
8537  else:
8538  print("counterexample")
8539  print(s.model())
8540 
8541 def _solve_html(*args, **keywords):
8542  """Version of function `solve` used in RiSE4Fun."""
8543  s = Solver()
8544  s.set(**keywords)
8545  s.add(*args)
8546  if keywords.get('show', False):
8547  print("<b>Problem:</b>")
8548  print(s)
8549  r = s.check()
8550  if r == unsat:
8551  print("<b>no solution</b>")
8552  elif r == unknown:
8553  print("<b>failed to solve</b>")
8554  try:
8555  print(s.model())
8556  except Z3Exception:
8557  return
8558  else:
8559  if keywords.get('show', False):
8560  print("<b>Solution:</b>")
8561  print(s.model())
8562 
8563 def _solve_using_html(s, *args, **keywords):
8564  """Version of function `solve_using` used in RiSE4Fun."""
8565  if z3_debug():
8566  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, Solver), "Solver object expected")
8567  s.set(**keywords)
8568  s.add(*args)
8569  if keywords.get('show', False):
8570  print("<b>Problem:</b>")
8571  print(s)
8572  r = s.check()
8573  if r == unsat:
8574  print("<b>no solution</b>")
8575  elif r == unknown:
8576  print("<b>failed to solve</b>")
8577  try:
8578  print(s.model())
8579  except Z3Exception:
8580  return
8581  else:
8582  if keywords.get('show', False):
8583  print("<b>Solution:</b>")
8584  print(s.model())
8585 
8586 def _prove_html(claim, **keywords):
8587  """Version of function `prove` used in RiSE4Fun."""
8588  if z3_debug():
8589  _z3_assert(is_bool(claim), "Z3 Boolean expression expected")
8590  s = Solver()
8591  s.set(**keywords)
8592  s.add(Not(claim))
8593  if keywords.get('show', False):
8594  print(s)
8595  r = s.check()
8596  if r == unsat:
8597  print("<b>proved</b>")
8598  elif r == unknown:
8599  print("<b>failed to prove</b>")
8600  print(s.model())
8601  else:
8602  print("<b>counterexample</b>")
8603  print(s.model())
8604 
8605 def _dict2sarray(sorts, ctx):
8606  sz = len(sorts)
8607  _names = (Symbol * sz)()
8608  _sorts = (Sort * sz) ()
8609  i = 0
8610  for k in sorts:
8611  v = sorts[k]
8612  if z3_debug():
8613  _z3_assert(isinstance(k, str), "String expected")
8614  _z3_assert(is_sort(v), "Z3 sort expected")
8615  _names[i] = to_symbol(k, ctx)
8616  _sorts[i] = v.ast
8617  i = i + 1
8618  return sz, _names, _sorts
8619 
8620 def _dict2darray(decls, ctx):
8621  sz = len(decls)
8622  _names = (Symbol * sz)()
8623  _decls = (FuncDecl * sz) ()
8624  i = 0
8625  for k in decls:
8626  v = decls[k]
8627  if z3_debug():
8628  _z3_assert(isinstance(k, str), "String expected")
8629  _z3_assert(is_func_decl(v) or is_const(v), "Z3 declaration or constant expected")
8630  _names[i] = to_symbol(k, ctx)
8631  if is_const(v):
8632  _decls[i] = v.decl().ast
8633  else:
8634  _decls[i] = v.ast
8635  i = i + 1
8636  return sz, _names, _decls
8637 
8638 
8639 def parse_smt2_string(s, sorts={}, decls={}, ctx=None):
8640  """Parse a string in SMT 2.0 format using the given sorts and decls.
8641 
8642  The arguments sorts and decls are Python dictionaries used to initialize
8643  the symbol table used for the SMT 2.0 parser.
8644 
8645  >>> parse_smt2_string('(declare-const x Int) (assert (> x 0)) (assert (< x 10))')
8646  [x > 0, x < 10]
8647  >>> x, y = Ints('x y')
8648  >>> f = Function('f', IntSort(), IntSort())
8649  >>> parse_smt2_string('(assert (> (+ foo (g bar)) 0))', decls={ 'foo' : x, 'bar' : y, 'g' : f})
8650  [x + f(y) > 0]
8651  >>> parse_smt2_string('(declare-const a U) (assert (> a 0))', sorts={ 'U' : IntSort() })
8652  [a > 0]
8653  """
8654  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8655  ssz, snames, ssorts = _dict2sarray(sorts, ctx)
8656  dsz, dnames, ddecls = _dict2darray(decls, ctx)
8657  return AstVector(Z3_parse_smtlib2_string(ctx.ref(), s, ssz, snames, ssorts, dsz, dnames, ddecls), ctx)
8658 
8659 def parse_smt2_file(f, sorts={}, decls={}, ctx=None):
8660  """Parse a file in SMT 2.0 format using the given sorts and decls.
8661 
8662  This function is similar to parse_smt2_string().
8663  """
8664  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8665  ssz, snames, ssorts = _dict2sarray(sorts, ctx)
8666  dsz, dnames, ddecls = _dict2darray(decls, ctx)
8667  return AstVector(Z3_parse_smtlib2_file(ctx.ref(), f, ssz, snames, ssorts, dsz, dnames, ddecls), ctx)
8668 
8669 
8670 #########################################
8671 #
8672 # Floating-Point Arithmetic
8673 #
8674 #########################################
8675 
8676 
8677 # Global default rounding mode
8678 _dflt_rounding_mode = Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_ZERO
8679 _dflt_fpsort_ebits = 11
8680 _dflt_fpsort_sbits = 53
8681 
8682 def get_default_rounding_mode(ctx=None):
8683  """Retrieves the global default rounding mode."""
8684  global _dflt_rounding_mode
8685  if _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_ZERO:
8686  return RTZ(ctx)
8687  elif _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_NEGATIVE:
8688  return RTN(ctx)
8689  elif _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_POSITIVE:
8690  return RTP(ctx)
8691  elif _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_NEAREST_TIES_TO_EVEN:
8692  return RNE(ctx)
8693  elif _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_NEAREST_TIES_TO_AWAY:
8694  return RNA(ctx)
8695 
8696 def set_default_rounding_mode(rm, ctx=None):
8697  global _dflt_rounding_mode
8698  if is_fprm_value(rm):
8699  _dflt_rounding_mode = rm.decl().kind()
8700  else:
8701  _z3_assert(_dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_ZERO or
8702  _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_NEGATIVE or
8703  _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_TOWARD_POSITIVE or
8704  _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_NEAREST_TIES_TO_EVEN or
8705  _dflt_rounding_mode == Z3_OP_FPA_RM_NEAREST_TIES_TO_AWAY,
8706  "illegal rounding mode")
8707  _dflt_rounding_mode = rm
8708 
8709 def get_default_fp_sort(ctx=None):
8710  return FPSort(_dflt_fpsort_ebits, _dflt_fpsort_sbits, ctx)
8711 
8712 def set_default_fp_sort(ebits, sbits, ctx=None):
8713  global _dflt_fpsort_ebits
8714  global _dflt_fpsort_sbits
8715  _dflt_fpsort_ebits = ebits
8716  _dflt_fpsort_sbits = sbits
8717 
8718 def _dflt_rm(ctx=None):
8719  return get_default_rounding_mode(ctx)
8720 
8721 def _dflt_fps(ctx=None):
8722  return get_default_fp_sort(ctx)
8723 
8724 def _coerce_fp_expr_list(alist, ctx):
8725  first_fp_sort = None
8726  for a in alist:
8727  if is_fp(a):
8728  if first_fp_sort is None:
8729  first_fp_sort = a.sort()
8730  elif first_fp_sort == a.sort():
8731  pass # OK, same as before
8732  else:
8733  # we saw at least 2 different float sorts; something will
8734  # throw a sort mismatch later, for now assume None.
8735  first_fp_sort = None
8736  break
8737 
8738  r = []
8739  for i in range(len(alist)):
8740  a = alist[i]
8741  if (isinstance(a, str) and a.contains('2**(') and a.endswith(')')) or _is_int(a) or isinstance(a, float) or isinstance(a, bool):
8742  r.append(FPVal(a, None, first_fp_sort, ctx))
8743  else:
8744  r.append(a)
8745  return _coerce_expr_list(r, ctx)
8746 
8747 
8748 ### FP Sorts
8749 
8750 class FPSortRef(SortRef):
8751  """Floating-point sort."""
8752 
8753  def ebits(self):
8754  """Retrieves the number of bits reserved for the exponent in the FloatingPoint sort `self`.
8755  >>> b = FPSort(8, 24)
8756  >>> b.ebits()
8757  8
8758  """
8759  return int(Z3_fpa_get_ebits(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast))
8760 
8761  def sbits(self):
8762  """Retrieves the number of bits reserved for the significand in the FloatingPoint sort `self`.
8763  >>> b = FPSort(8, 24)
8764  >>> b.sbits()
8765  24
8766  """
8767  return int(Z3_fpa_get_sbits(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast))
8768 
8769  def cast(self, val):
8770  """Try to cast `val` as a floating-point expression.
8771  >>> b = FPSort(8, 24)
8772  >>> b.cast(1.0)
8773  1
8774  >>> b.cast(1.0).sexpr()
8775  '(fp #b0 #x7f #b00000000000000000000000)'
8776  """
8777  if is_expr(val):
8778  if z3_debug():
8779  _z3_assert(self.ctx == val.ctx, "Context mismatch")
8780  return val
8781  else:
8782  return FPVal(val, None, self, self.ctx)
8783 
8784 
8785 def Float16(ctx=None):
8786  """Floating-point 16-bit (half) sort."""
8787  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8788  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_16(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8789 
8790 def FloatHalf(ctx=None):
8791  """Floating-point 16-bit (half) sort."""
8792  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8793  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_half(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8794 
8795 def Float32(ctx=None):
8796  """Floating-point 32-bit (single) sort."""
8797  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8798  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_32(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8799 
8800 def FloatSingle(ctx=None):
8801  """Floating-point 32-bit (single) sort."""
8802  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8803  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_single(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8804 
8805 def Float64(ctx=None):
8806  """Floating-point 64-bit (double) sort."""
8807  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8808  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_64(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8809 
8810 def FloatDouble(ctx=None):
8811  """Floating-point 64-bit (double) sort."""
8812  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8813  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_double(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8814 
8815 def Float128(ctx=None):
8816  """Floating-point 128-bit (quadruple) sort."""
8817  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8818  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_128(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8819 
8820 def FloatQuadruple(ctx=None):
8821  """Floating-point 128-bit (quadruple) sort."""
8822  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
8823  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort_quadruple(ctx.ref()), ctx)
8824 
8825 class FPRMSortRef(SortRef):
8826  """"Floating-point rounding mode sort."""
8827 
8828 
8829 def is_fp_sort(s):
8830  """Return True if `s` is a Z3 floating-point sort.
8831 
8832  >>> is_fp_sort(FPSort(8, 24))
8833  True
8834  >>> is_fp_sort(IntSort())
8835  False
8836  """
8837  return isinstance(s, FPSortRef)
8838 
8839 def is_fprm_sort(s):
8840  """Return True if `s` is a Z3 floating-point rounding mode sort.
8841 
8842  >>> is_fprm_sort(FPSort(8, 24))
8843  False
8844  >>> is_fprm_sort(RNE().sort())
8845  True
8846  """
8847  return isinstance(s, FPRMSortRef)
8848 
8849 ### FP Expressions
8850 
8851 class FPRef(ExprRef):
8852  """Floating-point expressions."""
8853 
8854  def sort(self):
8855  """Return the sort of the floating-point expression `self`.
8856 
8857  >>> x = FP('1.0', FPSort(8, 24))
8858  >>> x.sort()
8859  FPSort(8, 24)
8860  >>> x.sort() == FPSort(8, 24)
8861  True
8862  """
8863  return FPSortRef(Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
8864 
8865  def ebits(self):
8866  """Retrieves the number of bits reserved for the exponent in the FloatingPoint expression `self`.
8867  >>> b = FPSort(8, 24)
8868  >>> b.ebits()
8869  8
8870  """
8871  return self.sort().ebits();
8872 
8873  def sbits(self):
8874  """Retrieves the number of bits reserved for the exponent in the FloatingPoint expression `self`.
8875  >>> b = FPSort(8, 24)
8876  >>> b.sbits()
8877  24
8878  """
8879  return self.sort().sbits();
8880 
8881  def as_string(self):
8882  """Return a Z3 floating point expression as a Python string."""
8883  return Z3_ast_to_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
8884 
8885  def __le__(self, other):
8886  return fpLEQ(self, other, self.ctx)
8887 
8888  def __lt__(self, other):
8889  return fpLT(self, other, self.ctx)
8890 
8891  def __ge__(self, other):
8892  return fpGEQ(self, other, self.ctx)
8893 
8894  def __gt__(self, other):
8895  return fpGT(self, other, self.ctx)
8896 
8897  def __add__(self, other):
8898  """Create the Z3 expression `self + other`.
8899 
8900  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8901  >>> y = FP('y', FPSort(8, 24))
8902  >>> x + y
8903  x + y
8904  >>> (x + y).sort()
8905  FPSort(8, 24)
8906  """
8907  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([self, other], self.ctx)
8908  return fpAdd(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8909 
8910  def __radd__(self, other):
8911  """Create the Z3 expression `other + self`.
8912 
8913  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8914  >>> 10 + x
8915  1.25*(2**3) + x
8916  """
8917  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([other, self], self.ctx)
8918  return fpAdd(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8919 
8920  def __sub__(self, other):
8921  """Create the Z3 expression `self - other`.
8922 
8923  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8924  >>> y = FP('y', FPSort(8, 24))
8925  >>> x - y
8926  x - y
8927  >>> (x - y).sort()
8928  FPSort(8, 24)
8929  """
8930  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([self, other], self.ctx)
8931  return fpSub(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8932 
8933  def __rsub__(self, other):
8934  """Create the Z3 expression `other - self`.
8935 
8936  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8937  >>> 10 - x
8938  1.25*(2**3) - x
8939  """
8940  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([other, self], self.ctx)
8941  return fpSub(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8942 
8943  def __mul__(self, other):
8944  """Create the Z3 expression `self * other`.
8945 
8946  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8947  >>> y = FP('y', FPSort(8, 24))
8948  >>> x * y
8949  x * y
8950  >>> (x * y).sort()
8951  FPSort(8, 24)
8952  >>> 10 * y
8953  1.25*(2**3) * y
8954  """
8955  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([self, other], self.ctx)
8956  return fpMul(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8957 
8958  def __rmul__(self, other):
8959  """Create the Z3 expression `other * self`.
8960 
8961  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8962  >>> y = FP('y', FPSort(8, 24))
8963  >>> x * y
8964  x * y
8965  >>> x * 10
8966  x * 1.25*(2**3)
8967  """
8968  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([other, self], self.ctx)
8969  return fpMul(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8970 
8971  def __pos__(self):
8972  """Create the Z3 expression `+self`."""
8973  return self
8974 
8975  def __neg__(self):
8976  """Create the Z3 expression `-self`.
8977 
8978  >>> x = FP('x', Float32())
8979  >>> -x
8980  -x
8981  """
8982  return fpNeg(self)
8983 
8984  def __div__(self, other):
8985  """Create the Z3 expression `self / other`.
8986 
8987  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
8988  >>> y = FP('y', FPSort(8, 24))
8989  >>> x / y
8990  x / y
8991  >>> (x / y).sort()
8992  FPSort(8, 24)
8993  >>> 10 / y
8994  1.25*(2**3) / y
8995  """
8996  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([self, other], self.ctx)
8997  return fpDiv(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
8998 
8999  def __rdiv__(self, other):
9000  """Create the Z3 expression `other / self`.
9001 
9002  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
9003  >>> y = FP('y', FPSort(8, 24))
9004  >>> x / y
9005  x / y
9006  >>> x / 10
9007  x / 1.25*(2**3)
9008  """
9009  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([other, self], self.ctx)
9010  return fpDiv(_dflt_rm(), a, b, self.ctx)
9011 
9012  def __truediv__(self, other):
9013  """Create the Z3 expression division `self / other`."""
9014  return self.__div__(other)
9015 
9016  def __rtruediv__(self, other):
9017  """Create the Z3 expression division `other / self`."""
9018  return self.__rdiv__(other)
9019 
9020  def __mod__(self, other):
9021  """Create the Z3 expression mod `self % other`."""
9022  return fpRem(self, other)
9023 
9024  def __rmod__(self, other):
9025  """Create the Z3 expression mod `other % self`."""
9026  return fpRem(other, self)
9027 
9028 class FPRMRef(ExprRef):
9029  """Floating-point rounding mode expressions"""
9030 
9031  def as_string(self):
9032  """Return a Z3 floating point expression as a Python string."""
9033  return Z3_ast_to_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
9034 
9035 
9036 def RoundNearestTiesToEven(ctx=None):
9037  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9038  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_nearest_ties_to_even(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9039 
9040 def RNE (ctx=None):
9041  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9042  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_nearest_ties_to_even(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9043 
9044 def RoundNearestTiesToAway(ctx=None):
9045  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9046  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_nearest_ties_to_away(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9047 
9048 def RNA (ctx=None):
9049  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9050  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_nearest_ties_to_away(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9051 
9052 def RoundTowardPositive(ctx=None):
9053  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9054  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_toward_positive(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9055 
9056 def RTP(ctx=None):
9057  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9058  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_toward_positive(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9059 
9060 def RoundTowardNegative(ctx=None):
9061  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9062  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_toward_negative(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9063 
9064 def RTN(ctx=None):
9065  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9066  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_toward_negative(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9067 
9068 def RoundTowardZero(ctx=None):
9069  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9070  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_toward_zero(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9071 
9072 def RTZ(ctx=None):
9073  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9074  return FPRMRef(Z3_mk_fpa_round_toward_zero(ctx.ref()), ctx)
9075 
9076 def is_fprm(a):
9077  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression.
9078 
9079  >>> rm = RNE()
9080  >>> is_fprm(rm)
9081  True
9082  >>> rm = 1.0
9083  >>> is_fprm(rm)
9084  False
9085  """
9086  return isinstance(a, FPRMRef)
9087 
9088 def is_fprm_value(a):
9089  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 floating-point rounding mode numeral value."""
9090  return is_fprm(a) and _is_numeral(a.ctx, a.ast)
9091 
9092 ### FP Numerals
9093 
9094 class FPNumRef(FPRef):
9095  """The sign of the numeral.
9096 
9097  >>> x = FPVal(+1.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9098  >>> x.sign()
9099  False
9100  >>> x = FPVal(-1.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9101  >>> x.sign()
9102  True
9103  """
9104  def sign(self):
9105  l = (ctypes.c_int)()
9106  if Z3_fpa_get_numeral_sign(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast(), byref(l)) == False:
9107  raise Z3Exception("error retrieving the sign of a numeral.")
9108  return l.value != 0
9109 
9110  """The sign of a floating-point numeral as a bit-vector expression.
9111 
9112  Remark: NaN's are invalid arguments.
9113  """
9114  def sign_as_bv(self):
9115  return BitVecNumRef(Z3_fpa_get_numeral_sign_bv(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
9116 
9117  """The significand of the numeral.
9118 
9119  >>> x = FPVal(2.5, FPSort(8, 24))
9120  >>> x.significand()
9121  1.25
9122  """
9123  def significand(self):
9124  return Z3_fpa_get_numeral_significand_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9125 
9126  """The significand of the numeral as a long.
9127 
9128  >>> x = FPVal(2.5, FPSort(8, 24))
9129  >>> x.significand_as_long()
9130  1.25
9131  """
9132  def significand_as_long(self):
9133  ptr = (ctypes.c_ulonglong * 1)()
9134  if not Z3_fpa_get_numeral_significand_uint64(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast(), ptr):
9135  raise Z3Exception("error retrieving the significand of a numeral.")
9136  return ptr[0]
9137 
9138  """The significand of the numeral as a bit-vector expression.
9139 
9140  Remark: NaN are invalid arguments.
9141  """
9142  def significand_as_bv(self):
9143  return BitVecNumRef(Z3_fpa_get_numeral_significand_bv(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
9144 
9145  """The exponent of the numeral.
9146 
9147  >>> x = FPVal(2.5, FPSort(8, 24))
9148  >>> x.exponent()
9149  1
9150  """
9151  def exponent(self, biased=True):
9152  return Z3_fpa_get_numeral_exponent_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast(), biased)
9153 
9154  """The exponent of the numeral as a long.
9155 
9156  >>> x = FPVal(2.5, FPSort(8, 24))
9157  >>> x.exponent_as_long()
9158  1
9159  """
9160  def exponent_as_long(self, biased=True):
9161  ptr = (ctypes.c_longlong * 1)()
9162  if not Z3_fpa_get_numeral_exponent_int64(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast(), ptr, biased):
9163  raise Z3Exception("error retrieving the exponent of a numeral.")
9164  return ptr[0]
9165 
9166  """The exponent of the numeral as a bit-vector expression.
9167 
9168  Remark: NaNs are invalid arguments.
9169  """
9170  def exponent_as_bv(self, biased=True):
9171  return BitVecNumRef(Z3_fpa_get_numeral_exponent_bv(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast(), biased), self.ctx)
9172 
9173  """Indicates whether the numeral is a NaN."""
9174  def isNaN(self):
9175  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_nan(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9176 
9177  """Indicates whether the numeral is +oo or -oo."""
9178  def isInf(self):
9179  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_inf(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9180 
9181  """Indicates whether the numeral is +zero or -zero."""
9182  def isZero(self):
9183  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_zero(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9184 
9185  """Indicates whether the numeral is normal."""
9186  def isNormal(self):
9187  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_normal(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9188 
9189  """Indicates whether the numeral is subnormal."""
9190  def isSubnormal(self):
9191  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_subnormal(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9192 
9193  """Indicates whether the numeral is positive."""
9194  def isPositive(self):
9195  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_positive(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9196 
9197  """Indicates whether the numeral is negative."""
9198  def isNegative(self):
9199  return Z3_fpa_is_numeral_negative(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9200 
9201  """
9202  The string representation of the numeral.
9203 
9204  >>> x = FPVal(20, FPSort(8, 24))
9205  >>> x.as_string()
9206  1.25*(2**4)
9207  """
9208  def as_string(self):
9209  s = Z3_get_numeral_string(self.ctx.ref(), self.as_ast())
9210  return ("FPVal(%s, %s)" % (s, self.sort()))
9211 
9212 def is_fp(a):
9213  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 floating-point expression.
9214 
9215  >>> b = FP('b', FPSort(8, 24))
9216  >>> is_fp(b)
9217  True
9218  >>> is_fp(b + 1.0)
9219  True
9220  >>> is_fp(Int('x'))
9221  False
9222  """
9223  return isinstance(a, FPRef)
9224 
9225 def is_fp_value(a):
9226  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 floating-point numeral value.
9227 
9228  >>> b = FP('b', FPSort(8, 24))
9229  >>> is_fp_value(b)
9230  False
9231  >>> b = FPVal(1.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9232  >>> b
9233  1
9234  >>> is_fp_value(b)
9235  True
9236  """
9237  return is_fp(a) and _is_numeral(a.ctx, a.ast)
9238 
9239 def FPSort(ebits, sbits, ctx=None):
9240  """Return a Z3 floating-point sort of the given sizes. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
9241 
9242  >>> Single = FPSort(8, 24)
9243  >>> Double = FPSort(11, 53)
9244  >>> Single
9245  FPSort(8, 24)
9246  >>> x = Const('x', Single)
9247  >>> eq(x, FP('x', FPSort(8, 24)))
9248  True
9249  """
9250  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9251  return FPSortRef(Z3_mk_fpa_sort(ctx.ref(), ebits, sbits), ctx)
9252 
9253 def _to_float_str(val, exp=0):
9254  if isinstance(val, float):
9255  if math.isnan(val):
9256  res = "NaN"
9257  elif val == 0.0:
9258  sone = math.copysign(1.0, val)
9259  if sone < 0.0:
9260  return "-0.0"
9261  else:
9262  return "+0.0"
9263  elif val == float("+inf"):
9264  res = "+oo"
9265  elif val == float("-inf"):
9266  res = "-oo"
9267  else:
9268  v = val.as_integer_ratio()
9269  num = v[0]
9270  den = v[1]
9271  rvs = str(num) + '/' + str(den)
9272  res = rvs + 'p' + _to_int_str(exp)
9273  elif isinstance(val, bool):
9274  if val:
9275  res = "1.0"
9276  else:
9277  res = "0.0"
9278  elif _is_int(val):
9279  res = str(val)
9280  elif isinstance(val, str):
9281  inx = val.find('*(2**')
9282  if inx == -1:
9283  res = val
9284  elif val[-1] == ')':
9285  res = val[0:inx]
9286  exp = str(int(val[inx+5:-1]) + int(exp))
9287  else:
9288  _z3_assert(False, "String does not have floating-point numeral form.")
9289  elif z3_debug():
9290  _z3_assert(False, "Python value cannot be used to create floating-point numerals.")
9291  if exp == 0:
9292  return res
9293  else:
9294  return res + 'p' + exp
9295 
9296 
9297 def fpNaN(s):
9298  """Create a Z3 floating-point NaN term.
9299 
9300  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9301  >>> set_fpa_pretty(True)
9302  >>> fpNaN(s)
9303  NaN
9304  >>> pb = get_fpa_pretty()
9305  >>> set_fpa_pretty(False)
9306  >>> fpNaN(s)
9307  fpNaN(FPSort(8, 24))
9308  >>> set_fpa_pretty(pb)
9309  """
9310  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9311  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_nan(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast), s.ctx)
9312 
9313 def fpPlusInfinity(s):
9314  """Create a Z3 floating-point +oo term.
9315 
9316  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9317  >>> pb = get_fpa_pretty()
9318  >>> set_fpa_pretty(True)
9319  >>> fpPlusInfinity(s)
9320  +oo
9321  >>> set_fpa_pretty(False)
9322  >>> fpPlusInfinity(s)
9323  fpPlusInfinity(FPSort(8, 24))
9324  >>> set_fpa_pretty(pb)
9325  """
9326  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9327  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_inf(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast, False), s.ctx)
9328 
9329 def fpMinusInfinity(s):
9330  """Create a Z3 floating-point -oo term."""
9331  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9332  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_inf(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast, True), s.ctx)
9333 
9334 def fpInfinity(s, negative):
9335  """Create a Z3 floating-point +oo or -oo term."""
9336  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9337  _z3_assert(isinstance(negative, bool), "expected Boolean flag")
9338  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_inf(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast, negative), s.ctx)
9339 
9340 def fpPlusZero(s):
9341  """Create a Z3 floating-point +0.0 term."""
9342  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9343  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_zero(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast, False), s.ctx)
9344 
9345 def fpMinusZero(s):
9346  """Create a Z3 floating-point -0.0 term."""
9347  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9348  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_zero(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast, True), s.ctx)
9349 
9350 def fpZero(s, negative):
9351  """Create a Z3 floating-point +0.0 or -0.0 term."""
9352  _z3_assert(isinstance(s, FPSortRef), "sort mismatch")
9353  _z3_assert(isinstance(negative, bool), "expected Boolean flag")
9354  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_fpa_zero(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast, negative), s.ctx)
9355 
9356 def FPVal(sig, exp=None, fps=None, ctx=None):
9357  """Return a floating-point value of value `val` and sort `fps`. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
9358 
9359  >>> v = FPVal(20.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9360  >>> v
9361  1.25*(2**4)
9362  >>> print("0x%.8x" % v.exponent_as_long(False))
9363  0x00000004
9364  >>> v = FPVal(2.25, FPSort(8, 24))
9365  >>> v
9366  1.125*(2**1)
9367  >>> v = FPVal(-2.25, FPSort(8, 24))
9368  >>> v
9369  -1.125*(2**1)
9370  >>> FPVal(-0.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9371  -0.0
9372  >>> FPVal(0.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9373  +0.0
9374  >>> FPVal(+0.0, FPSort(8, 24))
9375  +0.0
9376  """
9377  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9378  if is_fp_sort(exp):
9379  fps = exp
9380  exp = None
9381  elif fps is None:
9382  fps = _dflt_fps(ctx)
9383  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(fps), "sort mismatch")
9384  if exp is None:
9385  exp = 0
9386  val = _to_float_str(sig)
9387  if val == "NaN" or val == "nan":
9388  return fpNaN(fps)
9389  elif val == "-0.0":
9390  return fpMinusZero(fps)
9391  elif val == "0.0" or val == "+0.0":
9392  return fpPlusZero(fps)
9393  elif val == "+oo" or val == "+inf" or val == "+Inf":
9394  return fpPlusInfinity(fps)
9395  elif val == "-oo" or val == "-inf" or val == "-Inf":
9396  return fpMinusInfinity(fps)
9397  else:
9398  return FPNumRef(Z3_mk_numeral(ctx.ref(), val, fps.ast), ctx)
9399 
9400 def FP(name, fpsort, ctx=None):
9401  """Return a floating-point constant named `name`.
9402  `fpsort` is the floating-point sort.
9403  If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
9404 
9405  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
9406  >>> is_fp(x)
9407  True
9408  >>> x.ebits()
9409  8
9410  >>> x.sort()
9411  FPSort(8, 24)
9412  >>> word = FPSort(8, 24)
9413  >>> x2 = FP('x', word)
9414  >>> eq(x, x2)
9415  True
9416  """
9417  if isinstance(fpsort, FPSortRef) and ctx is None:
9418  ctx = fpsort.ctx
9419  else:
9420  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9421  return FPRef(Z3_mk_const(ctx.ref(), to_symbol(name, ctx), fpsort.ast), ctx)
9422 
9423 def FPs(names, fpsort, ctx=None):
9424  """Return an array of floating-point constants.
9425 
9426  >>> x, y, z = FPs('x y z', FPSort(8, 24))
9427  >>> x.sort()
9428  FPSort(8, 24)
9429  >>> x.sbits()
9430  24
9431  >>> x.ebits()
9432  8
9433  >>> fpMul(RNE(), fpAdd(RNE(), x, y), z)
9434  fpMul(RNE(), fpAdd(RNE(), x, y), z)
9435  """
9436  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9437  if isinstance(names, str):
9438  names = names.split(" ")
9439  return [FP(name, fpsort, ctx) for name in names]
9440 
9441 def fpAbs(a, ctx=None):
9442  """Create a Z3 floating-point absolute value expression.
9443 
9444  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9445  >>> rm = RNE()
9446  >>> x = FPVal(1.0, s)
9447  >>> fpAbs(x)
9448  fpAbs(1)
9449  >>> y = FPVal(-20.0, s)
9450  >>> y
9451  -1.25*(2**4)
9452  >>> fpAbs(y)
9453  fpAbs(-1.25*(2**4))
9454  >>> fpAbs(-1.25*(2**4))
9455  fpAbs(-1.25*(2**4))
9456  >>> fpAbs(x).sort()
9457  FPSort(8, 24)
9458  """
9459  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9460  [a] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a], ctx)
9461  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_abs(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
9462 
9463 def fpNeg(a, ctx=None):
9464  """Create a Z3 floating-point addition expression.
9465 
9466  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9467  >>> rm = RNE()
9468  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9469  >>> fpNeg(x)
9470  -x
9471  >>> fpNeg(x).sort()
9472  FPSort(8, 24)
9473  """
9474  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9475  [a] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a], ctx)
9476  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_neg(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
9477 
9478 def _mk_fp_unary(f, rm, a, ctx):
9479  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9480  [a] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a], ctx)
9481  if z3_debug():
9482  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression")
9483  _z3_assert(is_fp(a), "Second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9484  return FPRef(f(ctx.ref(), rm.as_ast(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
9485 
9486 def _mk_fp_unary_pred(f, a, ctx):
9487  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9488  [a] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a], ctx)
9489  if z3_debug():
9490  _z3_assert(is_fp(a), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9491  return BoolRef(f(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast()), ctx)
9492 
9493 def _mk_fp_bin(f, rm, a, b, ctx):
9494  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9495  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a, b], ctx)
9496  if z3_debug():
9497  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression")
9498  _z3_assert(is_fp(a) or is_fp(b), "Second or third argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9499  return FPRef(f(ctx.ref(), rm.as_ast(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), ctx)
9500 
9501 def _mk_fp_bin_norm(f, a, b, ctx):
9502  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9503  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a, b], ctx)
9504  if z3_debug():
9505  _z3_assert(is_fp(a) or is_fp(b), "First or second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9506  return FPRef(f(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), ctx)
9507 
9508 def _mk_fp_bin_pred(f, a, b, ctx):
9509  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9510  [a, b] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a, b], ctx)
9511  if z3_debug():
9512  _z3_assert(is_fp(a) or is_fp(b), "First or second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9513  return BoolRef(f(ctx.ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), ctx)
9514 
9515 def _mk_fp_tern(f, rm, a, b, c, ctx):
9516  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9517  [a, b, c] = _coerce_fp_expr_list([a, b, c], ctx)
9518  if z3_debug():
9519  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression")
9520  _z3_assert(is_fp(a) or is_fp(b) or is_fp(c), "Second, third or fourth argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9521  return FPRef(f(ctx.ref(), rm.as_ast(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast(), c.as_ast()), ctx)
9522 
9523 def fpAdd(rm, a, b, ctx=None):
9524  """Create a Z3 floating-point addition expression.
9525 
9526  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9527  >>> rm = RNE()
9528  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9529  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9530  >>> fpAdd(rm, x, y)
9531  fpAdd(RNE(), x, y)
9532  >>> fpAdd(RTZ(), x, y) # default rounding mode is RTZ
9533  x + y
9534  >>> fpAdd(rm, x, y).sort()
9535  FPSort(8, 24)
9536  """
9537  return _mk_fp_bin(Z3_mk_fpa_add, rm, a, b, ctx)
9538 
9539 def fpSub(rm, a, b, ctx=None):
9540  """Create a Z3 floating-point subtraction expression.
9541 
9542  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9543  >>> rm = RNE()
9544  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9545  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9546  >>> fpSub(rm, x, y)
9547  fpSub(RNE(), x, y)
9548  >>> fpSub(rm, x, y).sort()
9549  FPSort(8, 24)
9550  """
9551  return _mk_fp_bin(Z3_mk_fpa_sub, rm, a, b, ctx)
9552 
9553 def fpMul(rm, a, b, ctx=None):
9554  """Create a Z3 floating-point multiplication expression.
9555 
9556  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9557  >>> rm = RNE()
9558  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9559  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9560  >>> fpMul(rm, x, y)
9561  fpMul(RNE(), x, y)
9562  >>> fpMul(rm, x, y).sort()
9563  FPSort(8, 24)
9564  """
9565  return _mk_fp_bin(Z3_mk_fpa_mul, rm, a, b, ctx)
9566 
9567 def fpDiv(rm, a, b, ctx=None):
9568  """Create a Z3 floating-point division expression.
9569 
9570  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9571  >>> rm = RNE()
9572  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9573  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9574  >>> fpDiv(rm, x, y)
9575  fpDiv(RNE(), x, y)
9576  >>> fpDiv(rm, x, y).sort()
9577  FPSort(8, 24)
9578  """
9579  return _mk_fp_bin(Z3_mk_fpa_div, rm, a, b, ctx)
9580 
9581 def fpRem(a, b, ctx=None):
9582  """Create a Z3 floating-point remainder expression.
9583 
9584  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9585  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9586  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9587  >>> fpRem(x, y)
9588  fpRem(x, y)
9589  >>> fpRem(x, y).sort()
9590  FPSort(8, 24)
9591  """
9592  return _mk_fp_bin_norm(Z3_mk_fpa_rem, a, b, ctx)
9593 
9594 def fpMin(a, b, ctx=None):
9595  """Create a Z3 floating-point minimum expression.
9596 
9597  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9598  >>> rm = RNE()
9599  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9600  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9601  >>> fpMin(x, y)
9602  fpMin(x, y)
9603  >>> fpMin(x, y).sort()
9604  FPSort(8, 24)
9605  """
9606  return _mk_fp_bin_norm(Z3_mk_fpa_min, a, b, ctx)
9607 
9608 def fpMax(a, b, ctx=None):
9609  """Create a Z3 floating-point maximum expression.
9610 
9611  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9612  >>> rm = RNE()
9613  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9614  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9615  >>> fpMax(x, y)
9616  fpMax(x, y)
9617  >>> fpMax(x, y).sort()
9618  FPSort(8, 24)
9619  """
9620  return _mk_fp_bin_norm(Z3_mk_fpa_max, a, b, ctx)
9621 
9622 def fpFMA(rm, a, b, c, ctx=None):
9623  """Create a Z3 floating-point fused multiply-add expression.
9624  """
9625  return _mk_fp_tern(Z3_mk_fpa_fma, rm, a, b, c, ctx)
9626 
9627 def fpSqrt(rm, a, ctx=None):
9628  """Create a Z3 floating-point square root expression.
9629  """
9630  return _mk_fp_unary(Z3_mk_fpa_sqrt, rm, a, ctx)
9631 
9632 def fpRoundToIntegral(rm, a, ctx=None):
9633  """Create a Z3 floating-point roundToIntegral expression.
9634  """
9635  return _mk_fp_unary(Z3_mk_fpa_round_to_integral, rm, a, ctx)
9636 
9637 def fpIsNaN(a, ctx=None):
9638  """Create a Z3 floating-point isNaN expression.
9639 
9640  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9641  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9642  >>> y = FP('y', s)
9643  >>> fpIsNaN(x)
9644  fpIsNaN(x)
9645  """
9646  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_nan, a, ctx)
9647 
9648 def fpIsInf(a, ctx=None):
9649  """Create a Z3 floating-point isInfinite expression.
9650 
9651  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9652  >>> x = FP('x', s)
9653  >>> fpIsInf(x)
9654  fpIsInf(x)
9655  """
9656  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_infinite, a, ctx)
9657 
9658 def fpIsZero(a, ctx=None):
9659  """Create a Z3 floating-point isZero expression.
9660  """
9661  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_zero, a, ctx)
9662 
9663 def fpIsNormal(a, ctx=None):
9664  """Create a Z3 floating-point isNormal expression.
9665  """
9666  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_normal, a, ctx)
9667 
9668 def fpIsSubnormal(a, ctx=None):
9669  """Create a Z3 floating-point isSubnormal expression.
9670  """
9671  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_subnormal, a, ctx)
9672 
9673 def fpIsNegative(a, ctx=None):
9674  """Create a Z3 floating-point isNegative expression.
9675  """
9676  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_negative, a, ctx)
9677 
9678 def fpIsPositive(a, ctx=None):
9679  """Create a Z3 floating-point isPositive expression.
9680  """
9681  return _mk_fp_unary_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_is_positive, a, ctx)
9682 
9683 def _check_fp_args(a, b):
9684  if z3_debug():
9685  _z3_assert(is_fp(a) or is_fp(b), "First or second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9686 
9687 def fpLT(a, b, ctx=None):
9688  """Create the Z3 floating-point expression `other < self`.
9689 
9690  >>> x, y = FPs('x y', FPSort(8, 24))
9691  >>> fpLT(x, y)
9692  x < y
9693  >>> (x < y).sexpr()
9694  '(fp.lt x y)'
9695  """
9696  return _mk_fp_bin_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_lt, a, b, ctx)
9697 
9698 def fpLEQ(a, b, ctx=None):
9699  """Create the Z3 floating-point expression `other <= self`.
9700 
9701  >>> x, y = FPs('x y', FPSort(8, 24))
9702  >>> fpLEQ(x, y)
9703  x <= y
9704  >>> (x <= y).sexpr()
9705  '(fp.leq x y)'
9706  """
9707  return _mk_fp_bin_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_leq, a, b, ctx)
9708 
9709 def fpGT(a, b, ctx=None):
9710  """Create the Z3 floating-point expression `other > self`.
9711 
9712  >>> x, y = FPs('x y', FPSort(8, 24))
9713  >>> fpGT(x, y)
9714  x > y
9715  >>> (x > y).sexpr()
9716  '(fp.gt x y)'
9717  """
9718  return _mk_fp_bin_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_gt, a, b, ctx)
9719 
9720 def fpGEQ(a, b, ctx=None):
9721  """Create the Z3 floating-point expression `other >= self`.
9722 
9723  >>> x, y = FPs('x y', FPSort(8, 24))
9724  >>> fpGEQ(x, y)
9725  x >= y
9726  >>> (x >= y).sexpr()
9727  '(fp.geq x y)'
9728  """
9729  return _mk_fp_bin_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_geq, a, b, ctx)
9730 
9731 def fpEQ(a, b, ctx=None):
9732  """Create the Z3 floating-point expression `fpEQ(other, self)`.
9733 
9734  >>> x, y = FPs('x y', FPSort(8, 24))
9735  >>> fpEQ(x, y)
9736  fpEQ(x, y)
9737  >>> fpEQ(x, y).sexpr()
9738  '(fp.eq x y)'
9739  """
9740  return _mk_fp_bin_pred(Z3_mk_fpa_eq, a, b, ctx)
9741 
9742 def fpNEQ(a, b, ctx=None):
9743  """Create the Z3 floating-point expression `Not(fpEQ(other, self))`.
9744 
9745  >>> x, y = FPs('x y', FPSort(8, 24))
9746  >>> fpNEQ(x, y)
9747  Not(fpEQ(x, y))
9748  >>> (x != y).sexpr()
9749  '(distinct x y)'
9750  """
9751  return Not(fpEQ(a, b, ctx))
9752 
9753 def fpFP(sgn, exp, sig, ctx=None):
9754  """Create the Z3 floating-point value `fpFP(sgn, sig, exp)` from the three bit-vectors sgn, sig, and exp.
9755 
9756  >>> s = FPSort(8, 24)
9757  >>> x = fpFP(BitVecVal(1, 1), BitVecVal(2**7-1, 8), BitVecVal(2**22, 23))
9758  >>> print(x)
9759  fpFP(1, 127, 4194304)
9760  >>> xv = FPVal(-1.5, s)
9761  >>> print(xv)
9762  -1.5
9763  >>> slvr = Solver()
9764  >>> slvr.add(fpEQ(x, xv))
9765  >>> slvr.check()
9766  sat
9767  >>> xv = FPVal(+1.5, s)
9768  >>> print(xv)
9769  1.5
9770  >>> slvr = Solver()
9771  >>> slvr.add(fpEQ(x, xv))
9772  >>> slvr.check()
9773  unsat
9774  """
9775  _z3_assert(is_bv(sgn) and is_bv(exp) and is_bv(sig), "sort mismatch")
9776  _z3_assert(sgn.sort().size() == 1, "sort mismatch")
9777  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9778  _z3_assert(ctx == sgn.ctx == exp.ctx == sig.ctx, "context mismatch")
9779  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_fp(ctx.ref(), sgn.ast, exp.ast, sig.ast), ctx)
9780 
9781 def fpToFP(a1, a2=None, a3=None, ctx=None):
9782  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression from other term sorts
9783  to floating-point.
9784 
9785  From a bit-vector term in IEEE 754-2008 format:
9786  >>> x = FPVal(1.0, Float32())
9787  >>> x_bv = fpToIEEEBV(x)
9788  >>> simplify(fpToFP(x_bv, Float32()))
9789  1
9790 
9791  From a floating-point term with different precision:
9792  >>> x = FPVal(1.0, Float32())
9793  >>> x_db = fpToFP(RNE(), x, Float64())
9794  >>> x_db.sort()
9795  FPSort(11, 53)
9796 
9797  From a real term:
9798  >>> x_r = RealVal(1.5)
9799  >>> simplify(fpToFP(RNE(), x_r, Float32()))
9800  1.5
9801 
9802  From a signed bit-vector term:
9803  >>> x_signed = BitVecVal(-5, BitVecSort(32))
9804  >>> simplify(fpToFP(RNE(), x_signed, Float32()))
9805  -1.25*(2**2)
9806  """
9807  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9808  if is_bv(a1) and is_fp_sort(a2):
9809  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_bv(ctx.ref(), a1.ast, a2.ast), ctx)
9810  elif is_fprm(a1) and is_fp(a2) and is_fp_sort(a3):
9811  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_float(ctx.ref(), a1.ast, a2.ast, a3.ast), ctx)
9812  elif is_fprm(a1) and is_real(a2) and is_fp_sort(a3):
9813  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_real(ctx.ref(), a1.ast, a2.ast, a3.ast), ctx)
9814  elif is_fprm(a1) and is_bv(a2) and is_fp_sort(a3):
9815  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_signed(ctx.ref(), a1.ast, a2.ast, a3.ast), ctx)
9816  else:
9817  raise Z3Exception("Unsupported combination of arguments for conversion to floating-point term.")
9818 
9819 def fpBVToFP(v, sort, ctx=None):
9820  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression that represents the
9821  conversion from a bit-vector term to a floating-point term.
9822 
9823  >>> x_bv = BitVecVal(0x3F800000, 32)
9824  >>> x_fp = fpBVToFP(x_bv, Float32())
9825  >>> x_fp
9826  fpToFP(1065353216)
9827  >>> simplify(x_fp)
9828  1
9829  """
9830  _z3_assert(is_bv(v), "First argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
9831  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(sort), "Second argument must be a Z3 floating-point sort.")
9832  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9833  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_bv(ctx.ref(), v.ast, sort.ast), ctx)
9834 
9835 def fpFPToFP(rm, v, sort, ctx=None):
9836  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression that represents the
9837  conversion from a floating-point term to a floating-point term of different precision.
9838 
9839  >>> x_sgl = FPVal(1.0, Float32())
9840  >>> x_dbl = fpFPToFP(RNE(), x_sgl, Float64())
9841  >>> x_dbl
9842  fpToFP(RNE(), 1)
9843  >>> simplify(x_dbl)
9844  1
9845  >>> x_dbl.sort()
9846  FPSort(11, 53)
9847  """
9848  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression.")
9849  _z3_assert(is_fp(v), "Second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression.")
9850  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(sort), "Third argument must be a Z3 floating-point sort.")
9851  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9852  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_float(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, v.ast, sort.ast), ctx)
9853 
9854 def fpRealToFP(rm, v, sort, ctx=None):
9855  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression that represents the
9856  conversion from a real term to a floating-point term.
9857 
9858  >>> x_r = RealVal(1.5)
9859  >>> x_fp = fpRealToFP(RNE(), x_r, Float32())
9860  >>> x_fp
9861  fpToFP(RNE(), 3/2)
9862  >>> simplify(x_fp)
9863  1.5
9864  """
9865  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression.")
9866  _z3_assert(is_real(v), "Second argument must be a Z3 expression or real sort.")
9867  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(sort), "Third argument must be a Z3 floating-point sort.")
9868  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9869  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_real(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, v.ast, sort.ast), ctx)
9870 
9871 def fpSignedToFP(rm, v, sort, ctx=None):
9872  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression that represents the
9873  conversion from a signed bit-vector term (encoding an integer) to a floating-point term.
9874 
9875  >>> x_signed = BitVecVal(-5, BitVecSort(32))
9876  >>> x_fp = fpSignedToFP(RNE(), x_signed, Float32())
9877  >>> x_fp
9878  fpToFP(RNE(), 4294967291)
9879  >>> simplify(x_fp)
9880  -1.25*(2**2)
9881  """
9882  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression.")
9883  _z3_assert(is_bv(v), "Second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
9884  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(sort), "Third argument must be a Z3 floating-point sort.")
9885  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9886  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_signed(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, v.ast, sort.ast), ctx)
9887 
9888 def fpUnsignedToFP(rm, v, sort, ctx=None):
9889  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression that represents the
9890  conversion from an unsigned bit-vector term (encoding an integer) to a floating-point term.
9891 
9892  >>> x_signed = BitVecVal(-5, BitVecSort(32))
9893  >>> x_fp = fpUnsignedToFP(RNE(), x_signed, Float32())
9894  >>> x_fp
9895  fpToFPUnsigned(RNE(), 4294967291)
9896  >>> simplify(x_fp)
9897  1*(2**32)
9898  """
9899  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression.")
9900  _z3_assert(is_bv(v), "Second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
9901  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(sort), "Third argument must be a Z3 floating-point sort.")
9902  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9903  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_unsigned(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, v.ast, sort.ast), ctx)
9904 
9905 def fpToFPUnsigned(rm, x, s, ctx=None):
9906  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression, from unsigned bit-vector to floating-point expression."""
9907  if z3_debug():
9908  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression")
9909  _z3_assert(is_bv(x), "Second argument must be a Z3 bit-vector expression")
9910  _z3_assert(is_fp_sort(s), "Third argument must be Z3 floating-point sort")
9911  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9912  return FPRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_fp_unsigned(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, x.ast, s.ast), ctx)
9913 
9914 def fpToSBV(rm, x, s, ctx=None):
9915  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression, from floating-point expression to signed bit-vector.
9916 
9917  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
9918  >>> y = fpToSBV(RTZ(), x, BitVecSort(32))
9919  >>> print(is_fp(x))
9920  True
9921  >>> print(is_bv(y))
9922  True
9923  >>> print(is_fp(y))
9924  False
9925  >>> print(is_bv(x))
9926  False
9927  """
9928  if z3_debug():
9929  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression")
9930  _z3_assert(is_fp(x), "Second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9931  _z3_assert(is_bv_sort(s), "Third argument must be Z3 bit-vector sort")
9932  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9933  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_sbv(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, x.ast, s.size()), ctx)
9934 
9935 def fpToUBV(rm, x, s, ctx=None):
9936  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression, from floating-point expression to unsigned bit-vector.
9937 
9938  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
9939  >>> y = fpToUBV(RTZ(), x, BitVecSort(32))
9940  >>> print(is_fp(x))
9941  True
9942  >>> print(is_bv(y))
9943  True
9944  >>> print(is_fp(y))
9945  False
9946  >>> print(is_bv(x))
9947  False
9948  """
9949  if z3_debug():
9950  _z3_assert(is_fprm(rm), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point rounding mode expression")
9951  _z3_assert(is_fp(x), "Second argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9952  _z3_assert(is_bv_sort(s), "Third argument must be Z3 bit-vector sort")
9953  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9954  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_ubv(ctx.ref(), rm.ast, x.ast, s.size()), ctx)
9955 
9956 def fpToReal(x, ctx=None):
9957  """Create a Z3 floating-point conversion expression, from floating-point expression to real.
9958 
9959  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
9960  >>> y = fpToReal(x)
9961  >>> print(is_fp(x))
9962  True
9963  >>> print(is_real(y))
9964  True
9965  >>> print(is_fp(y))
9966  False
9967  >>> print(is_real(x))
9968  False
9969  """
9970  if z3_debug():
9971  _z3_assert(is_fp(x), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9972  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9973  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_real(ctx.ref(), x.ast), ctx)
9974 
9975 def fpToIEEEBV(x, ctx=None):
9976  """\brief Conversion of a floating-point term into a bit-vector term in IEEE 754-2008 format.
9977 
9978  The size of the resulting bit-vector is automatically determined.
9979 
9980  Note that IEEE 754-2008 allows multiple different representations of NaN. This conversion
9981  knows only one NaN and it will always produce the same bit-vector representation of
9982  that NaN.
9983 
9984  >>> x = FP('x', FPSort(8, 24))
9985  >>> y = fpToIEEEBV(x)
9986  >>> print(is_fp(x))
9987  True
9988  >>> print(is_bv(y))
9989  True
9990  >>> print(is_fp(y))
9991  False
9992  >>> print(is_bv(x))
9993  False
9994  """
9995  if z3_debug():
9996  _z3_assert(is_fp(x), "First argument must be a Z3 floating-point expression")
9997  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
9998  return BitVecRef(Z3_mk_fpa_to_ieee_bv(ctx.ref(), x.ast), ctx)
9999 
10000 
10001 
10002 #########################################
10003 #
10004 # Strings, Sequences and Regular expressions
10005 #
10006 #########################################
10007 
10008 class SeqSortRef(SortRef):
10009  """Sequence sort."""
10010 
10011  def is_string(self):
10012  """Determine if sort is a string
10013  >>> s = StringSort()
10014  >>> s.is_string()
10015  True
10016  >>> s = SeqSort(IntSort())
10017  >>> s.is_string()
10018  False
10019  """
10020  return Z3_is_string_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast)
10021 
10022  def basis(self):
10023  return _to_sort_ref(Z3_get_seq_sort_basis(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast), self.ctx)
10024 
10025 
10026 def StringSort(ctx=None):
10027  """Create a string sort
10028  >>> s = StringSort()
10029  >>> print(s)
10030  String
10031  """
10032  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
10033  return SeqSortRef(Z3_mk_string_sort(ctx.ref()), ctx)
10034 
10035 
10036 def SeqSort(s):
10037  """Create a sequence sort over elements provided in the argument
10038  >>> s = SeqSort(IntSort())
10039  >>> s == Unit(IntVal(1)).sort()
10040  True
10041  """
10042  return SeqSortRef(Z3_mk_seq_sort(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast), s.ctx)
10043 
10044 class SeqRef(ExprRef):
10045  """Sequence expression."""
10046 
10047  def sort(self):
10048  return SeqSortRef(Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10049 
10050  def __add__(self, other):
10051  return Concat(self, other)
10052 
10053  def __radd__(self, other):
10054  return Concat(other, self)
10055 
10056  def __getitem__(self, i):
10057  if _is_int(i):
10058  i = IntVal(i, self.ctx)
10059  return _to_expr_ref(Z3_mk_seq_nth(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), i.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10060 
10061  def at(self, i):
10062  if _is_int(i):
10063  i = IntVal(i, self.ctx)
10064  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_seq_at(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), i.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10065 
10066  def is_string(self):
10067  return Z3_is_string_sort(self.ctx_ref(), Z3_get_sort(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast()))
10068 
10069  def is_string_value(self):
10070  return Z3_is_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
10071 
10072 
10073  def as_string(self):
10074  """Return a string representation of sequence expression."""
10075  if self.is_string_value():
10076  string_length = ctypes.c_uint()
10077  chars = Z3_get_lstring(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), byref(string_length))
10078  return string_at(chars, size=string_length.value).decode('latin-1')
10079  return Z3_ast_to_string(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast())
10080 
10081  def __le__(self, other):
10082  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_str_le(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), other.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10083 
10084  def __lt__(self, other):
10085  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_str_lt(self.ctx_ref(), self.as_ast(), other.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10086 
10087  def __ge__(self, other):
10088  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_str_le(self.ctx_ref(), other.as_ast(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10089 
10090  def __gt__(self, other):
10091  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_str_lt(self.ctx_ref(), other.as_ast(), self.as_ast()), self.ctx)
10092 
10093 
10094 def _coerce_seq(s, ctx=None):
10095  if isinstance(s, str):
10096  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
10097  s = StringVal(s, ctx)
10098  if not is_expr(s):
10099  raise Z3Exception("Non-expression passed as a sequence")
10100  if not is_seq(s):
10101  raise Z3Exception("Non-sequence passed as a sequence")
10102  return s
10103 
10104 def _get_ctx2(a, b, ctx=None):
10105  if is_expr(a):
10106  return a.ctx
10107  if is_expr(b):
10108  return b.ctx
10109  if ctx is None:
10110  ctx = main_ctx()
10111  return ctx
10112 
10113 def is_seq(a):
10114  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 sequence expression.
10115  >>> print (is_seq(Unit(IntVal(0))))
10116  True
10117  >>> print (is_seq(StringVal("abc")))
10118  True
10119  """
10120  return isinstance(a, SeqRef)
10121 
10122 def is_string(a):
10123  """Return `True` if `a` is a Z3 string expression.
10124  >>> print (is_string(StringVal("ab")))
10125  True
10126  """
10127  return isinstance(a, SeqRef) and a.is_string()
10128 
10129 def is_string_value(a):
10130  """return 'True' if 'a' is a Z3 string constant expression.
10131  >>> print (is_string_value(StringVal("a")))
10132  True
10133  >>> print (is_string_value(StringVal("a") + StringVal("b")))
10134  False
10135  """
10136  return isinstance(a, SeqRef) and a.is_string_value()
10137 
10138 
10139 def StringVal(s, ctx=None):
10140  """create a string expression"""
10141  s = "".join(str(ch) if ord(ch) < 128 else "\\u{%x}" % (ord(ch)) for ch in s)
10142  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
10143  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_lstring(ctx.ref(), len(s), s), ctx)
10144 
10145 def String(name, ctx=None):
10146  """Return a string constant named `name`. If `ctx=None`, then the global context is used.
10147 
10148  >>> x = String('x')
10149  """
10150  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
10151  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_const(ctx.ref(), to_symbol(name, ctx), StringSort(ctx).ast), ctx)
10152 
10153 def Strings(names, ctx=None):
10154  """Return string constants"""
10155  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
10156  if isinstance(names, str):
10157  names = names.split(" ")
10158  return [String(name, ctx) for name in names]
10159 
10160 def SubString(s, offset, length):
10161  """Extract substring or subsequence starting at offset"""
10162  return Extract(s, offset, length)
10163 
10164 def SubSeq(s, offset, length):
10165  """Extract substring or subsequence starting at offset"""
10166  return Extract(s, offset, length)
10167 
10168 def Strings(names, ctx=None):
10169  """Return a tuple of String constants. """
10170  ctx = _get_ctx(ctx)
10171  if isinstance(names, str):
10172  names = names.split(" ")
10173  return [String(name, ctx) for name in names]
10174 
10175 def Empty(s):
10176  """Create the empty sequence of the given sort
10177  >>> e = Empty(StringSort())
10178  >>> e2 = StringVal("")
10179  >>> print(e.eq(e2))
10180  True
10181  >>> e3 = Empty(SeqSort(IntSort()))
10182  >>> print(e3)
10183  Empty(Seq(Int))
10184  >>> e4 = Empty(ReSort(SeqSort(IntSort())))
10185  >>> print(e4)
10186  Empty(ReSort(Seq(Int)))
10187  """
10188  if isinstance(s, SeqSortRef):
10189  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_seq_empty(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast), s.ctx)
10190  if isinstance(s, ReSortRef):
10191  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_empty(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast), s.ctx)
10192  raise Z3Exception("Non-sequence, non-regular expression sort passed to Empty")
10193 
10194 def Full(s):
10195  """Create the regular expression that accepts the universal language
10196  >>> e = Full(ReSort(SeqSort(IntSort())))
10197  >>> print(e)
10198  Full(ReSort(Seq(Int)))
10199  >>> e1 = Full(ReSort(StringSort()))
10200  >>> print(e1)
10201  Full(ReSort(String))
10202  """
10203  if isinstance(s, ReSortRef):
10204  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_full(s.ctx_ref(), s.ast), s.ctx)
10205  raise Z3Exception("Non-sequence, non-regular expression sort passed to Full")
10206 
10207 
10208 def Unit(a):
10209  """Create a singleton sequence"""
10210  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_seq_unit(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast()), a.ctx)
10211 
10212 def PrefixOf(a, b):
10213  """Check if 'a' is a prefix of 'b'
10214  >>> s1 = PrefixOf("ab", "abc")
10215  >>> simplify(s1)
10216  True
10217  >>> s2 = PrefixOf("bc", "abc")
10218  >>> simplify(s2)
10219  False
10220  """
10221  ctx = _get_ctx2(a, b)
10222  a = _coerce_seq(a, ctx)
10223  b = _coerce_seq(b, ctx)
10224  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_seq_prefix(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
10225 
10226 def SuffixOf(a, b):
10227  """Check if 'a' is a suffix of 'b'
10228  >>> s1 = SuffixOf("ab", "abc")
10229  >>> simplify(s1)
10230  False
10231  >>> s2 = SuffixOf("bc", "abc")
10232  >>> simplify(s2)
10233  True
10234  """
10235  ctx = _get_ctx2(a, b)
10236  a = _coerce_seq(a, ctx)
10237  b = _coerce_seq(b, ctx)
10238  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_seq_suffix(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
10239 
10240 def Contains(a, b):
10241  """Check if 'a' contains 'b'
10242  >>> s1 = Contains("abc", "ab")
10243  >>> simplify(s1)
10244  True
10245  >>> s2 = Contains("abc", "bc")
10246  >>> simplify(s2)
10247  True
10248  >>> x, y, z = Strings('x y z')
10249  >>> s3 = Contains(Concat(x,y,z), y)
10250  >>> simplify(s3)
10251  True
10252  """
10253  ctx = _get_ctx2(a, b)
10254  a = _coerce_seq(a, ctx)
10255  b = _coerce_seq(b, ctx)
10256  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_seq_contains(a.ctx_ref(), a.as_ast(), b.as_ast()), a.ctx)
10257 
10258 
10259 def Replace(s, src, dst):
10260  """Replace the first occurrence of 'src' by 'dst' in 's'
10261  >>> r = Replace("aaa", "a", "b")
10262  >>> simplify(r)
10263  "baa"
10264  """
10265  ctx = _get_ctx2(dst, s)
10266  if ctx is None and is_expr(src):
10267  ctx = src.ctx
10268  src = _coerce_seq(src, ctx)
10269  dst = _coerce_seq(dst, ctx)
10270  s = _coerce_seq(s, ctx)
10271  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_seq_replace(src.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast(), src.as_ast(), dst.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10272 
10273 def IndexOf(s, substr):
10274  return IndexOf(s, substr, IntVal(0))
10275 
10276 def IndexOf(s, substr, offset):
10277  """Retrieve the index of substring within a string starting at a specified offset.
10278  >>> simplify(IndexOf("abcabc", "bc", 0))
10279  1
10280  >>> simplify(IndexOf("abcabc", "bc", 2))
10281  4
10282  """
10283  ctx = None
10284  if is_expr(offset):
10285  ctx = offset.ctx
10286  ctx = _get_ctx2(s, substr, ctx)
10287  s = _coerce_seq(s, ctx)
10288  substr = _coerce_seq(substr, ctx)
10289  if _is_int(offset):
10290  offset = IntVal(offset, ctx)
10291  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_seq_index(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast(), substr.as_ast(), offset.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10292 
10293 def LastIndexOf(s, substr):
10294  """Retrieve the last index of substring within a string"""
10295  ctx = None
10296  ctx = _get_ctx2(s, substr, ctx)
10297  s = _coerce_seq(s, ctx)
10298  substr = _coerce_seq(substr, ctx)
10299  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_seq_last_index(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast(), substr.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10300 
10301 
10302 def Length(s):
10303  """Obtain the length of a sequence 's'
10304  >>> l = Length(StringVal("abc"))
10305  >>> simplify(l)
10306  3
10307  """
10308  s = _coerce_seq(s)
10309  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_seq_length(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10310 
10311 def StrToInt(s):
10312  """Convert string expression to integer
10313  >>> a = StrToInt("1")
10314  >>> simplify(1 == a)
10315  True
10316  >>> b = StrToInt("2")
10317  >>> simplify(1 == b)
10318  False
10319  >>> c = StrToInt(IntToStr(2))
10320  >>> simplify(1 == c)
10321  False
10322  """
10323  s = _coerce_seq(s)
10324  return ArithRef(Z3_mk_str_to_int(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10325 
10326 
10327 def IntToStr(s):
10328  """Convert integer expression to string"""
10329  if not is_expr(s):
10330  s = _py2expr(s)
10331  return SeqRef(Z3_mk_int_to_str(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10332 
10333 
10334 def Re(s, ctx=None):
10335  """The regular expression that accepts sequence 's'
10336  >>> s1 = Re("ab")
10337  >>> s2 = Re(StringVal("ab"))
10338  >>> s3 = Re(Unit(BoolVal(True)))
10339  """
10340  s = _coerce_seq(s, ctx)
10341  return ReRef(Z3_mk_seq_to_re(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10342 
10343 
10344 
10345 
10346 ## Regular expressions
10347 
10348 class ReSortRef(SortRef):
10349  """Regular expression sort."""
10350 
10351  def basis(self):
10352  return _to_sort_ref(Z3_get_re_sort_basis(self.ctx_ref(), self.ast), self.ctx)
10353 
10354 def ReSort(s):
10355  if is_ast(s):
10356  return ReSortRef(Z3_mk_re_sort(s.ctx.ref(), s.ast), s.ctx)
10357  if s is None or isinstance(s, Context):
10358  ctx = _get_ctx(s)
10359  return ReSortRef(Z3_mk_re_sort(ctx.ref(), Z3_mk_string_sort(ctx.ref())), s.ctx)
10360  raise Z3Exception("Regular expression sort constructor expects either a string or a context or no argument")
10361 
10362 
10363 class ReRef(ExprRef):
10364  """Regular expressions."""
10365 
10366  def __add__(self, other):
10367  return Union(self, other)
10368 
10369 def is_re(s):
10370  return isinstance(s, ReRef)
10371 
10372 
10373 def InRe(s, re):
10374  """Create regular expression membership test
10375  >>> re = Union(Re("a"),Re("b"))
10376  >>> print (simplify(InRe("a", re)))
10377  True
10378  >>> print (simplify(InRe("b", re)))
10379  True
10380  >>> print (simplify(InRe("c", re)))
10381  False
10382  """
10383  s = _coerce_seq(s, re.ctx)
10384  return BoolRef(Z3_mk_seq_in_re(s.ctx_ref(), s.as_ast(), re.as_ast()), s.ctx)
10385 
10386 def Union(*args):
10387  """Create union of regular expressions.
10388  >>> re = Union(Re("a"), Re("b"), Re("c"))
10389  >>> print (simplify(InRe("d", re)))
10390  False
10391  """
10392  args = _get_args(args)
10393  sz = len(args)
10394  if z3_debug():
10395  _z3_assert(sz > 0, "At least one argument expected.")
10396  _z3_assert(all([is_re(a) for a in args]), "All arguments must be regular expressions.")
10397  if sz == 1:
10398  return args[0]
10399  ctx = args[0].ctx
10400  v = (Ast * sz)()
10401  for i in range(sz):
10402  v[i] = args[i].as_ast()
10403  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_union(ctx.ref(), sz, v), ctx)
10404 
10405 def Intersect(*args):
10406  """Create intersection of regular expressions.
10407  >>> re = Intersect(Re("a"), Re("b"), Re("c"))
10408  """
10409  args = _get_args(args)
10410  sz = len(args)
10411  if z3_debug():
10412  _z3_assert(sz > 0, "At least one argument expected.")
10413  _z3_assert(all([is_re(a) for a in args]), "All arguments must be regular expressions.")
10414  if sz == 1:
10415  return args[0]
10416  ctx = args[0].ctx
10417  v = (Ast * sz)()
10418  for i in range(sz):
10419  v[i] = args[i].as_ast()
10420  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_intersect(ctx.ref(), sz, v), ctx)
10421 
10422 def Plus(re):
10423  """Create the regular expression accepting one or more repetitions of argument.
10424  >>> re = Plus(Re("a"))
10425  >>> print(simplify(InRe("aa", re)))
10426  True
10427  >>> print(simplify(InRe("ab", re)))
10428  False
10429  >>> print(simplify(InRe("", re)))
10430  False
10431  """
10432  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_plus(re.ctx_ref(), re.as_ast()), re.ctx)
10433 
10434 def Option(re):
10435  """Create the regular expression that optionally accepts the argument.
10436  >>> re = Option(Re("a"))
10437  >>> print(simplify(InRe("a", re)))
10438  True
10439  >>> print(simplify(InRe("", re)))
10440  True
10441  >>> print(simplify(InRe("aa", re)))
10442  False
10443  """
10444  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_option(re.ctx_ref(), re.as_ast()), re.ctx)
10445 
10446 def Complement(re):
10447  """Create the complement regular expression."""
10448  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_complement(re.ctx_ref(), re.as_ast()), re.ctx)
10449 
10450 def Star(re):
10451  """Create the regular expression accepting zero or more repetitions of argument.
10452  >>> re = Star(Re("a"))
10453  >>> print(simplify(InRe("aa", re)))
10454  True
10455  >>> print(simplify(InRe("ab", re)))
10456  False
10457  >>> print(simplify(InRe("", re)))
10458  True
10459  """
10460  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_star(re.ctx_ref(), re.as_ast()), re.ctx)
10461 
10462 def Loop(re, lo, hi=0):
10463  """Create the regular expression accepting between a lower and upper bound repetitions
10464  >>> re = Loop(Re("a"), 1, 3)
10465  >>> print(simplify(InRe("aa", re)))
10466  True
10467  >>> print(simplify(InRe("aaaa", re)))
10468  False
10469  >>> print(simplify(InRe("", re)))
10470  False
10471  """
10472  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_loop(re.ctx_ref(), re.as_ast(), lo, hi), re.ctx)
10473 
10474 def Range(lo, hi, ctx = None):
10475  """Create the range regular expression over two sequences of length 1
10476  >>> range = Range("a","z")
10477  >>> print(simplify(InRe("b", range)))
10478  True
10479  >>> print(simplify(InRe("bb", range)))
10480  False
10481  """
10482  lo = _coerce_seq(lo, ctx)
10483  hi = _coerce_seq(hi, ctx)
10484  return ReRef(Z3_mk_re_range(lo.ctx_ref(), lo.ast, hi.ast), lo.ctx)
10485 
10486 # Special Relations
10487 
10488 def PartialOrder(a, index):
10489  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_mk_partial_order(a.ctx_ref(), a.ast, index), a.ctx);
10490 
10491 def LinearOrder(a, index):
10492  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_mk_linear_order(a.ctx_ref(), a.ast, index), a.ctx);
10493 
10494 def TreeOrder(a, index):
10495  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_mk_tree_order(a.ctx_ref(), a.ast, index), a.ctx);
10496 
10497 def PiecewiseLinearOrder(a, index):
10498  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_mk_piecewise_linear_order(a.ctx_ref(), a.ast, index), a.ctx);
10499 
10500 def TransitiveClosure(f):
10501  """Given a binary relation R, such that the two arguments have the same sort
10502  create the transitive closure relation R+.
10503  The transitive closure R+ is a new relation.
10504  """
10505  return FuncDeclRef(Z3_mk_transitive_closure(f.ctx_ref(), f.ast), f.ctx)
10506 
10507 
10508 class PropClosures:
10509  def __init__(self):
10510  self.bases = {}
10511  self.lock = None
10512 
10513  def set_threaded():
10514  if self.lock is None:
10515  import threading
10516  self.lock = threading.thread.Lock()
10517 
10518  def get(self, ctx):
10519  if self.lock: self.lock.acquire()
10520  r = self.bases[ctx]
10521  if self.lock: self.lock.release()
10522  return r
10523 
10524  def set(self, ctx, r):
10525  if self.lock: self.lock.acquire()
10526  self.bases[ctx] = r
10527  if self.lock: self.lock.release()
10528 
10529  def insert(self, r):
10530  if self.lock: self.lock.acquire()
10531  id = len(self.bases) + 3
10532  self.bases[id] = r
10533  if self.lock: self.lock.release()
10534  return id
10535 
10536 _prop_closures = None
10537 
10538 def ensure_prop_closures():
10539  global _prop_closures
10540  if _prop_closures is None:
10541  _prop_closures = PropClosures()
10542 
10543 def user_prop_push(ctx):
10544  _prop_closures.get(ctx).push();
10545 
10546 def user_prop_pop(ctx, num_scopes):
10547  _prop_closures.get(ctx).pop(num_scopes)
10548 
10549 def user_prop_fresh(id, ctx):
10550  prop = _prop_closures.get(id)
10551  _prop_closures.set_threaded()
10552  new_prop = UsePropagateBase(None, ctx)
10553  _prop_closures.set(new_prop.id, new_prop.fresh())
10554  return ctypes.c_void_p(new_prop.id)
10555 
10556 def user_prop_fixed(ctx, cb, id, value):
10557  prop = _prop_closures.get(ctx)
10558  prop.cb = cb
10559  prop.fixed(id, _to_expr_ref(ctypes.c_void_p(value), prop.ctx()))
10560  prop.cb = None
10561 
10562 def user_prop_final(ctx, cb):
10563  prop = _prop_closures.get(ctx)
10564  prop.cb = cb
10565  prop.final()
10566  prop.cb = None
10567 
10568 def user_prop_eq(ctx, cb, x, y):
10569  prop = _prop_closures.get(ctx)
10570  prop.cb = cb
10571  prop.eq(x, y)
10572  prop.cb = None
10573 
10574 def user_prop_diseq(ctx, cb, x, y):
10575  prop = _prop_closures.get(ctx)
10576  prop.cb = cb
10577  prop.diseq(x, y)
10578  prop.cb = None
10579 
10580 _user_prop_push = push_eh_type(user_prop_push)
